reviewText: The best cat litter I have ever used, no dust and hardly any tracking and it clumps so well and there is no odor coming from the litter box at all. I am sold on this product.  My Persian quit using the litter box and as soon as I got Cat Attract litter, problem taken care of.  I would recommend this to anyone that has cats.

I purchased one of these for our dog and loved it so much that a couple years later, I purchased additional ones for our garage. We now store our chicken food and cat food in individual containers. In my most recent order, one of the items did arrive damaged and broken, but Amazon was prompt with replacement.

We purchased this to keep our dogs food in. It's very convenient and much easier than having to sift through a big bag. This container easily holds her 30lb bag of kibble with room to spare- in fact I'm betting almost an entire second bag would fit too. The wheels make it easy to move and we can store this in the pantry. It has kept the dog and 2 cats out of the food so far. I only wish we had opted for a smaller size to fit the pantry better, but I really can't complain.
This is a simple solution to dealing with a massive 44 pound bag of dog food. It has wheels and rolls right into the pantry! Perfect!
summary: Works great for holding big bags of dog food

reviewText: I like this container.  It's easy to set an entire bag of dog food inside.  It rolls into my pantry and easily rolls out when needed.  I wish it was sturdier but as long as I don't drop the bag in (set it down easily instead) it should hold up.  Air tight?  Maybe but the plastic has a lot of flex so no, it's not air tight when you move it around or do anything with it.  I do think it seals well enough to keep bug out and the smell contained when it is left alone.

I bought this container hoping to fit a 30lb bag of dog food inside. Unfortunately, only about 25lbs actually fits. However, the container is airtight and doesn't look cheaply made.If I could purchase it again, I would buy the next size up.

It is the third Iris container I have. One is for cat food. The other one is for my bread flour. This third one I needed for dog food. It is sturdy, it closes tight, and it holds a Costco-sized bag of dog food without any problems. Also, it is easy to move around on sturdy casters. Last but not least: it is still quality made in the USA. I am sure this will not be the last of Iris containers I buy. I am very happy with the purchase.
I use this to store my homemade laundry detergent. It's perfect. It is well constructed and holds up to the weight.

Love this food dispenser.  Only thing is it arrived in freezing temparatures and one of the wheels broke off right away.  Great for tight spaces and holds our 55lbs of dog food.  This is a definite must!
Love these for dog food. I have a number of dogs and have 3 of these for dog food/treats etc and they work wonderfully. It makes feeding dogs easy and the food is fresh. Am very pleased.
I needed something for my large cat food bags - 4 cats need LARGE.  This works great and (I assume since I don't eat it) keeps their 16 pound bag of cat food fresh.
summary: Great - Use it for Cat Food

reviewText: Love having this food container since it is a pain when you have large dogs and a lot of food.  this will hold more than a 40lb bag of your favorite food.  We are currently not using the wheels since the food container does not move very often.  My lab loves food and knows the sound when I open it, but will not try to get it open on his own.Food stays fresh but we do clean it out after every bag so that everything is fresh
Like the O ring and snap seal.Like the wheelsLike the Size. It holds a full large bag of dog food.Do get a scoop for it.Do buy some of the smaller sizes also, they are great for treats and such.

This item holds a 30lb dog food bag nearly perfectly. We chop the top off the dog food bag and slid it into the unit. When we get to the bottom we just toss the bag. We have four dogs so anything that makes feeding less of a chore is a big win and this certainly does that. We simply wheel it from the pantry to the counter and back again.
its a large container, it holds a lot of pet food. I use it for my dogs food. I love the size and the space saving design. Wishing it came with a scoop
summary: holds a lot of dog food, keeps it fresh.

reviewText: I bought this for cat food because it states that it holds 20# of dry food.I buy cat food in 18# bags and it only holds about 3/4 of the bag.  I have to roll up the balance and put it away until I've lowered the level in the container.It has a good seal and keeps the food fresh but they should have said that it holds 14 or 15# and I would have bought a larger size.
Purchased 2 containers, love it and would recommend the item to friends or anyone that needs a pet food container. Price was fair.
This bin is great and I store dry food in it right beside the stove in the kitchen. Takes up little to no room. Thanks!

I resisted getting this item because I was afraid it would be too low and my dogs would try to eat out of it while I was getting the food ready.  I have 11 dogs at my home right now (some rescue) and 7 that live upstairs and are at my side when I am getting food ready.  I did not want to have a training battle when I an busy getting food ready.  However, I haven't had that problem and this has been much easier than dumping a 30-34 lbs bag of food in it (that will fill it up) than try to break the bag dog into smaller containers.

I love this container for dog food - have been looking for one of these and this one is perfect! You could easily pour a 55lb bag of dog food in this, but I just slide the whole bag in and it fits with room to spare. I left the wheels off because I dont ever need to roll the container. It is air tight to keep the food fresh and any bugs out, yet easily opens with a one-handed flip of the latch. The material is sturdy, including the lid, but I would not "drop" the bag of food in especially if you have the wheels attached as I can imagine that kind of sudden impact on the bottom might damage it. The sides are not see-through which doesnt matter since I can easily check on the food level when I feed my dog every day. I am brain storming to think of other uses for these containers and now looking at some of the smaller sizes for other uses too! Love it!
summary: Exactly what I was looking for!

reviewText: container is made in a pretty heavy duty plastic, the hinge where the lid connects to the container is pretty weak, but aside from that, the rest is pretty well made. The lid has a strip of rubber/foam along the outside edge where it comes into contact with the lid of the container, which provides an airtight seal.Generally speaking, pretty easy to use and is as described.

Cat food storage solution.IRIS Airtight Pet Food Storage Container, 11 Quart, GreenOur curious kitty decided that her food bag in an extra large ziplock to deter ants was something to chew on when bored.  Needed to keep bag intact and ants unable to smell food.  This does the trick.  Just poured the food inside the container and snapped the lid shut.  Kitty has knocked it over, but not opened it.  And it's easier to use then the ziplock was!  Plastic isn't flimsy and the flip snap latch is holding up well on the hinged lid.

We have two, and we actually use them to store white and brown rice. They keep the rice fresh and safe from bugs and mice. We're actually considering ordering some more of them to hold other foods like cereal. Great product!
summary: We don't use these for pet food, but they work great!

reviewText: We keep our dog food in here and our dogs have not tried to attack it yet.  We do not use the wheels.  Also can't smell the food when the door is closed.
Good seal; no problems woith bugs in the food.  I keep it in the garage.  I like that you can see how much food is left; it helps to know when to re-purchase.Good capacity, too.

I'm guessing I could fit 2 large bags of food in here.  The lid is easy to open but closes tight enough that my dog can't push her way inside - though she is not one who knows how to open latches so YMMV.I'm giving this 4 stars instead of 5 because of the price.  And I think the price is in part due to the wheels.  I don't use the wheels.  I can't think of any reason anyone would want to be able to push their container of dog food around on wheels.  I've seen comments on how great the wheels are.  What exactly are these people doing?  It seems really strange to me.  Put the container in a corner, fill it up with food, and take the bowl over to it when you want to fill it.  Is that hard?  What happens when your dog figures out that if you push the container, it rolls around?  I want my dog to eat her food, not play with the container.I would have preferred a less expensive option that did not include the wheels that I threw out unopened.  Still, as a container it's great.
summary: Fits a LOT; what is the point of the wheels?

reviewText: We keep out snacks in this container so that there aren't any bugs sharing our food.
Bought this for my pet food.  Is perfect, and so much cheaper than the same type of container from a pet store.
Just as expected it holds dog food seals nicely and the casters on the bottom, although cheap, make it easy to move around if need be.
Perfect. We buy 30 pound bags of chow and they fit wonderful ly in this container. Nice container keeps food from getting stale. We put bag into unit. Bought two.

What can i say its a container. It is a little pricey (made in USA so don't mind to much) but its sturdy holds about 50ish Lbs of food. I simply got tired of keeping my dogs food in the bags all the time. Now i am able to pre mix the two foods he needs vary easily.
Love it and works great. Our German shepherd was using her long pointy snout to get the dog food bag unrolled and helping herself...ugh I have now put a stop to that lol

I recently started baking bread using the no-knead recipe. The bread is scrumptious, and all my friends and neighbors love it -- which means I have to stock up on flour. Costco offers a great deal on organic artisan bread flour, but you have to buy a 25lbs bag. That's not an issue since I've been going through massive amounts of flour lately, but proper storage is an issue: these bags are heavy, fragile and can be leaky.The IRIS container offers perfect storage for this 25lbs bag, with room to spare on the sides -- I also store my yeast, scale and dough hook in there, and it provides an airtight seal. With its convenient wheels, it rolls away in the pantry and I can pull it out easily when I need it.
summary: Good fit for a 25lbs bag of flour

reviewText: Good item, as describe. A bit smaller than I imagined, but it is 11 quarts as describe, I believe. It fit my 6 pounds of dry cat food and looks like it maaay even fit 10 (haven't tried a 10 pounder yet). It took a while for the item to ship out, but arrived in decent time when it did finally ship. Overall a good experience.

I owned one of these in Texas, but it got damaged in the move.  I haven't received these two yet, but since I've owned one before, I wanted two for my dog.  I have to mix two different dry dogfoods for her diet, so it will be great to have both bags emptied into these containers to make it much easier to scoop her food.  Storage is great too and I don't have to keep lifting the bags.

If I ever need another pet food container I will be purchasing this brand again! It's wonderful. Not only is it air tight, but the lid is very easy to open one-handed while you hold the dog food bowl in your other hand. I know that one complaint was that her cat knocked the storage container off the counter and it broke and all I can say is "Duhhhh, don't put the container on your counter." It should be on the floor in the pantry or elsewhere. It's very sturdy and holds an entire large bag of dog food. PERFECT!

Works better than storing cat food in the bag it comes in.I can wheel it from my entry closet into the kitchen where Ifill a large apothacary type jar which I keep on my counter.When this container is empty I just fill it again about everytwo weeks or more.

I just love this container for my dogs' 15lb bag of Royal Canin.  I put the bag itself into the container and then am able to keep the food airtight without trying to close a zip lock top which is difficult for my rheumatic hands.  Very pleased with this item.

This is a sturdy container that turned out to be the perfect solution for storing kitty litter. "7yy66p[`" - this was just typed by our kitten, the container's owner, it means, "excellent for kittens." The price was significantly lower than that of similar products at our local pet retailer.
ive been looking for a good dog food storage an i saw the great reviews an i recived it today. i like it its the right size to fit in my pantry.

I looked in several local stores for storage containers to keep our horse feed in the garage and be worry free of any bugs getting into the food.  These are perfect.  They are the right size, easy to move around because of the rollers, close tightly, can see the level of food and fit great against the wall.  These containers would be good to use for any pet food you want to keep the bugs out!
summary: Great Storage Item For Horse Feed

reviewText: Purcahsed for cat food and we are happy with this container.  Cheaper than we could get in store.  Would buy this again.
LOVE THE PRODUCT KEEPS THE DOG FOOD FRESH AND DON'T HAVE TO HAVE A BAG LYING AROUND LOOKS NICE
summary: IRIS AIR TIGHT FOOD STORAGE CONTAINER 60 QUART

reviewText: We bought this container to store our dog food a year ago.  We looked at the big pet stores and the containers were way too expensive.  This was much cheaper and better quality than more expensive containers.  We can easily dump a whole 40lb bag of kibble in this bad boy with room to spare.  The seal works great.  The wheels work well but they do not snap in tight, so one of them falls off every time I lift it off the ground.  Not a big deal since I rarely need to carry it anywhere, but seems like a flaw they could fix.  This was a great purchase and we also bought a smaller one for our cat food which we are equally happy with.
The see through design and rollers, and the large size make this item very handy - no more storing food bags and treats in empty cat litter containers.
Have stored both cat food and dog food in these and they do not seem to let air in.  Do what they are supposed to do.

With four cats and a Littermaid litter box, I go through a bit of cat litter. I used to buy Fresh Step brand in big tubs that had a removable lid that allowed me to scoop the litter easily. I can't find those big tubs anymore, just boxes. Pouring litter from a tiny spout in a 34-pound cardboard box is not easy and is an invitation for a spill.The answer was to buy a storage container for it that would be easy to move around yet would hold plenty of litter. I bought the IRIS Airtight Pet Food Storage Container, 33 Quart size for this and was very pleased with its capacity. I've been able to fit two 28-pound boxes of cat litter in this, plus a large scoop.I also like that the hinged lid lifts easily off, yet locks in place in front.The container is on four wheels, and this should make it easy to move around, yet one of the wheels keeps falling off. Unfortunately, I didn't notice this until it was too late to exchange it with Amazon, although their exchange policies are stellar.I did end up ordering another before I realized the wheel was broken on the first. I needed another to store bird and squirrel feed in the garage. Since this heavy-duty container locks so well, it has worked well to keep the feed dry and critter free in the garage. The second one has not had any issues with the wheels.I give it four stars instead of five because of the broken wheel. The price I paid for this was fair, but it wasn't cheap, and I wouldn't have expected the wheel to be so flimsy.
summary: Heavy duty container moves easily on wheels, locks well for storage

reviewText: It works great for dog food.  I like that it is clear so you can easily see how much you have left.  The lid is easy to operate, and secures seals well.  I wish it was a little bigger, but I am able to get nearly 50lbs of food in it.  I should have bought two.
This will easily hold about 50 # of premium cat food. I actually have 3-18# bags of different cat food for which I put the bag and all in the container. Keeps the ants out.
My bag of cat food fits in here perfectly.  No more ants getting into the food!The lid opens & closes very easily too.

I could only fit about 22 pounds of dog food in the 33 quart size without the bag. Different kibbles weigh differently so just keep that in mind when ordering so you can get the right size. I can fit a 15 pound bag of taste of the wild in easily, but the 30 pound bag was too big even though i had already poured about 1/4 of the bag out.

Nice locking capability.  Keep food fresh with a nice seal.  I also love that my dog can't (or hasn't yet) figured out how to open it.  It's a decent latch.  It holds 2 bags of 35lb food for me, but depending on the shape of your kibble, that might not be the case for you.  The wheels have held up and the hinges are great.  I have zero complaints!

I have 11 dogs, and packing around 40-50 lbs of dog food is an enormous chore for me. Yesterday, I bought more dog food, I rolled these Iris air tight containers right up the back of my vehicle, opened the bags of dog food, and poured the dog food straight into each container. I rolled the containers back under the car port and pushed one along the side of the house, easy breezy. No more muscling heavy bags of dog food around. I keep dog food in the house too, but I can't stand the smell of dog food. These Iris Airtight containers seals tightly, no more dog food odors. No more looking at unsightly opened bag of dog food, now the dog food looks nice and tidy inside this container and it keeps the dog food fresh until completely used up, and with the cost of dog food now a days, this is important. Access to the inside of the container has an easy open latch.The entire lid lifts up. It catches and holds the lid up automatically. The large opening makes access easy to scoop out dog food. I liked these containers so well, I ordered more to store hobby items, extra blankets, and it seals airtight so no mice or spiders can get inside. Living in the country, these two are a constant pest. For the price, excellent product. Love it.

This 11-12 quart container is exactly right for the size bags of cat food I buy--not the huge bags, but the eight pounders.  The profile is slim and unobtrusive and while I could wish it was sturdier, I think the unit will survive average domestic use.  The top locks securely, but isn't a nail breaker to get off; the latch just kind of rolls up.  The non-locking side is hinged which is nice for keeping everything together.I'm very pleased with this.  So, apparently, are the cats.

I love this thing. I have the 33 quart size, and it works prefect. I can fit a whole 20 pound bag and there's room for some more. It works out perfectly, because I can get a new bag and dump it all in without having to use up everything. It makes feeding my two dogs so much easier. Just open up the top and scoop out their food. Couldn't be easier.

Works as advertised.  Keeps the varmints out and the food in.  Easily hold 50# bag of food.  Not sure how air tight it is by I do recommend as a simple food storage unit.  The wheels add to the convenience.
Holds about 16 lbs. of any kind of food or seed. Different colored lids show what kind is in which container. Just right.
summary: Perfect for storing food for pets, birds, wild critters

reviewText: Perfectly holds a 30lb bag of Blue Buffalo, which is what I needed. The wheels are a nice touch too.

I bought this to keep my dogs 35 pound bag of Professional dog food in. It fits perfect and keeps it good for a long time. Just be careful when you drop the food or bag into the bottom of the container. It was shipped fast and It was at my house in 3 days. I am very happy with this product and would recommend it to anyone.
works perfectly well.  I keep a costco size 35lb bag of food in here and it stays fresh.

I have 3 dogs and have tried a few other bins before to store their food. This is by far the best. Latches easily, airtight and it's easy to get out the last few kibbles. The wheels are just an added bonus.
I bought this to fit in my pantry to store my dog's food and it's great.  I wish I got the size bigger to hold the whole 16 lb bag of dog food, but that's ok.  Very tightly sealed when closed.
Have 3 different types of food, and these store nicely and keep everything fresh.  It's nice to be able to roll them around without lifting, great deal too!

I use the 33 quart container to store 25-lb bags of organic whole wheat flour. I just lower the bag in gently and then close up the lid. It keeps the flour fresher longer, and makes it easy to shift around the kitchen to where I need it. I've never had a problem with it, and it has made my life so much easier.It worked so well, in fact, that I'm ordering another larger one to keep dog food in (which I guess is the original purpose) for our new dog!

I have these in an outdoor rubbermaid storage box. The IRIS Airtight Pet Food Container means I have double the protection for my 30 lb. bags of dry dog food. After years of use I've never had a problem with my dog food being kept safe from the elements. I do lock the outer storage box lid. I did not put the caster wheels on the container which makes it fit in the outdoor storage box perfectly. An awesome product that I recommend as perfect. I don't understand why others say that their dog food bags do not fit. I am buying standard dog food bags from Petco and there is still room enough to store what little is left of the last bag which is about empty.
summary: Safe and Secure, Container For My Dog Food Bags

reviewText: I ordered two of these bins to hold rice and flour for my kitchen.  I ordered these specific bins because they were air (and critter) tight.  I didn't want to attract unwanted "guests" to my food supplies.  I was very happy with the sturdiness and weight of this product.  It Appears that it will suit my purpose well and I am totally pleased.  I was unsure of the size of the container as it pertains to my storage needs, so in case you want to know, this size bin holds 100 pounds of longrain white rice.  I think it will hold about 100 pounds of flour as well, but I have put only 50 in it so far.  The wheels are holding up well, contrary to some of the other reviewers experiences with these wheeled bins.
great container but didnt hold my full 30lb bag but I have three of these and they are overall great. would jut recommend ordering little larger then you think you need.

Holds a 32-pound bag with room to spare.  Will hold more food if used without the original food bag.  Seals pretty well and does keep food fresher, though not sure about the "air-tight" claim.  Would like to see a version without the wheels for less.  Don't have ants so can't comment on this.

This is a heavy duty plastic container! The wheels glide very nicely, the lid locks great keeping my dogs food fresh, and it fits perfectly in our pantry. I have no idea why I didn't buy this sooner, but you won't be disappointed!
summary: Why didn't I buy this sooner?

reviewText: If you have a space to roll this into (or not - I keep it in the downstairs bathtub), it's very convenient.  It holds an entire 28 lbs bag of dog food and keeps it from going stale.  I have a smaller one that I use for cat food that I role in and out of a linen closet, and the convenience of the rollers cannot be overstated.
This container works perfectly for a 30 pound bag of dog food. I love that it's on wheels and skinny, making it easy to store in limited space and roll out to access the food.

I use the 11 quart container and it holds the entire contents of a bag ofNewman's Own Organics Advanced Dog Formula for Active or Senior Dogs, 12.5-Pound Bagwhich I also get on Amazon. It's airtight and keeps the food fresh. It also keeps our dog from getting at the food (like she did a couple of times when we kept it in the bag).The cons: the plastic is lightweight and I'm afraid that one day it will start to crack, but I've had this container now for almost a year and it's still fine so maybe my worry is unfounded. A bigger complaint is that it is hard to pick up. See, there is a hold for your hand in the back part right under the green lid. However, if you try to hold the front in that same section, you are actually right under the latch and the latch has come undone for me several times as I am trying to pick it up and spilled kibble everywhere. It is possible to hold it underneath the latch, you just have to be REALLY careful. It's opened a couple of times even as I was being careful with it. That can get annoying.However, for the price, this product is great. The latch thing is a minor annoyance because I don't have to move it that often (about once a month when I refill the food). Otherwise, it's a solid product and I love using it!

Keeps the food enclosed and away from bugs (and our overeating cat who fancies dog food too).  Wheels are convenient for moving around and sweeping up around the container.I imagine if my dog could talk he would tell me that his food stays fresh, but he doesn't talk.Purchased a few months ago, but I feel was a good value for the price.
summary: Simple, sturdy, stores food as described.

reviewText: Just what we needed for our dog food. Ended up buying a second one because it worked so well. Good purchase. Second purchase was the newer model though. Worth exploring, didnt know it existed originally. Look for the IRIS premuim.

Since my dog's food is sold in pounds, not quarts, I had no idea how big of a container I would need. It also couldn't be too big, as the contained needed to fit snugly underneath our kitchen sink. I purchased the 21-23 quart container, and it suited my needs perfectly. It fit about 15-20 lbs of dog kibble (depending on what brand you purchase) and I also keep a measuring cup right in the bucket.The construction was surprisingly thick plastic, and has withstood multiple daily uses for the past year. The lid still locks firmly even though it is a plastic on plastic lock, so there hasn't been any rounding from constant usage. There's a foam gasket in the lid to make the container more airtight, and it seems to keep the food fresh for the 3-4 weeks it lasts me (I haven't tasted it to check for staleness, but the pup has not filed any complaints).Bottom line: Perhaps a little more expensive than just getting a cheap plastic bin from a store, but the quality and convenience make this a good value. Having a locking lid that flips open and closed is more convenient to me than a separate lid with locking points all around the rim. Seems to keep the food quite fresh thanks to the gasket and has shown no signs of wear after a year of usage.
summary: 21-23 quart holds about 15-20 lbs of kibble.

reviewText: This is such a great holder. It took 30 seconds to put the wheels on and attach the lid. I did wash it out good since there was a dead bug in it. It fit a 30 pound bag of dog food and I was able to leave the food in the original bag to keep the container clean. I received this within 3 days of ordering it! I would consider getting another one for alternative storage as well. Thanks Amazon!

I really like the way this container seals.  It is perfect size for the bag of food I buy.  I have several different foods I feed and have several of this size container.  Easy to lift when full, easy to place side by side for easy distribution at feeding time.
Purchased this for pet food. Love the fact it is air tight and moisture proof and that it is on wheels. Great way to store food to keep it fresh.

I love this container for dog food. I can buy large bags and not worry if it will stay fresh, saving me money. It's also very convenient b/c I just keep a scoop in it and it also rolls easily when I clean my floors. It's not flimsy and actually my cats enjoy sitting on it.

These are airtight and roll easily, even full of dog food. I have several of them in different sizes and the quality is great. It's quick and easy to open and close. I highly recommend them. They're far superior to most pet food storage containers.

I purchased this as a storage container for my dry dog food. Unfortunately, when I removed it from the box, one of the wheels was already broken and the exterior of the container was scratched like it had been used for months prior to its arrival. I honestly would have been ok with the scratches but I had to send it back because I could not fix the wheel. I was apprehensive about buying another one online, so I didn't and instead I chose buy a different one from one of the big box stores in our area.
It is perfect, holds close to 60 pounds of dog food.

This will work fine because it will hold all of the 50-pound bag of dog food that I purchase to store for my 4 dogs.  It also  rolls to spot to spot  with wheels that are included.  I love the container.

I use this one to hold salt so when it rains freezing rain or snow and it starts to freeze to ice, I can open this puppy up, use a small scoop and toss salt around. I use other models to store dog / cat food in my room so I can feed the pets without having to walk out to the garage to get a scoop of food. Plus I use the largest one to hold the dog food in the garage.I used to just open the bags and then try and scrunch them shut, but I noticed the food was drying out so I got one of these and now the food stays moist just like you opened it up right then.IRIS Airtight Pet Food Container, Navy Blue, 69 Quarts

I bought the 21-23qt for cat food and 45-47qt for dog food. The 21-23qt holds a 16lb bag of friskies just fine, and the 45-47qt almost holds a 44lb of dog chow with a little left over (especially since I tend to add a new one before the old is completely gone). But I have 3 dogs so the left over is usually gone within a day or two.It holds the smell in as well, as I haven't had any problems with any of the pets trying to eat their way through, and let me tell you my pets act like they haven't had a meal in years and WILL get into food.I love that the large 45-47qt has rollers so I can easily bring it to the dogs' bowls and fill them without breaking my back. Careful filling it with a 40+lb bag by yourself, as it tends to try to roll away!Perfect for my needs!

I put a 7 lb bag of dry cat food in the 11 quart container and it stores it well and keeps it fresh. The 7 lb bag keeps the container about 3/4, so it fits just fine. My only issue with the product is that it doesn't pour easily, so you definitely have to use a cup or something to scoop the food out of the container. However, that's not a big deal, and it's a very good product overall.

I use this to keep my cat's cat food in so he can't get to it, as he will try to eat through the bag if I just leave it in there. It also is very airtight so it keeps bugs away, and the food doesn't go stale!
This is perfect.  The size is perfect for dog food.  I would buy again.  It lasts forever.  The quality is great.  I would buy again.
I love it..I need to order another...it was priced a bit high though.Delivery was super fast.Item seals tight for safe dog food storage.

Bought this to store our cat's food. Discovered a 10 pound bag of cat food fits perfectly inside the container. The lid is easy to open and to re-seal. And I love the color of the green lid. This container works great while looking good.Recommend.
My tricky dogs can't get this open. They can, however, roll it around the kitchen. It also keeps the food fresh.
This holds a fairly large bag of dog food - enough for two pugs for one month.  It fits into a narrow cabinet.  Very convenient.

we got the 47-quart capacity container and it holds a 40 lb bag of dog food just perfectly. almost too perfectly...if you constantly buy 40 pound bags, maybe consider the next size up so you don't have to wait until the last minute to refill (because 40 pounds fits just right, you have to wait til its literally out of all food). so far it's been great for us, but in retrospect, i might have gotten the bigger one. great container though, lid opens easy, it holds up, locks freshness in, and keeps the dog food smell inside where it belongs.
Just wish the seal felt tighter.  It seems to be airtight, I just would like to hear some type of snap to be sure it is closed.  It rolls well and easily hold a full size dog food bag from Costco.
GREAT PRICE.  I BOUGHT THIS TO KEEP PET FOOD IN.  IT HAS A NICE TIGHT SEAL AND AN EASY OPEN FLIP HANDLE.  DEFINITELY A GOOD BUY.

We use it to keep our dog food fresh and prevent bugs from getting to it. It also helps prevent the kitchen area from smelling like dog food.We don't have the wheels installed so I don't know how well they work.Definitely recommend this product!

This Iris pet food storage container was purchased to replace a previous smaller one. The smaller one had been a bit small for holding a large 35# bag of dog food. We keep the dog food in the original bag, so we had to make the bag "skinny enough" to fit the bag into the skinnier storage container. (Maybe we really don't have to keep the food in the bags, but we do anyway.) As some others have noted, the wheels can break off when the container has a heavy weight dumped into it.  This is what happened to our smaller container when I was trying to "slam" the big bag of dog food into the too-skinny space. (I had always been successful before, but was not careful enough this last time.) So, when the wheels break off, it is impossible to re-attach them. You can still use the container by removing the wheels, though. So, we will use our skinnier container for containing dog food in our RV.  These Iris containers had previously been available through pet supply stores, but these stores now carry different brands.  We have two other Iris containers that we wanted to match in height and style (cat food, bird food).These air tight containers are invaluable for keeping dogs out of their food, and also for keeping any moths or insects contained-- as, these critters occasionally infiltrate/infest birdseed and pet foods and will infiltrate your house (we've had much experience with this).  The Iris containers work fine. In normal use, the wheels will not break off.

This is a great storage container to keep dog food from going stale. The sides and lid seem very durable and have been using it for a year without any problems. The casters seem a little weak for the amount of weight it has to support when full, but as long as you're not using it to bobsled you should be fine!

I bought the IRIS pet food container because it's air tight and has wheels.  33 Quarts is good for the 17 pound bag of dog food we have.  The label says it can hold 25+ pounds of cat food, 26+ pounds of dog food, or 44+ pounds of bird seed.The wheels role smoothly, the lid fits snugly.  There's a latch on one side and a hinge on the other, so the lid stays attached and open when I'm scooping out food.  Works great.

These food containers are a great bargain and are airtight. They keep pet food fresh longer and bugs out. Unlike others, I do not dump my dog's food in these (I have two, one for Royal Canin and one for Bil-Jac). I put the entire bag in the container. This makes clean up and swapping out/refilling easier.I like the airtight handle and after almost a year of use, the first one I bought is still like new. The wheels make it easy to roll this in and out of other rooms. These containers do have a plastic smell that I tried to air out, but it's still there. It's not an unpleasant smell so it's not too bothersome--my lab still eats his food.This is a must have if you keep dog food and want it to stay fresh. 30-35lb. bags of dog food fit well in these.
summary: Keeps Pet Food Fresh and Pest Free

reviewText: Well made. does a good job,& you dont have a bag laying around!!If you have a dog ,buy one !

Ordered 2 of the 23qt for 15lb bags of dog food. It says it will hold 20lb but the 15lb barely fits. I saw a review that said they put in 30lbs, I don't know how. Nice container with a lid that flips up on one side & snaps shut.

We got this to store our 2 dogs food instead of a ripped open bag that was always falling over somehow. It fits the large bag of food great! And we can roll it from the back of the closet to the front easily. Love it!

We bought this because our cat liked to get into our other container. This container is well built and seems to be fairly adorable. The lid has a nice hinge on the rear of it and they Latcha on the front to keep everything tight and seal. On top of that inside of the lid is an O-ring that will match up against the whip of the container to keep the food fresh inside. This container fits a full bag of cat food with just enough room to put a little scooping cup in the top. Highly recommend this container.
This is exactly what I needed for keeping my dogs' food dry and secure on the back porch!  It holds 50 pounds of food with no problem, and closes securely enough that they can't get into it.

I bought this 21-23 quart container for my dog's 35 lb. bag of dog food. A mathematician I am not. So, the food didn't fit, but I liked the container so much I wasn't about to send it back. It is now my new, and best, kitchen trash container. The seal is so strong, I can't smell a thing. Trash bags fit nicely and the container fits perfectly under the counter. If I had more room in my kitchen, I'd leave it out because it's cute and sleek. As for my dog's food, I bought the 30-33 quart IRIS (see review).

I spent months searching for a food container to store my dog's food in. I could not find a container that fit all of my criteria. I decided to order this product from Amazon and see if it worked for me. So far, so good! I am very pleased with the item that arrived and here's why:- You can see the food through the container. At a glance I know how much food my dog has and when it's time to refill.- It holds a little over 30 lbs. of kibble. (I believe the last bag I bought was 33 lbs. and it fit perfectly).- Despite holding over 30 lbs. of kibble it takes up little space, which is important to me as I have a tiny kitchen.- The wheels on the bottom of the container make moving the container (even when full) around my house a breeze. Now I can scoot the container out of the way to clean.- The wide opening at the top of the container made mixing kibbles while switching brands of kibble easier.- Reasonably priced. In my experience, it is often cheaper than the food containers you can find in pet stores.- This container has done a fantastic job of keeping insects like ants out of the kibble. After losing $60 worth of kibble to an ant invasion, I REALLY appreciate this!- In addition to holding 33 lbs. of kibble, this container has no problem holding a 9 lb. snoozing cat atop the lid.The one downside I've found is that larger bags of kibble may not fit in the container **while still in the bag** due to the shape of the container. The big bags of kibble will get stuck a few inches from the bottom. If the bag is new and full the container may not close. So if you're planning on buying a 30+ lb. bag of kibble and you don't want to toss the bag, you might want to go a size up in containers. Otherwise, dump the kibble into the container and ditch the bag. (If you're worried about keeping track of when the food expires, try copying the expiration date from the bag onto a sticker. Put the sticker on the outside of the container.)
summary: This food container is exactly what I was looking for

reviewText: This is the perfect sized container for my dog's food.  I have a 15lb border terrier, and I buy a 13lb bag of food each time and can drop the whole thing in there (including the bag).  It's a perfect fit.  The lid seals the food up pretty good and it's easy to open and close.  I was skeptical at first when seeing how the latch was online, with the molded connectors on the back, but it's  pretty solid.

I love this thing - I purchased two smaller ones last year and use one for dog food and another for bird feed.  They're air tight and sturdy.  I believe these are 33qt size - they're about 11" in width so they fit nicely, side by side, in the area I had available for them.This is the larger size and I'm using for our picnic supplies at our pavilion.  It's not going to rust from being outdoors, it's air tight so it will keep napkins, paper towels, plates, etc. clean and dry and it rolls across the cement floor with ease!All in all, it's worth the $25 to me.  It provides clean and secure storage, the wheels can be removed if you're not going to roll it in and out of it's hiding place -- and it's much better than having a loose bag of dog or bird feed falling all over.My next one will be for rice and flour/sugar.  I purchase the large bags and can store them easily inside these containers.  Of course I wouldn't dump these out into the container, but secure the opened bag and place inside.  Then scoop out what I need to refill my containers in the kitchen.

We got this to keep my dog's pet food in because the bag kept falling over in the closet. It was just generally a pain. I really like this tub since we got it. It's compact and sturdy, and the wheels are an added bonus. It's easy to pull out to sweep out the closet! It seems like this is cleaner, too, because it's airtight. No chance of bugs! Great price for the size and quality. Highly recommend!
summary: Sturdy and compact. Perfect for a closet!

reviewText: I needed an airtight storage container for my dog's food. I have a 100 lb Great Pyrenees, who eats Pro Plan Giant Breed formula. The largest size canister holds 1-34lb bag of kibble, with only a little room to spare. It would hold more if your dog eats smaller kibble. The Pro Plan Giant Breed is huge, and takes up more space. The airtight seal is great and the wheels were super easy to attach. It slides around the garage easily, even full of food. Still a great canister for dog food, no matter what size, although I would suggest a smaller canister if you have smaller pets so the food stays fresher. Overall, great purchase and I'm very happy with it.
summary: Exactly what I was looking for

reviewText: I was iffy on buying this product because I didn't want to spend that much on a "big tupperware container,"  but it has proven to be worth every penny.  We have 2 large dogs so we wanted a dog food container that would hold a very large quantity of dog food (about 35 lb.) and keep it sealed from little critters so we could store it in the garage.  This does all that, plus it's very sturdy.  We recently moved to another state and I was almost expecting it to break in the process, but I was glad to be wrong.  We had to get the container out when we'd get to hotels and then load it back up for travel.  This held up without any cracks or breaks...or really any sign of wear at all.  Plus, the casters are great so you can store it under a table or something and pull it out easily even when it's full.
summary: Big and Sturdy, Worth the price

reviewText: I don't know why I didn't buy this before!  The dog food was always spilling in the garage, sitting there open.  This completely solved our problem.  The lip opens up in such a convenient way.  I ordered the biggest size in order to fit the dog food in there which is only 35lbs as well as pig ear and other treats in there.  This is must if you have a dog!
This was perfect to hold my dogs 28 pounds of dry dog food. You can put the wheels on or leave them off. It's always nice to have an option.

I purchased this for my English bullies dog food. We buy him two 35 pound bags of dog food every couple of months and it's so simple to just roll this out of the closet & fill it up. I absolutely love the top because it pops up and down with ease. I also love the price! Every where else I have looked, I've seen dog food containers for much more money. And this container fits my budget & life style! :)

I was looking for a good, airtight dogfood container for my pet. This was the perfect solution. I bought the Airtight Food Container keeps Dry Pet Food Fresh 45-47 QT (Holds up to 35 # Dog / Cat food) - this is according to the Product Description.I buy Life's Abundance Premium Health Food for Puppies & Adult Dogs in a 40 lb. bag. The entire bag just barely fit into the bin, but it did fit. Also, when I put together the bin, I didn't put the wheels on it. Some reviewers said the wheels would occasionally break. Since I don't need to move the bin, I just didn't install them.The container has a nice seal, my dog can't knock it over and open it. (I have a pug that LOVES food.) My bag of food fits perfectly. I couldn't be more happy.
This is the second one of these I have bought.  They hold just the right amount, about a 10lb bag, are airtight and they stack.

I shopped for a dog food container at a local pet discount store, and they wanted over $30 for small ones. This is just what I needed for the 35# bags of food I buy, a good price, and easy to move around. It fits in my pantry out of the way. I'm very pleased to have found it, and the food stays fresh, and the pantry does not smell like dog food.

The specifications state (15 x 17.9 x 22.2 inches). With the wheels, it measures 24.25 in height. Of course it will not slide into my pantry at that height.Now I either place it outside in an unsightly plain-view position or drag it in and out of the pantry. I will bet in a few months that the unit breaks after pushing and pulling since the plastic is sort of brittle. The corners of the wheels are flimsy and not engineered well enough for the added stress of daily maneuvering where the wheels attach to the unit.Seriously, pass this if you are on the bubble of a decision.
summary: Improper dimensions and brittle cheaper plastics

reviewText: This has worked well for us. the 30-33 qt container easily holds a 20lb bag of dog food. I pour the food in so not sure how well it would fit if you tried to jam the bag in there. Wheels make it so convenient and easy to slide in and out of pantry as needed.
summary: Works well. Much nicer way to store dog food

reviewText: So far it's living up to expectations though the foam seal seems flimsy and I know that if I were to dump a large bag in, I run the risk of a crack. The wheels are nice and makes keeping this container in a tight space manageable.
This locks well, but is easy for a person to open. It holds about 3 medium-sized bags of kibble, or one of those enormous bags. I'm pleased with the purchase.

It's big enough to just put the entire 8.5lb bag of catfood into it. Keeps the food nice and fresh. Haven't had any ant problems and my cat isn't the food-bin-mauling type, so can't really say how durable it is. Haven't attached the wheels, so can't really tell you how well they work either. Overall, it works well enough for my purposes.

This is a great storage bin for dog food.  We actually didn't pour out the food, in an effort to keep the container cleaner, but instead just put the opened bag inside.  It works very well.  This also allows us to keep a bag of treats inside too.  The container seals well and moves quite easily.  We only store a 20 lb bag of food inside and a small bag of treats, but there is plenty of room for more.  I would highly recommend this for anyone that needs to store a large bag of pet food.

Seems sturdy and works great for storing my pet food.  I needed something that the animals couldn't get into, and this worked great.  The wheels fit very easily and make moving this product around very easy.
I bought this to store my Dog's food in. Keeps her food fresh and keeps out the insects. Works well. Fits a 15 pound bag of food well.
summary: Iris Pet Food Storage Container 23, Quart

reviewText: smells like mineral spirits. looks like a aerosal can , but is actually a screw on top bottle. I pour about 1/2 cup in dish and run the blades in the wash while turned on. keeps the blades sharp, clean, and lubed. overall, good product.

This product serves its purpose. It cleans the blades well. However, I would rather have the 3 in 1 product that lubricates, cleans, and cools. It is virtually the same price and serves 3 purposes. It is also made by Oster. Check that one out instead.
summary: Ok Product; Better Ones Out There

reviewText: I clip my own dog and it is very important to clean the blades I use each time after clipping.  This product works just great.  Pkg arrived in excellent condition.
I've tried others.  This cools the blade fast and keeps it sharp while cutting animals whose fur is not as combed out as I would like.

I have 2 goldendoodles and have to save money by grooming them myself.  After investing in an Oster clipper I realized I didn't have any way to clean it after grooming all that doodlefur.  I pour a small amount of this blade wash into a dish and run my clippers in it when I've finished grooming.  All the little fur pieces seem to come out of the clipper blades.  I hope that by using this blade wash I will extend the life of my blades & my clippers.
summary: It seems to do the job it was hired to do

reviewText: I have an Andis electric groomer for my 2 Bichons.  I require 3-4 different blades during the groom. When grooming is done, cleaning my blades with a little of this in a small rectangler bowl cleans them of all hair and debris.
summary: Andis and Oster clipper blade cleaner

reviewText: I have used this blade wash for years. It used to come in more of an oblong can. I remember reading that this is a pour-can so that feedback was very helpful. It is deceiving that it looks like a spray. My can came dented but still pours just fine!

Use this after clipping my hairy dog and it cleans those blades good!  I love being able to get all the hair out of them.  Every time I open it I'm surprised it's not aerosol, though!  Odd design on the can!

This stuff works great at cooling the blades and keeping the pups happy.  Great for use while cutting.  They seem to keep my blades in great shape and condition.  Like I stated, it's great for quickly cooling off and lubricating the blade during a grooming session with my pups.
Use this to clean our dog clippers during and after grooming. Also helps cool the blade off to keep from getting too hot.

I purchased this product because the other reviewers raved about it. it smells very good, like a lemon scent. it lubes the blade very well also, however, it didn't seem to cool off my oster too much. maybe because I was using it non-stop for 4 hours. in any case, it did help with keeping the blades nice. would I buy another bottle? probably.
use clippers a lot this oil keeps the blades cool and lubed and isn't too strong though there is some odor.
If you purchase a set of Pet Hair Clippers, you need to purchase this product as well. It serves three purposes and replaces multiple products. A must have for your home grooming needs.
summary: Lubricant, Cleaner, and Coolant in One

reviewText: Keeps blades cool to keep clipping. Use it on my horse and dog clippers. This a coolant and not a cleaner - keep blade oil and blade wash on hand.

I am a newbie at grooming two long haired cats that I adopted from the local shelter. They actually are pretty good about submitting to the clipper right up until it starts to heat up so I bought this product and it buys me some time while I groom them because it does cool the clipper head down. It does not make it cold, just cool but it works for a few minutes so that I can finish the area I was working on.  I also bought an extra clipper head (or maybe should be called clipper comb) but changing them takes two hands and my subject is long gone by then so this "instant cool" is a big help.

I've been grooming dogs for 35+ years & would never, ever be caught without Kool Lube!!  Great product, easy to use & is VERY HELPFUL!  It not only cools hot blades off, but removes hair quickly when you're in the middle of grooming a dog & don't want to take the blade off, take it apart to clean it!  Just spray Kool Lube along the top of the blade & thru the side, wipe off the excess & you're good to go!!  I love ALL Oster Products!

Hi, I have had experience with this spray an oster products an they are reallygood generally. I just bought a can of this an only used it a couple of timeswhen my spray nosel snaped off making it impossible to use now. Now what ?Got any sujustions ?tyOSTER KOOL LUBE III SPRAY 14OZ (Catalog Category: Dog / Grooming)
summary: Bad luck with what was a good product

reviewText: a good fast spray lube for in between uses while clipping, sprays lose hair out and cools the motor off.

I shave my own cats because my cats are docile with me, but they try to kill any vet or groomer attempting to touch them. To minimize the stress on them and the emotional/physical trauma for the vets and the groomers, I shave them myself.I bought the Andis 21420 Pro-Animal Detachable Ceramic Blade Clipper Kit, which was fantastic, and I imagine a weebit cooler than the normal blades, but it still gets hot pretty quickly (10 minutes). Once it gets hot, you need a cooling spray like this (or at least a rubbing alcohol spray) to cool down the blades before you continue so your poor animals don't cry like you're trying to brand them.I attempted to shave them once before buying this, and immediately ordered this after that first attempt. It's a god send.
summary: Do not attempt to shave your animals without this.

reviewText: Use this on my oster  clippers when clipping my Labradoodle .  Cools down clippers and lubricates blades at same time.  Love this stuff.  Doesn't leave oily residue on hair either.

I was sceptical about a remedy that was not sprayed into the nose, but my cats runny eye and sneezing stopped within 48 hours of starting the liquid. It doesn't smell good (or I'm sure - doesn't taste good either) and I ended up putting in the water bowl rather than trying to get it into her mouth. But her 'cattitude' has returned - I guess I didn't realize how poorly she felt until she got better. Try this product - it's worth it!
This natural remedy really is effective for giving my kitty relief from occasional respiratory ills/allergies. I highly recommend it, and will order again when necessary.

Worked great for three weeks then cat just stopped responding. Had to contact vet again and she put him on steroid eye drops to put in his nose. Problem solved. Kitten happy. Had to do the vet drops for one month. Now only use when he gets a sneezing fit and it is nipped before he gets sinus clog and infection.  Had multiple vets recommend useless remedies and medications. The drops are neomycin polymyxin and dexamethasone in ophthalmic suspension. It is manufactured by Sandoz and is prescription only. Comes in tiny bottle. It took three years three vets and over twelve hundred dollars spent before success. Hope this helps and saves you a thousand dollars.
summary: Worked Great At First Then Nothing - But Found What Works :)

reviewText: I have been taking my one cat to the vet ever since I rescued him back in February.  I have spent over $1,000.00 on this cat and he still has an upper respiratory problem that won't go away.  This is the first time I have tried anything Homeopathic.  Well, I must say I am pleasantly surprised that my cat has not sneezed or coughed or anything since I started him on these drops.  It is a miracle!  True, my vet did give him some more Clavamox on the same day, but in all fairness, he has been on antibiotics at least 6 different times with no results.  I have to attribute my success to the Homeopet Nose Relief drops.
thank you for making a product that gives my cat some relief!  Nothing helps him - he has chronic sinusitis and this product does give him some relief!!!!
summary: Excellent - helps my cat with his nasal issues

reviewText: I had 2 younger cats in the house that caught a feline "cold" with sneezing and runny eyes.  It worked very well for these 2 cats, but my senior cat who is about 17 years old caught this "cold" and this medicine did not work for him.  I had to take him to the vet twice to get treated before he started recovering and getting better.  He had it so bad that he did not eat for almost a week.
summary: Homeopathic Meds for Pets that catch a cold

reviewText: Based on the positive reviews, I purchased this product to deal with my cats sinus issues. His nose is constantly blocked up, he snores all the time and breathes through his mouth. He also has excessive nasal discharge. After bringing him to the veterinarian several times and putting him on a regimen of antibiotics, I decided to try out this product, as none of the other treatments provided any relief. While this product didn't make his condition any worse, it didn't do anything to make it better. I guess it all depends on your particular pet, but for mine the product was useless.
summary: This product was of no help in resolving my cats sinus problems

reviewText: have flat face persians.  so few drops of this and no more sneezing, snorting or snoring.works immediately and one dose pretty much the whole day.keep in mind, that my persian had sneezing fits that would last up to a minute, now zeroooo!

Have been using this on my Himalayan for a few weeks now. I've bought other medications for her, and she ALWAYS throws up, foams at the mouht and locks her mouth shut, or just doesn't eat it.This is odorless, colorless and tasteless. I LOVE that about this product!I've given her a few drops three times a day. I've noticed her eyes aren't that gunky or runny as much as before, but they still get wattery.I'd recommend to at least try it.
summary: Good at reducing symptoms, but doesn't get rid of allergies 100%.

reviewText: It really works. I use this on both a outside kitty colony and my own kitties. I put their dose on two cat treats and let it sit for about 5 minutes so the alcohol smell will go away and if they won't eat it I grate a little hard cheese and shape it into a ball around the medicated treats. So far, I've had no problems. If the kitty is too stuffed up to smell and eat the treats then I just grab them with the scruff of their neck open their mouth and put in their dose. So far I haven't had any kitties having a upset tummy. It does take a day or two to really see results. I give them their dose twice a day.

One evening in April, my cat Pepper curled up outside in the English Ivy, which happened to have a heavy coating of pollen.  The following evening she had a brief sneezing fit - about 10 quick sneezes.  The next day brought another longer sneezing fit.  The third day, she developed some congestion, and a mild discharge began from her eyes.  There was no fever, and her appetite and activity were normal, so I was hopeful that this would resolve on its own.  Unfortunately, the congestion worsened to the point that I began to worry about her developing an upper respiratory infection, so I purchased Homeopet Nose Relief.I tried the drops first, just to test the flavor - it was mild, so I didn't feel bad about subjecting her to the drops.  Mixing into food is preferable, but she doesn't always eat all of her food, so sometimes I put the drops in her mouth directly.  She did not appreciate this method.  While using the drops, her condition didn't seem to get worse, but it didn't improve, either.Ultimately, I purchased Chlortrimeton - only $5 at Target.  I followed the recommendations I found online.  A half tablet on two consecutive days seemed to get her congestion under control.  I'm thrilled to avoid a visit to the Vet.I like the idea of a homeopathic remedy, but I think I might have missed the window for this one to be beneficial.  I did continue to give her the drops for a couple of days after stopping the Chlortrimeton.
summary: Maybe if I had started sooner...

reviewText: This product really works.  However, you have to keep using it.  It is very easy to use.  My cat practically licks it from the eye dropper.  He thinks he's getting a treat.
It has helped some.  While not actually knowing what is wrong with her, I believe it did help some and it lasts a long time.  Thank you.
It did not seem to help with her snoring. I was hopeing it would work on her nose. She has a over bite and sleeps with her tongue between her lips or mouth. So she breathes through her nose.

This ball is the typical Kong tough rubber, which is great.  My dog has been chewing on it quite a bit and it hasn't ripped or torn yet.  However, there are four bone-shaped holes in the ball, and one of them is significantly larger than the others.  Every treat I've put inside the ball comes out of that hole almost instantly.  I was hoping this would be more like the Kong, where I could put a treat in it and keep my dog entertained for a while trying to get it out, but that's not the case.  Still an ok purchase though for a tough ball that he can chew and not destroy.

The most frustrating thing was finding a treat that fit well in the holes (big enough so it wouldn't fall out, small enough so it'd fit).  Ever since I found an appropriate sized dog biscuit (Kirkland!), we're golden.  He loves this ball so much he'll try to roll it around without food in it.  It also slows down his very fast eating.  Made of Kong rubber so it lasts.

I bought this to entertain my dog while she recovered from surgery.  When I first gave the ball to her, with Get Naked Dental Sticks protruding, the cat showed more than a passing interest.  So much so that I had to put the dog and ball into her crate to get away from the cat!My dog never was into balls or chasing them around, but she enjoys this one because of the treats.  But she wouldn't work that hard once the treat broke off and the rest remained in the ball.  After a few times of my intervening, with her watching, she'll now try (albeit unsuccessfully) to get the rest of the treat out herself.  Today, she actually chewed on the ball for some 10 minutes trying to get at the treat.  Maybe she'll get better at this as time goes on.
I got this ball in a size small but it was still too big to fit in my Shih Tzu's mouth.
summary: Much bigger than expected...too big for Shih Tzu's mouth

reviewText: My 3 mo. Siberian Husky LOVES this ball (most of the time).  Like other reviewers I've had problems with it being way too easy.  However, he will still play with it long after the treats are gone if I use a strong smelling treat to begin with (leaving the smell on the ball).  Its very tough and he loves to chew on it and chase it.  It bounces pretty well and rolls great.  I have found that if you use a beggin' strip that is long enough and soft enough, you can get it in and wedged against a side so that it takes (a little) longer to fall out.  Please, please, please post links to items you've found fit this ball if you know of any.  Overall, I'd probably buy it again.  I just wish I knew what would fit best in it.Thank you!Edit: Husky is now 4 mo. old and we've found that the Get Naked Sticks fit great!!!  Stick it in one end & out the other and it keeps him busy for much, much longer!! (These:Get Naked Low Calorie Dental Chew Sticks for Dogs, Small/6.2-Ounce, 18 sticks/Pack)  I've also found some other treats (Cardinal Laboratories Pet Botanics Healthy Omega Treats, Salmon 6 Ouncesfit in the holes (length wise) well.  That doesn't take nearly as long to get out as the Get Naked sticks though...Good luck!
summary: Fun but too easy if you don't use the right "filler"

reviewText: Was hard to keep it filled and my puppy didnt like to play with it for some reason, she liked the other ball they have the dental one much better.  One plus..it bounces good.

These are a big hit with my dogs.  I fill them with soft dog food and freeze them overnight.  I crate the dogs while I'm at work, and this gives them something to do.  I like these better than the traditional KONG beehive shape because it seems like it is easier for the dogs to get the ball completely cleaned out.  That means I don't have to worry about old bits of food being stuck inside and festering, even if I only wash them every couple of days.The large ball holds a little over 1/2 can of dog food, and is probably appropriate for 50 to 90 pound dog.  The small ball hold about 1/4 can, and is probably appropriate for anything smaller.  By "appropriate" I mean that the ball is big enough for the dog to get its tongue into, but small enough to still be a bit of a challenge.Also, and this is probably obvious, but make sure you get the "ground" dog food, not the stuff with chunks and juice.

Had my fair share of treat balls, and this one is the only one that lasted.The rest has been torn and destroyed by my two medium-sized dogs...The holes are a little too big for me (even when I purchased the small size), but some biscuits fit in there perfectly.For me, I use the Science Diet Medium Biscuit Treats (many different flavours available), and it can keep the dogs entertained for a minute or two.
THERE IS THE HOLE TO PUT THE TREATS IN BUT THE HOLE IS SO BIG THAT THEY FALL BACK OUT!!

Seemingly indestructible for my 80 pound pup!  The only thing I wish I had known was to buy larger sized dog biscuits to fill the grooves, as all the treats I currently have fall out immediately from the large openings surrounding the ball.  They are great, by the way, for her to grab hold to during a game of fetch or retrieve.  I have taken to filling the ball with her kibble after wetting it, mixing in a few treats/dog biscuits, and then freezing it overnight.  This slows down her ability to extract the treats, and gives her a bit more to "work" on before she settles down for a nap.  Next time I order from Amazon, I will get some extra large biscuits for Kong products to put in the grooves, but until then, she is enjoying her kongsicle.
This is one of the only toys my dogs have not been able to destroy. I fill it with treats and peanut butter and it keeps them busy for a while outside

Holes for food are too large and plentiful -  food just falls out even with peanut butter, but ball is very durable and bouncy .Too heavy to throw at a dog for catch since it would knock out their teeth. That said, my goldens love to fetch it, and roll it on the bottom of the pond. They would give it a five, I a three, hence the four star rating. Easy to find with vibrant color.
summary: Like a rubber ball I come bouncing back to you, uh huh - yogi and pharoah

reviewText: I used this as a gateway toy to a kong for my pit mix. He didn't like his regular kong, so I would fill this for him so he could figure out how to get inside. He really liked it, and would continue to play with it even after it wasn't filled.

First of all, I love the kong toys. They are durable, they last, and my dog enjoys eating the treats inside. We have the regular kong ball w/ the small hole in the end and she loved that so I decided to buy this one too. I bought treats shaped like biscuits to go inside the biscuit ball but found that there was still alot of space/room inside this ball-even though it was the smaller size. Our dog had no problems getting the biscuit out which is a problem since she's eating a larger treat and spent no little time playing with the ball to get to the treat.  I give it a 3 because I love the kong products but didn't like this particular design.
summary: love kong toys but this one isn't my favorite

reviewText: The holes are WAY too big in this.  NOTHING will stay in it for even a second.  It's ok as a plain ball to play with, but you can get balls much cheaper.

I have a golden that is 8 mos old and is a heavy chewer! She loves this ball! Have been looking for safe bones to stick in the places. In the meantime I have been stuffing each opening with creamy peanut butter! What a great treat ball!!! She loves it!!! Still in great shape!!!! Highly recommend this one! Love Kong!!!!

**UPDATE: May 2012**  I still have this ball!  It's about 7 years old and still in great shape.  I have 2 shelties now - my older boy sheltie that I wrote about in my original review below has passed away, and now I'm the proud dog-mom to a 7 yr old girl sheltie (28 lbs) and a 4 year old boy sheltie (22 lbs).  Even though they aren't big dogs, I'm glad I have the large size biscuit ball, it's a great size for them.  I make homemade gluten-free biscuits for them these days, drying them so they're hard and crunchy and they don't fall apart easily.  Because of this, the homemade biscuits work nicely in the biscuit ball as they're more difficult to get out of the ball compared to store bought biscuits.**Original review**While dog biscuits don't last 5 minutes in this ball with my sheltie, this ball will keep my little boy busy for over half an hour when I fill it with mashed banana or other fruit, yogurt, unsweetened applesauce, or his "real meals", ground meat with veggies, and then freeze it (makes him work harder for the goodies inside).  I then place it either on our enclosed concrete patio that I can hose off, or in his doggie "playpen" out on the lawn, and my little guy goes nuts for it.  Excellent mental stimulation, and much better than him just snarfing up his food in 20 seconds from his food bowl.  We've had this over a year and a half, with no signs of wear.  AND, it cleans up in the dishwasher!  Highly recommended.
Not an awful product. Holes were mostly too big to put anything in, food comes out too easily. Meaning dog is bored with it after a few seconds. Not bad, I suppose, but didn't do much for my dog.

My 27 lb Miniature Poodle mix has already taken a couple big chunks out of this....I was expecting better from a KONG product, I'm very disappointed and so is pup! It lasted only 7 or 8 days before I had to throw it out because he tore into the ball so easily.

I haven't found treats that work very well in this toy.  The holes are bigger but one side is really big so if you get a treat in the smaller sized holes it falls out the big hole to quickly.  And the treat I have found to stay in the big hole are to big to fit in & stay in long enough to give my dog some chew time.  Maybe I just haven't found the right treat, but my Siberian doesn't care for this one much.
dogs able to chew pieces off within an hour of giving them the toy. Expected more from Kong products. other kongs products have been great, this one = not so much. bummer.

Great product for larger dogs(smaller versions are available).  Load it up with treats that just fit through the holes and your dog is occupied for a long time.  It is fun to watch them learn to roll, shake and throw the ball to release the treats.  My dog asks me to fill it up.
summary: Great time waster for your dog

reviewText: We have an English Bulldog and I have been struggling to find something he cannot destroy within a few days.  This toy was destroyed within a week.  Not to say it is a bad toy, it is probably good for a less aggressive chewer.
summary: My bulldog destroyed it in a week

reviewText: I love everything kong. They have overall better products for all breeds and sizes. Our pug is entertained. Our pit bull is entertained. Kong products last longer. They cost more but in the end we spend less.
My dog gives this 5 stars!We put the biscuits inside the ball so she has to work to get them out.She loves her biscuit ball.

My Foster pit bull can literally destroy any toy in a Mayer of seconds. Even all other kong toys are no match for this. The funny thing is that he and I were out for a walk one day and we found this laying on some grass by the side of the road. He had not been able to make a dent in this thing and carries it around with him every where he goes. I will definitely be sending it worth him when he goes to his furever home, and I will be sure to tell them what a great price it sells for here.

This is ok.  I think it's a standard sort of easy and inexpensive hydrometer, but I can measure my water more than once and get slightly different readings, so I think it's ok for the price, but I wouldn't stake the life or death of my fish etc. on it.
summary: Not sure how accurate this is.

reviewText: This is absolutely not an alternative to or replacement for a refractometer. But if you're in a pinch and need to not spend the extra few bucks for a refractometer, you can probably get by with this. Just please understand what you're getting and the potential downfalls of relying solely on a hydrometer.
summary: Does what it's supposed to, but know what you're getting.

reviewText: it does what it advertises and  i trust instant oceans quality so i bought it works great  easy to read. has markings for the normal readings that really stand out

I've been using hydrometers for over 35 years.  This one would give me three different readings in three different attempts to check specific gravity in my aquarium.  Screwed up my salt levels in the tank by trusting this.  Corals are very unhappy.
I wouldn't use this for mixing salt, but to quickly check your tanks when feeding or fussing around it's good enough for me.

After reading the instructions, keeping it rinse with regular water after use and discarding the first test each time I use it my readings still will not go past 1.016! This is even after adding more salt to the aquarium to bring it up to the 1.025 I need. Now I have no way of know what my salinity is until I purchase a refractometer for more accurate results which also puts a delay on me adding any inhabitants to the tank.I even gave it a second chance, I actually purchased saltwater from my local fish store which is pre-mixed at a salinity of 1.025. When I did a test on it...still got 1.016. Needless to say I will be throwing this item away.

I used this all the time. I compared it to my LFS and it was a little off but since I know what it should read, I just compensate for it. Now I got a refractometer from Amazon and I don't use the hydrometer anymore.

keep it clean and i would say it works  if rite from factory. I have.  deep 6 hydrometers  that are 15 years old maybe older that still work well.  That's 5 star in my book as long as its accurate when new  keep it clean with fresh water and look close for air bubbles ...i have had 4 Instant Ocean SeaTest Hydrometer that the counter weight fell out with no way to fix  and 3 instant ocean testers that didn't work at all  ThoseFishGeeks. comCounter weight falls out

There are mixed feelings about using a hydrometer to measure specific gravity of the water. but there are some ways to keep on getting accurate readings. one is , pour water in slowly, make sure all the fresh water is out so measure the first time and then dump it and measure again. Normally that gives the more accurate reading.  and always make sure there is no bubbles on the measuring unit. bubbles can greatly affect the reading.  Definitely a lot cheaper than a refractometer. I will get one later but for now this will do, since im just starting.

I used this for a couple months but the readings were just not consistent enough and it started to become more and more important that I knew the exact, real specific gravity of my water. So I bought a $50.00 hydrometer. Now there is no question as to the salinity of my water.
summary: Works but measurements are not consistent

reviewText: When kept clean and when you dump the first scoop of water and slowly allow the water to enter so that there are no bubbles on the weighted gauge, and when the water temperature is in the high 70's, the reading is very accurate. I have recently purchased a temperature compensated refractometer from Bulk Reef Supply along with calibration fluid. I compared the readings using this hygrometer and the calibrated refractometer. The readings were identical.

I got this for free from a friend and never really used it as online forum members seemed to favor using a refractometer.  Have to say that if kept clean and used properly to keep bubbles from messing with the reading this thing is accurate enough and easy to read.  So I actually end up using this more than the refractometer.
exactly what I wanted. Measures the salinity of my salt water tank perfectly. Glad I bought this. Cant wait to set everything up!

It was inexpensive and does its job well.  But for those of you who don't already know this, you have to rinse out with normal water before and after using it with saltwater.  You also have to gently fill it with saltwater and tap the top and ensure to rid the inside of any bubbles, then you'll get a relatively accurate reading of your salinity.  You follow these simple rules and you'll love it!  5 stars!

I'm using this to measure low salinity in brackish tanks and for salt ich treatments. One thing to remember....the directions say rinse Before and After....BUT when you rinse it in tap water, there are many drops of fresh water still in the instrument...if you dip it in tank water and take a measure, you will get a LOW reading....so dump that first sample after a minute or so...Then dip Another sample and you will have an accurate reading every time. This is a very good hydrometer for the money. Many buy expensive refractometers or resistive types which can also deceive you for a number of reasons.

I happen to live near the ocean,, so I have the luxury of testing it against a control system.  I took several samples of ocean water at various depths and away from shore to see what the actualy salinity was.  Then I made a mark on it to set the salinity of my fish tank.. (.038) anyway,,  I live in the south pacific in the marshall islands..  It seems a little high,, so either the gauge is slightly wrong or the water has more salt than what wikipedia says it should be for the tropics.
summary: Seems to work,, watch out for air bubbles and might read a little on the high side

reviewText: Bought this to test the water in my marine aquarium. It's way off! Said the specific gravity was 1.022 when it was actually a extreme low 1.015. Lucky for me it's a new set up and no fish yet or else I'd be out a lot more money for sure. And yes I rinsed very well before and after use.

Purchased this for my new saltwater tank.  Very simple readings and accurate!  I am a Lab technologist and have tested this alongside our own methods of testing body fluids and they are nearly identical!  Not bad comparing five bucks to five hundred in terms of equipment!  great buyEDIT!!! BROKE WITHIN 2 MONTHS!!! JUNK.  The center piece holding the meter fell out and thus rendering it useless.  Save your money for a refractometer!  These are garbage

I had an oceanic hydrometer for nano tanks that was meant to stay in the tank at all times (it had little suction cups on it so it was always facing the outside of the tank. I was getting high readings from it all the time, even when i would mix the appropriate salt/water mix stated in the directions to achieve a specific gravity of 1.024. I thought the hydrometer was off, so I ordered this one. I use a lot of Instant ocean products and expected this to be of the same quality of their other products. It consistently reads low salt content, while the other one i have reads high. I literally mixed a gallon of water with 1/2 cup salt so i knew that the salinity would be 1.024, and marked with a pen where 1.024 was, not where it said it was.
