Looks like the circle ends up somewhere in their house and our dogs figured that out and would take off in that direction. Going for an in-ground wired fence as i can control the area i want. Good for large houses maybe with tons of room between the neighboring houses.

The wireless fence is truly amazing at keeping your pets in the yard and safe.  We vowed to never fence or chain a pet again, so when we rescued a 9 month old lab mix we decided to try the wireless fence by Pet Safe.  Our young dog seemed very smart and eager to learn the flag system.  She only had to be shocked once and has never tried to run away or even go near the flags.The only negative is how upset I got when she was shocked.  It was truly awful, I don't know who yelled louder me or her.  After the shock, she became afraid of the yard for a day or so.  She only wanted to stay in the garage, but we took her out with only the "beep" activated and played with her on and off.  The next day when she heard the beep, she became scared and ran back to us when I called her.  It only took her a 5 days to learn the system.  Thank you Pet Safe!!PS  we felt the wireless was much easier than the buried wire system.

The unit was pretty easy to setup.  Within an hour I'd fine tuned the distance so that the boundary would be a few feet short of the front street.We have a steeply sloped back yard and the unit seemed to handle that okay.We replaced a "wired" invisible fence with this wireless one, so the dog knew what was "going down" from the minute it saw the new collar and flags.  No training required.At first our dog hung out pretty close to the house but within a week it was testing the perimeter.  I must say our perimeter isn't a perfect circle.  It's sort of like a large inexact, slightly varying circle.  Probably due to how much house and other junk is between the transmitter and the perimeter.All in all the unit has worked well and eliminated the need for wires.  The area the dog is confined to is smaller than our original wired perimeter, but it's where the dog spends 90 percent of it's time anyways.The batteries are much cheaper for this unit than another "name brand" wired unit.  The collar, however, looks a little cheaper than the unit we had.All in all, it's an acceptable solution and beats hunting for wires and fixing breaks all the time.
summary: Pretty much works as you'd expect

reviewText: We recently acquired a beagle/treeing walk mix puppy from our neighbor.  The mother of the puppy was notorious for getting out of her yard and roaming the neighborhood to "visit" everyone.  Unfortunately, she taught the little princess how to do this at the tender age of two months.  So when she came to live with us, it took her no time to scale the back fence and start roaming the neighborhood with her mother again.  I can't even begin to tell you how dangerous and frustrating it was for us.  Every time she was let outside, even with one of us there to supervise, she was running to the back fence and would be gone.Instead of getting a new fence, we decided that we would give this a shot.  I felt bad about having to use it, but we felt like it was the most economical option for us.  The other dogs don't ever try to leave the yard. The first day we purchased the system, we placed the flags all around the back yard and put her on a leash.  We then slowly walked her towards the containment field and let her hear the beep.  We then said no and pulled her back again before she felt the shock.  A few minutes later her mother came to visit, and when she left, the puppy tried to as well.  She ran forward, heard the beep, kept going, and got shocked.  I'm pretty sure that I cried more than she did, but we quickly saw that it was going to work.  We continued to keep her on the leash for a while, and then after about a week, let her off to see what she would do.  We only had it on the second setting, so she was able to push her way through the field and get out of the yard.  However, she came back into the field and ended up in the front yard, not wanting to push her luck for a second shock.  She did this again on 3, so we put it on the 4th setting, and that has worked ever since.Some of the other reviews that I've read said that this can't be used as a permanent containment device.  That is not accurate.  It said right in my instructions that you need to wipe your dogs neck at the contact point as well as the contacts daily, or it WILL cause a rash.  You should also take the collar off when your dog is safely in the house.  There's no good reason for it to be on all the time.  We have been using the product for 3 months now, and she has not escaped since we bumped the intensity up.We have made putting the collar on a fun treat for her.  She stands by the back door and waits for me to put her collar on so she can get her cookie.  Then she knows that it's time to go outside and play.  I even leave it off of her sometimes, and she still stays in the containment area.  The only time that she pushes her luck is if there is someone on the other side of the fence next door, and she wants to go visit.  Then she gets her collar put back on again for another week of outside play time.
summary: Thank you for a wonderful product!

reviewText: I must admit that I had to convince myself that this system was not cruel to use on my cocker spaniel.  I felt badly about having to zap him because we couldn't fence in our property.  After all, that wasn't his fault.  I read all the reviews here and decided that if it was anywhere as good as so many had written than I had to give it a try.  OMG, I wish I had known about this system when we first got Fudge.  Playing with him outdoors is a whole new world for both of us.  It's such a joy to watch him run freely at full speed.  That's something he never did while on his dog lead as it would give him a nasty snap if he ran too far (that was actually worst than the little zaps he got during training).  We have one and a third acres and I thought that I might want to purchase two of these, however, it turns out that I don't even need the full amount of space for this one.  I have it set to six and he still has plenty of space.  Because of the circular shape it was impossible to use the full 180 diameter because it overlapped my neighbors property on both sides, but who cares?!!! The price of this product is amazingly cheap compared to fencing.  Not to mention that it's easy to use.  My set up took a bit longer because my house is older and my property is sloped.  And yeah, my beeps are not always where I set the flags.  At first my dog found this confusing but now he knows that no matter where he sees a flag it's the beeps that count!  In fact, we've removed most of the flags except for two near the end of our driveway.  At first Fudge ran from the collar.  Now he runs to the collar because he knows that he's gonna be free! BTW, I tested the collar on each level before I used it on Fudge.  It's very humane and not painful.  But it will get your attention! And no, it does not feel good! That being said, nothing brings me more joy than to watch his long cocker ears flap in the wind!  Thanks for allowing me to enjoy my dog even more!

My two dogs were used to fenced yards and when I moved to a rural area with no fences I was worried. I purchased this system along with an extra receiver collar (for the second dog) and extra batteries. I carefully followed the instruction manual and took my time with the training. It has taken two weeks and some adjustments but both dogs are doing well and I'm very pleased with the purchase.One of my dogs is very stubborn and fearless. He broke through setting number 4 and ran for miles. He eventually came home unharmed and I bumped his intensity up as high as it will go and have not had any more wandering. I love that this allows them freedom to run and play off the leash but keeps them safely off the highway and out of the deep woods and the neighbor's yard.I'm still keeping a close eye on them and I take them out on a leash after dark, but without a system like this I probably would have had to get rid of the dogs and that would have broken my heart.

I am using the Aquaclear 50 for my 20 gallon tall planted tank. This new version includes biomedia in place of the Ammonia granules. This design has been in place for decades and after several types of tanks with various filters, i chose the aquaclear on my latest for both simplicity and reliability. The planted tank requirements are somewhat different to a fish tank however maintain clean water conditions and beneficial bacteria are largely the same.The biggest benefit is the freedom to make your own media using filter bags. A+The price on Amazon is also several dollars cheaper than the LFS so why go anywhere else :)
summary: Back to an old time favorite

reviewText: A great alternative! We have had some cheap Tetra ones which came with kits when we needed quick setups, but were never impressed by their lack of variable speeds & awkward small compartments which neither let you see what is in them (opaque black plastic) nor add much more than their specified expensive 'cartridges'...We shoved the bioballs down in this, added the supplied white filter, but passed on the carbon as we're not medicating at this time & the water is fairly clear. After adding a bottle of Dr.  Tim's One and Only Live Nitrifying Bacteria as well as some filter floss to catch smaller particulates this filter has served us well, keeping our slightly overstocked & well planted tanks very clean.A recommendation though - if you have smaller fish, invertebrates, or fish with delicate fins such as a betta I recommend adding a pre-filter like the cheap Fluval knock off ones you get 3 of for 5$ (free shipping on amazon) - it'll also help keep the rest of your filter cleaner longer... Plus shrimp loooove hanging out on them!
summary: A full endorsement, and probably will buy another soon...

reviewText: Use this on a 10g set up to raise cichlid juveniles. Love that it doesn't use wasteful cartridges... it's basically a miniature canister filter. I used some established Biomax rings from my Fluval 308 in here and boom - instant biological filter. Every so often squeeze the gunk out of the aquaclear foam filter and I see no reason this filter couldn't run for years (provided the motor holds up).
summary: Best small H.O.B. filter out there.

reviewText: The name says it all.  This HOB Filter is the best on the market, IMO.  I highly recommend it.  I like how it has separate bags for the Carbon, Bio-Stones and the Sponge.  Excellent item for the price!
Had to replace my outside filter on my aquarium.  Thought I'd try something a little different.  This installs easily and works extremely well.

This was great, until it wasn't.  Even though I had the problems with the noisy impeller, after I put a little vasoline on it it stopped the noise.  Everything was fine until I came home today to do my weekly maintenance and the filter was dead!  I know it was working last week when I did a water change but I have no idea when it quit working.  Fortunately I have two filters running so my fish are ok. This filter only lasted six months so I'm very disappointed.

This is my second AC70 filter. The first one didn't break; I am just using double filter for our living room aquarium which has an Oscar. I really like the easiness of these filters and that's why I ended up buying another one again. You can clean the foam, then squeeze it clean again, and then squeeze it clean again. You just can't wear it off. That saves on $ big time. Also, you can use your own carbon media with custom media bags (like I do) and save even more dollars buying a large supply of canned carbon. The bio filter is very nice and it resides in the filter so no worry about washing them off when doing water changes.One thing though: At first you will notice the filter is very loud, almost unacceptable. This is normal. Wear will soon kick in and the thing will be quiet in a few weeks. Just bear with it. I know because I have several other filters from AquaClear and they are all the same. A really nice thing is you can order just about any spare part imaginable for this product, right here in Amazon Prime.  By the way, the filter does its job very efficiently. That should go without saying.

reviewerName: Ami Laurie "too young to be grandma"
reviewText: This is the second filter in my discus tank. That is, I have two filters to keep the water sparkling and the fish happy. And it works!

AquaClear's are the best hang on back filter on the market IMO. Lot's of options for filter media and adjustable flow. Even though the gph for this filter are rated for larger tanks, I would recommend these filters for 10g to 15g tanks for optimum filtration.

I didn't buy this filter off Amazon, but did purchase one at Petsmart and one online elsewhere for a slightly lower price. Absolutely love this filter and the customization that it allows. It performs well not only on my 5 gallon betta tank that is heavily planted, but also on larger tanks. This filter moves a lot of water! My girlfriend recently bought me a Marineland Penguin 100 filter on Amazon and I should have returned it, but my curiosity got the better of me and I kept it. The filter does not compare to the Aqua Clear.The Aqua Clear is simple to use and maintain. It is quiet and has without a doubt saved me a lot of money because I no longer need to buy those useless filter cartridges. It has very few parts and is easy to put together and take apart. It also has a media basket, which I don't see in many other HOB filters - they all use cartridges... I wonder why? I have a pre filter sponge on my intake and 2 Aqua Clear 20 foam sponges in my basket along with the small bag of Biomax. And since I have this on a small betta tank I used a small piece of filter padding to baffle the flow. This filter provides great mechanical and biological filtration and I have had no ammonia spikes or anything, even after I dirted my aquarium. The flow is great and is adjustable by sliding the intake left or right to make it in line with the impeller. My only complaint is that the filter does have a very slight vibrating noise when the cover of the filter is on. Perhaps the manufacturers can change that.Filters should be simple, yet effective. This filter is all that. Makes maintenance much easier and is a filter I know I can rely on. For those who have had complaints about the filter being made of cheap plastic or poor quality, then perhaps you have purchased a defective unit or feel that they should be military grade and indestructible... Greater filter for the price. You get what you pay for!
summary: Best HOB filter on the market.

reviewText: I've had a few other common types of power filters and I believe this one is superior simply because you can more easily layer filter media of your choosing into the device without hassle.  It can be difficult to use batting or custom cut filters on the type where the filters sit vertically (looking down at the filter shows narrow edge of filter square) but on this unit they sit flat and water comes up from below.  A handful of the heavy Biolocal Filtration cylinders that come with the filter will hold down other layers.  I don't like to use Carbon b/c we have a lot of plants and this filter allows me to easily cut and use my own filter mesh.Also, flow rate is very good and somewhat adjustable on this unit.
summary: Might be the best power filter out there

reviewText: I use this for my 45-50 Gallon Jack Dempsey tank.Pros:It's "quiet" - you will hear the water flow but it's not loudDoes a great job of keeping the water clearGreat filtering media - one layer of sponge, standard carbon filter, and BioMaxI think it's a good deal price wise (a 10 gallon filter normally $15, so if you calculate, the price is about right)It's a BIG filter, but it's not ugly - it has a blue/clear color, sleek designYou can adjust water flow (I don't notice a difference adjusting it though)Cons:I wish they could have made the filter a little longer - my Jack is a bottom-dweller, so most debris on the bottom
summary: Great great filter! Probably the best!

reviewText: Aquaclear really knows how to make a filter. This one comes with 2 filter tubes for taller aquariums, and I recommend getting a "Filter-Max III Prefilter" as it fits it perfectly and adds an extra layer to the already 4-5 tier filtration it provides. I say 4-5 since the intake tube is 1, the foam insert is 2, a carbon filter (3), and then it comes with a bio-max, which is a cylinder-shaped bacteria holder and I tend to put 2 just because. You can put almost anything in here, whether it's one of those 'cut-it-yourself' inserts, any kind of seachem or purigen mesh bags, and you can pretty much reuse half of what it gives. It recommends replacing the foam every 2 months, but I just swish and squish it in some leftover water change water, same with the bio-max if it gets "grodey" looking. The prefilter helps with that. It can be moved with the little piece on top from 40gal-70gal (I have a 55 and keep at 70 since you cannot over-filter.) If you're going to get this and have a filter already, make sure you leave this in for about 1-2 months t make sure the bacteria gets in this filter from your other one.

This is a great little filter. It pumps 150 gallons per hour and has loads of filter media for a powerfilter of this size. Don't be fooled by the inefficient filter cartridges used by other brands. This is the filter you want.
summary: The best powerfilter on the market.

reviewText: Very pleased. My tank is clear and my fish are happy. Using and cleaning this filter is easy. I like the 3 tier system.

This is bar none the quietest HOB (hang on back) filter I have ever owned. It doesnt have the bypass problem other filters I own have had (when the water just goes around the filter instead of through it...All of my filters will be AquaClear from now on.
Great product, packaging good, delivrery on time.  Works the way it should.I have 6 of this brand running in my tanks.

I was changing and cleaning my tank every thrid day of the week and that was with a filter. I had to go on a trip for 2 weeks. I had to find something that could handle this mess of a turtle. I thought my turtle would die in its waste if i wasnt there. I FOUND THIS. Awsome filter. This saves me money and time with the filter. Tank has never been cleaner. This sucks everything up. I love it. Im saving money TOO!

I got into the aquarium hobby back in the seventies with my dad. From this perspective, aquarium filtration has vastly improved from the old floss filters. Any of you old timers remember those? Floss filters with metal frame tanks, boy those were the days: not! I have learned one valuable lesson from years of fish husbandry. Never use the manufactures suggested sizes for filtration. At the very least, double it if you want a good clean tank. I run two Aquaclear 50's on my forty gallon tank. I changed to this configuration from a Marineland canister with a bio wheel. The advantages of a two filter set up should be self explanatory. I run one of them with a Hagen Fluval Surface Skimmer to keep the surface clear of scum. It is a setup that works well. This is an easy filter to run with custom media too. I buy my charcoal in bulk and use filter bags. This is cheaper then buying the individual bags.The only issue with the filter becomes apparent during a power outage. If your tank is low, it might not regain suction. No damage will occur to the filter though as they are magnetically driven. Keeping your tank topped off is the best way to avoid this issue.  I have never had an issue with this filter leaking outside the tank. It only has a slight inside leak if run wide opened. It is also easy to disassemble and clean. I have had to replace one broken impeller.This is a very dependable and stable filter that is easy to maintain.
summary: Good filter that could be improved

reviewText: This filter runs much better and quieter than the one that came with the tank.  It also keeps running.  Our tank was really "unclear" for a while, but this filter kept chugging along without slowing down.  It's extremely easy to clean.  The only reason it dropped a star in my opinion is that the dip tube doesn't come off easily, and the connection to join the tube makes it hard to manipulate the dip tube off the filter when cleaning it.  I can see eventually breaking the dip tube.EXCELLENT customer service though.  Mine was missing the little adjustable spacer deal at the bottom to level it to the tank.  I emailed them, and within a day, they mailed me one.  I had a few days later.  I used part of the cardboard box folded up to level it until it arrived.  No biggie.
Updated review, my aqua clear 30 just died on me.Came home and saw no water coming down. Motor isnt even running and its plugged in.Avoid this manufacture's failure of a filter.
summary: My AquaClear 30 just died on me 1 month later. Motor died, no provocation. Did everything right, This is GARBAGE

reviewText: I purchased this filter in the fall of 2010. It is now 3 years old. It is a reliable powerhorse for my 10-gal aquarium. And it is quiet. Very quiet. The current list price is $30, so I'm now averaging $10/yr out of this thing. For what it does, and for the fact that it is constantly at work 24/7, I couldnt ask for a better product.Some people on here say not to waste time with the carbon filter. I think that is lousy advice - the water is crystal clear when new carbon is introduced - so I think changing it every two months is a good idea. I do not see any need to EVER change the biomax filter.. I've had mine since I bought it. You can get 3-4 months out of each sponge, just rinse it off with every cleaning, and the gunk comes right off.
summary: Great Value - Great Quality- 3 Years Strong

reviewText: This one has been running in a 65 and is doing such a good job I bought another for my 55 gallon. The one bad thing I will say about it is that the default foam insert does not do the greatest job with small particles. It's great at removing really big stuff, but there is definitely particle matter that makes it through the filter.The good news is, you can put any damn thing you want into this filter, and you'll be fine. Functionally, this is a canister filter. You can add or remove any filter media you want, you can even take out all the default stuff and fill the whole thing with cotton batting, it will still work. It's also very quiet. If you keep the water level high enough in your tank, the water pouring out of the filter will not make loud sloshing noises. the motor makes almost no noise, I can't hear it over the sound of my bubbler. If you unplug it for a water change, it will make the usual grinding noises until you refill it. The important thing is to make sure the intake tube is firmly set and the area around the tube is where you pour the water when you refill it. Pouring water over the filter media will not prime the pump and you will get grinding.In short: Quiet, works.
summary: Works so well I bought another.

reviewText: Works great, but it is a tad noisier than other HOB filters.  I suppose I can't complain though about the noise to much with how well this thing filters... it's super amazing... DO NOT use with fish that don't like current though as this thing will put out quite the current.  I had it in a 29 gallon tank and it worked wonders.

I have bought two of these after trying two other brands.  This unit has three advantages over the two others.  First, it is very easy to lift the tray to clean or replace the filter media.  Second, it is very quiet as long as you keep the water level high enough so the water doesn't have to drop a lot to the water's surface.  Third, it is safe in that it can not auto-siphen all of your aquarium water onto your floor if the seal fails...this has actually happened to me with a below-the-tank unit.

This is a great filter and it is versatile to add your own filter media suited to your needs. It is also cheap to maintain.I have a planted tank so I do not use the activated carbon as it removes nutrients from the water that plants use. Instead, I use a layer of filter floss. I also use a layer of shpagnum peat moss in a filter media bag (above the the sponge and floss, below the bio) which helps the PH and fertilizes the plants.Some users complained about the noise. This is an easy fix.First of all this filter is not for use with sand! it will make a grinding noise if you use it with sand. Gravel is OkIf you do use it with sand, you can take the motor housing apart and spray water into the spinning' fan to remove as much little dirt as you can, it should be quieter if you do this.For all uses, If you hear a rumbling noise, this is an easy fix;  basically use vaseline or silicon grease to lubricate the propeller shaft.Refer to the manual as follows:Take out the motor (part I), remove the propeller - little white thing- (part G  and put lubrication right on the propeller shaft in the middle (part H). Make sure you rub it up/down with the propeller to ensure good lubrication.Don't foget to secure your filters (push them down tight) and fill the unit up with water before you plug it in again.voila! noise is gone!
summary: great filter! noise problem can be solved easily!

reviewText: I bought this for my 30 gallon aquarium and I've had it about three months now and it works great! I change all the inserts when they're supposed to be changed, but they're really only between 2 and 4 dollars, so the price for the once a month carbon changes, bimonthly foam changes, and trimonthly biobag changes is actually pretty negligible. This filter keeps my water very clear and, a tip to those starting their first aquarium (as I did): They say to run the filter for a day before you add fish, but I actually ran mine for about 2 weeks (I was really waiting on a lid for the aquarium) and by the time I finally got fish into it, the cycling process was really easy on the filter since it had been running so long already. Everyone told me that my first fish would die but the first 6 are still alive as are the three I added about a month ago! So, my advice is to run it for a while before you add the fish. This was very easy to install and it's easy maintenance AND it's a low cost. I would definitely highly recommend this filter!
summary: Works great, easy installation, easy maintenance

reviewText: Great price,Rated at up to 500 gallons per hourIn reality gets 285 gallons per hour which is very very good - excellent mechanical filtration - keeps water super clear.Runs on only 14 wattsRelatively quietFlexible media capacityEasy to CleanI have owned a lot of filters and this is the best value in a filter I've seen.

I purchased two of these for my tank and have been very happy with them. They push a good amount of water and are pretty quiet. The only issue I've had is that one of them has a top which comes loose all of the time, making it rattle pretty loudly. Once I push it down, the vibration stops and stays that way for a while. This has only happened with one of my filters; the other works perfectly.

So far its good I recevied THREE replacement from AMAZON due to POOR packaging and POOR courier handling ONTRAC sucks, but thats beside the point if your AQ110 is sent packaged correctly and arrives in one peace assembly is easy provided you follow the included instructions unlike some reviews out there the plastic material the AQ is made out of is sturdy the included media is a bonus (just rinse very well) flow output is great and YOU CAN see the difference when flow rate is adjusted its not a HUGE difference, but noticeable set it up yesterday 6/13/2013 and its been running flawlessly all night no leaks or overflow problems. Priming was easy and fast lets hope it continues working fine.

The aquaclear is:- Quiet- Flows a ton of water- Cheap to maintain/use- Designed very nicelyIt doesnt make any noise at all, its seriously that quiet. This Aquaclear 110 flows 500 gallons of water per hour on the high setting. That is a lot of water thru a filter which means more turnover and more stuff being pulled out of the water. This filter is cheap to maintain as the sponge block is reusable, unlike other filters when the pad fills up you toss it. This filter you can just rinse out the sponge and its ready to go again in a few mins.A great filter for your main tank or even a nice setup for a Quarantine Tank....
summary: Aquaclear sets the benchmark for Hang on Back Filters!!

reviewText: This is a classic power filter that has been around for a long time.  Many competing brands of power filters have come and gone over the many years that this filter has been in production.  And this one continues to sell today.  This design has a lot going for it.  It is inexpensive to purchase, reliable, easy to set up, easy to clean, and the replacement media are affordable.This filter is what is known as a HOB (hangs on the back of the aquarium) power filter.  The hang-on-the-back power filter design usually cater to the casual aquarist.  That is not to say that advanced aquarists do not use them.  It is just that there are other filter designs that do a better job of mechanical, chemical, and biological filtration than the simple power filter.  The main advantage to the power filter is the ease of set up.  There are no hoses to cut, and holes do not need to be drilled into the fish tank.  A small motor-driven impeller pulls water from the tank, passes it through the filter media, and then releases the water back into the tank.  All this is done by sending the water over the top edge of the tank.I can recommend this Aquaclear to someone with a freshwater tank of less than 20 gallon capacity.  It runs reliably and quietly.  If you hear a lot of noise coming from the filter, please remove the energizer (motor) and check the impeller.  Also, make sure that the inlet tube is fully inserted on top of the impeller well.  The mechanical filter is basically a coarse sponge.  You can rinse this sponge out to remove excess debris and put it back in the filter.  Just be sure to rinse it out using dechlorinated water, or waste water from the tank itself.  Unless this sponge becomes hopelessly clogged with debris (possible if you have live plants), you will not need to replace it.  The ceramic rings that are included were designed to provide a place for beneficial bacteria to colonize and attach to.  The carbon pack will need to be replaced.  How often will depend on your tank's particular situation.A canister filter will usually provide superior mechanical and chemical filtration capabilities in comparison.  However, depending on the design, maintenance will usually consume more of your time.  Wet/Dry filtration provides superior bio filtration, but will usually be more expensive.  The Penguin (Marineland) power filter brand, with their bio-wheel, is said to be better at biological filtration than this and most other competing power filter design.  It is priced competitively with the Aquaclear.  However, with the Penguin, you will have to regularly buy their filter media.  The Aquaclear gives you more flexibility and more room in the filter box.  I have used an Emperor 400 in the past on a large cichlid tank.  The Emperor, which is similar in design to the Penguins, was made by Marineland.  Very good design, but again, you will have to purchase their filter media on a regular basis.  With the Aquaclear, you can buy your own filter bag, buy carbon in bulk, and save money over the life of the filter.Why 4 stars instead of 5?  The design allows for a lot of water by-pass.  Power filters allow for some by-pass to compensate for clogged filter pads.  The Aquaclears seem to allow more by-pass than its competitors.  Also, because of the coarse design of the mechanical filter sponge, a lot of the smaller particles pass through.  The prepackaged carbon bag fits snugly in the filter box of this filter, perhaps packing the carbon granules tighter than they need to be.  The water simply just flows around the bag and only makes contact with the carbon on the edges of the bag.  I have also found that the carbon media is not very good at removing tannins from mopani wood from the water.This is a very inexpensive filter to maintain.  I know a fellow hobbyist who does not use carbon.  He just rinses the sponge during his water changes, puts it back in, and turns the filter back on.  His only expense with this filter was the initial purchase price.  I use carbon, so there is a little bit of regular expense for me.  But there are those who choose not to use carbon.  Some cichlid keepers blame carbon as a possible cause of Hole-in-the-Head disease.  I am not an expert and clearly the issues of carbon's relationship to this disease is beyond my qualifications to discuss.  Since I no longer keep cichlids, I have continued to use carbon.
summary: Satisfactory Performance in a classic power filter

reviewText: I have older aquaclear filters that are dead silent.  The newer Hagen filters are far from that.  I'm on my 2nd AC110 do to impeller noise.I went through 4 flucal C2 filters before i got one that stayed a tolerable noise levels.Their customer service has gone down the hole too.  Sure, they offer to repair/replace parts, but demand you send in your defective filter first. Being a company that deals in fish supplies, they should know that the filter is the main component keeping your fish alive.  So basically they know you can't send in your part and you are forced to buy another filter, or live with the default.  I feel bad making amazon send me replacement filters for something as small as an unbalanced impeller. Hagen should just send the replacement parts first, then we could send back the defective unit with out having to buy another filter or risking any harm to the fish.  Other filter companies send replacement parts with minimal questions asked and often don't ask for the faulty piece back.This will probably be the last Hagen filter i buy after the quality issues I've had with my new AC110 and Fluval filters.
summary: They don't make them like they use to

reviewText: I picked this up for my brackish 46 gallon tank.  I liked it because I could replace the media with bulk media (using a drawstring mesh bag). It's a little overkill for this setup, but it keeps the water super clean.  I've got 3 puffers and a load of guppies in there and 0 nitro, 0 nitra, and 0 ammonia.  Water changes every 2-3 weeks and no issues.  I had a puffer die and when I took it to the store, they were confounded on how clean the water was.
summary: Great pump, affordable price, replacable media

reviewText: This filter is truly amazing. This is my second filter that I've bought only to add it to my new 75 gallon tank. It worked amazingly in my 29 gallon tall. My water was always crystal clear as long as i did my normal weekly water changes. I love that you can customise how you want to filter your water. I personally do a sponge on bottom, bio media in middle and another sponge on top. I have not yet replaced any of the supplies that they give you because I dont believe they need to be replaced at their reccomended time frame. My aquarium is always crytal clear and my fish love it too. Great filter. Would reccomend to anyone for H.O.B. filter.

after 4 month it still works very well , almost no maintenance needed, easy setup, the current is just right so the fish's aren't bothered by it. The only bad thing is you need to pour water into the filter before starting it otherwise it won't run. Overall the best filter you can get.

I run 2 of these on a salt water macro algae tank.. They work good, but for a while I had clogging issues from the sand getting sucked in. Since running them for the past 7 months they are doing great.
Filter worked fine for 3.5 months and then died.  Never had a filter that quit after such a short period of time.

This pump is rated for a 50 gal tank, I have a 36 gallon freshwater fish tank. It works very well. Came with a two suction tubes, but I had to purchase another tube to reach the bottom of my tank. The instructions tell you that you can slow the flow rate by moving the suction tube to the right or to the left, I find this questionable as I have seen no difference. This is a good product over all I recommend it.

Alright so this has everything to be a great filter: flow adjuster, bio media, filter sponge, charcoal, and to top it off it's a great price. The only problem is that it's loud as heck! I had to return it because I keep my aquarium in my room and there is no way I could sleep with the noise. Actually the noise bothered me even when I was awake in the room. It sounds like a knocking noise coming from the motor. I disassembled it and cleaned the motor and impeller but to not avail. So I ended up returning it. I guess I'm gonna stick with my Tetra Whisper filter. Although the Tetra also has its downfalls, it's at least as quiet as its name suggests. I give the aquaclear 3 stars because it has all the right stuff but not the right noise level. There's also the possibility that I got a faulty product (even though I have read countless forum entries about the same problem). Anyway, keep this in mind when you consider purchasing!

I have two of these on two different aquariums. The one I bought locally is very quiet, the one from Amazon not so much. These are great filters and work wonderfully but for the same price pick one up locally so it's easy to take back if it's loud..

Don't save 20 bucks because you'll end up buying more filters and having to listen to a loud filter even through the name probably implies that it isn't.  This is the real thing.  Adjustable flow and nice filtering system.  Buy this with confidence.  The extra bucks will save you in the long run.
Great flow rate and very easy to use and clean. The media basket that comes with it makes this the easiest filter I have ever had to clean. Gives great circulation in my 10 gallon reef aquarium.

I wish I had gotten the 70 for my 29 gallon but other than that I'm happy with this purchase. It moves a good bit of water and looks nice. I really like how I can buy cheap media baggies here on amazon and use my own carbon and fiber media saving $$. Always get the highest GPH you can afford as more is always better.
summary: Nice filter. Allows for using own media.

reviewText: This is 2nd one bought to be used as a backup filter for my 60 gallon tank, so I do recommend buying one. It works well to complement my Rena xP3. Very quiet as in the motor, gives the water flow sound, which is good for some people, myself included. Because my tank have live plants, sand substrate and cichlids, the filter does get clogged a lot.  Have to clean it biweekly. Love buying it via Amazon, fast delivery and cheaper than everyone else on this particular item!

I did a lot of research on filters before I purchased this and had considered a number of different brands before deciding on this one.  The driver of my decision was that this filter is small and has an adjustable flow rate which you sometimes don't get on smaller filters.  More importantly I like that the filter is customizable and allows you to configure the media any way you want.  You can add charcoal, foam, biomax, or some other item of your choice.  I'm running it with the foam sponge and some seachem matrix which is working well.  It seems easy to clean and is very quiet.  I would highly recommend it especially for planted aquariums due to how you can customize it.
summary: Great filter for my 5 gallon planted aquarium.

reviewText: this may not be the most powerful filter in the market but it really does an excellent job. i bought this for a small tank for my fish in my pond so that they can be indoor during the winter. the water is always crystal clear and doesn't stink. just make sure you always clean the foam filter and the propeller of the pump as it always have a lot of waste in it. if you can, make an extension of the pipe down to the bottom as this only includes one extension. you can buy a flexible pipe with the same diameter in your hardware store. the sound created by the waterfall largely depends on the height of the water in the tank. less water in the tank means more splashing sound. i just use the flow control during feeding time so that the food will not be sucked in to the pump other wise it is better to keep it fully open for optimized filtration, "natural" waterfall look and sound.

So I recently did the hunt for a new power filter for my 55 aquarium. I saw alot of positive reviews for this filter so I bought one... Wow. This simple but POWERFUL filter does an exceptional job filtering my tank.I also have a Peguin 200 power filter. Now this filter is what drove me to get a new one. You have to purchase insert filters and replace them regularly, which can be expensive and I think even wasteful. Also, the biowheel would often stop spinning after a few days.So when I was looking for a new filter I wanted one with easy maintenance and would also allow you to rinse and reuse.This aquaclear filter runs powerful, cleans the water using the three important steps, and allows me to customize my media inside it.Looking at my tank now, I have both the new Aquaclear 70 running on one end, and my Penguin on the opposite. The water is like glass and the fish do indeed to be floating in nothing.I have a overstock tank, lots of big and messy fish and lots of cories who snuffle along the bottom at all times. The water is pristine and there is no odor from the tank.Really impressed with the filter.
summary: This filter does the job! And then some.

reviewText: I have this and the Fluval C4 in a 55gal tank and I must say I like them both. However, I give a slight edge to the Fluval only because I like the way the media is stored. The Fluval's media is stored in individual vertical cartridges whereas the AquaClear's media is layered on top of each other. When it's time for cleaning or changing media, the Fluval is just more convenient. I think there both good filters. Watch some video reviews on both if you're not sure. Heck, one reviewer even compares the 2 filters. I don't think you can go wrong with either one. Just my 2.

These filters are awesome.  Nice and quiet.  Adjustable water flow.  And the fact that you can basically customize your filter media is great.  Only 2 things keep these from being perfect.  The main thing is the gallon size they are rated for.  In my opinion, if it says good for 10 to 30 gallon size tank, for example, you are better off putting it in the smallest size of the range listed.  The one I got for my 30 gallon tank just seems a wee bit too small to really handle a full 30 gallons, so I ordered a larger size and will be putting this 30 gallon rated one on my 10 gallon tank.  The second thing is if you customize your filter media, make sure you weight it down somehow.  Was having a problem with my media (filter floss) floating to the top making the bio max sit completely above the water in the filter.  Using the manufacturer's media (which I am sure they recommend) does not result in this problem, the sponges that come with these are firmly held in place by tabs in the media basket.  Bottom line...these are as close to perfect as you can get.

We purchased this filter for our 29 gallon aquarium and it seems to be working as promised so far.  However, we have sand substrate and if it manages to get into the filter, it will stop working.  We had to unplug it and take it apart to clear the sand out of the propeller area so that it would run again.

Great filter.  Have not had any of the buzzing noises like some others have had.  Very quiet and cleans my tank very well.  highly recommend.UPDATE:  9/13/13My filter has run very well until now.  The motor has now stopped working.  In the beginning on a warranty claim with Hagen.

I bought this after being impressed with Hagens HOB line of filters (I bought the Fluval C4's first). I needed or actually just wanted to try these Aquaclears that everyone raves about on one of my larger tanks. I was a bit skeptical at first about these filters (I was a Marineland fan... still kinda am)but I am very impressed. They do an awesome job at filtration and are easy to maintain. I would describe them as simple, low maintenace, very powerful, and effective. I have not yet run into any of the problems that others have complained about. I think to break them you have to be doing something wrong. There is no reason why they should not work for you and if they do die on you or you have any problems... Hagen has GREAT cutomer service. I had a slight problem with reciving cracked covers due to shipping, but it was resolved through Hagen customer service. They also say you must do regular maintenance with your Aquaclear as the sponge will get clogged which will lead to the basket floating and causing a flood. I have remedied this by buying a Filtermax III prefilter which fits perfectly on the Aquaclear. This prefilter has cut down the maintenace on the Aquaclear dramatically. Since I've owned my Filtermax III/ Aquaclear 110 combo I have only cleaned the internal sponge once. To be honest it wasnt even dirty! Most of the detrius is stopped by the Filtermax which I clean every couple of weeks. It cleans very simply and quickly in just a bucket of tankwater. Some others also complain that it wont prime itself/restart after a power outage. I do not have this problem at all. This problem has more to do with how low you choose to keep your water level. In conclusion: If your looking for great HOB's look no further than Hagen. I recommend the Fluval C4's for smaller tanks and the Aquaclear 110 for everything else. The smaller Aquaclears would be great for smaller tanks too, but I really like the Fluval C4's. If they made a Fluval C5 to match the Aquaclear I would probably buy that instead.
summary: Probably the BEST large HOB on the market today!

reviewText: I love the filter. I have six freshwater aquaria and each has an Aquaclear filter. Just don't be tempted to save a few dollars and order from warehouse deals. It was missing media, missing parts, and the parts that were there were broken.  Of course, Amazon, being the great company that it is, handled it - refunded my money and scheduled a pick up. All I had to do was put it back in the box and put it out for UPS.This is the fourth time I have made a purchase from warehouse deals. Their packing is terrible and everything has arrived broken. From Amazon direct or one of their many sellers I have never had anything but perfection!!
summary: Never ever buy from warehouse deals

reviewText: No complaints, clear housing makes it easy to clean, efficient and quiet filter. Easy to remove motor/coil means I can clean the impeller much easier than on marineland. And unlike marineland I haven't had the impeller fail and start rubbing/buzzing.

Well I actually had to  go through quite some trouble to get this filter delivered to me but it finally came. The setup was quite simple and I followed the instructions. Everything was assembled fairly quickly and easy but for some reason my package didn't come with a level. So far I'm pleased with the power of the filtration and the overall look. For the first few hours this filter was very quite and I couldn't even tell it was running. I went to the grocery store to buy some stuff and when I came back I noticed it was making more noise then before. I searched on YouTube to see if anybody else is having the same issue and it seems people are. A lot of people say it's the propeller in the motor that causes a rattling noise. I'm not one to complain about the noise because I've had louder filters before but I expected this one to be as nice and quite as when I first installed it. I'm not going to lie though after a while or at least at night when I'm trying to go the bed seeing as my tank is in the same room I sleep in the noise gets a bit annoying. I'm seeing on YouTube that the only fix is to take off the motor and lubricate the propeller. I'm going to have to remove the motor eventually to clean it out but I just find it a bit tedious to have to grease the impeller every now and then so it doesn't make that damn noise. I've read some people say that after a while the filter will settle down and break in and stop making so much noise I really hope that's the case. If not then I might have to keep this filter for as long as I can and then look to replace it with something else. It sucks that I had to go through so much trouble to get this filter hoping that it would be the perfect product but sadly it felt short. I will make an update if things get better but if not then this will be my final word. The product looks good and is assembled with ease and runs at a decent price but it has a noise issue well at least for me. I wouldn't say steer away from this filter but just know that you might encounter the same problem. I really had high hopes for this filter so maybe its my fault for expecting it to be flawless but for now I just have to deal with it until I find a solution.**Update**I used the Vaseline trick and it seemed to make a major difference the rattling noise isn't as loud anymore. It's not to say that the noise is completely gone because it's not but I can say it's been minimized to a nice hum. I don't know how long this fix will last I'm pretty sure it's only temporary and I will probably need to lubricate the impeller shaft eventually. For those of you who are having the same issue just type "Aquaclear 20 noise" in the YouTube search bar and you will find a few videos showing you how to do it. So good luck to all of you who decide to purchase this filter and for those who have the rattling noise note that there is a fix for it so don't give up.
summary: Rattling noise but there's a fix

reviewText: If you are experienced with fish keeping, then you know you want 10gph per gallons of water in your tank.The Aquaclear 70 with 300 gph flow was amazing for my 40 gallon tank, with a red eared slider (very messy huge bioload), and several fish.The filtration media capacity is huge, you can use 4-5 different types of media, and the carbon that goes with it lasted well over a month. You can buy their pre-filled bags of media, or just buy bags and fill your own for a savings. It's easy to take apart to clean, the only issues i've had were when sand kicked up into the filter and it started buzzing loudly. This is fixed by easily disassembling the impeller (takes 30 seconds or less to take apart and put together) and cleaning it out.It couldn't quite handle my 75 gallon tank, no surprise there. So I have this and a 100 gallon cascade canister on it now and my tank went from toxic to cycled in record time (4-5 days), with the aid of seachem stability.These two filters together are a force to be reckoned with. I went from dirty icky sandy muddy water, to crystal clear over night. Not to mention that my 40 gallon stayed crystal clear with just this filter.

Bought this for a 20 gallon tank. My water was cloudy and full of stuff with the filter that came in an aquarium set. This filter worked too well to begin with, churning up all the molding food in the gravel which had to be scooped out (need to stop overfeeding.) After a few days my water was clear and my fishies a lot happier-looking. The pump is clearly more powerful than the typical ones that come with kits so I strongly recommended others to upgrade.

This filter seems to be very good value for money and so far, has run like a charm. I like it mainly because it is very quiet. My previous model filter had a cover that just sat on top and it was prone to rattling and vibrating on occasion. The cover on this filter snaps into place and that keeps it from having that vibratory noise problem. It has good water flow and keeps the tank very clean. What I don't like about it is the suction tube does not go as deep as I would like, even with the extender. I also don't think the three part filter system is any more effective than the usual mesh and charcoal filters that are much more common. I understand the concept of keeping the biological aspects of the filter intact by staggering when you change the individual parts, but if your tank is established and you leave just a little of the charcoal behind, you can achieve the same effect without having to try to remember what you should be changing next. Ultimately, I have to give this filter five stars for its quietness and steady running ability. Although a little bit harder to clean, it seems that you can just rinse everything off and reuse it - probably for quite a while - so eventually, I'll be saving money compared to filters that require completely changing out every time you clean them. The filtering mechanism requires more detailed maintenance, but it should also require less frequent maintenance to make up for that. Therefore, I'm of a mind that this filter is hard to beat for your typical mid-size freshwater aquarium.
summary: Some minor drawbacks, but still great

reviewText: Best Filter we have ever had, the water is crystal clear  (so clear we seen fish we didn't know we had....kidding) but no kidding the filter is much better than the one we were using for two years. Very Pleased

I have had aquariums for several years and this power filter is one of the best out there. It uses a three chamber system to clean and deoderize and keep aquariums freed up of any floating debris or nasty bug. There is the sponge which filters out any little nasties floating around in the water, there is a bag of charcoal to keep the water clean and free of ammonia build up, and there is a chamber for media which allows positive bacteria to grow and help build the invisible filter.
This filter is the best brand of hang-off-the-back filter you can buy. AquaClear makes a filter that is easy to clean and maintain while also operating very quietly.
This filter is quiet and has 3 parts to it , foam, carbon and ceramic.  I've had two operating for over a year with no problems.

Cheaply made but u can't go wrong with these I use aquaclears at all of my fresh water accounts simple filters last forever replace carbon 2 times a year ... very easy to add other filter media  ThoseFishGeeks . Com
I have to say this filter is really quiet. You wont notice its there. It has a lot of media and simple design. It also slimmer than most filters.

It all started in middle school-------------------------------I was a big tropical hobbyist in my middle school days but somehow fell out of the routine. This year, I decided on rekindling this passion. I already had a 10-gallon set up that was recently vacated by my 12-year old goldfish, so I decided to switch gears and go back to tropical fish.Other filters good. AquaClear better-------------------------------------I started off my aquarium with a Biowheel filter. It was working well, but the water conditions never seemed to be quite clear enough for me. I read the positive reviews on the AquaClear and decided to pick one up from Amazon.com. The one I chose was the AquaClear 20 for my tank.The AquaClear is very configurable as you can setup the filter cage anyway you would like to. Typically, this means the foam filter at the bottom, the carbon pack in the middle, and the ceramic bio-rocks at the top. But you can also replace the carbon with any media you want from water softeners to nitrate removers. I decided to swap out the carbon with a nitrate remover.Clear water. Happy fish-----------------------My Biowheel filter worked well and the water was clear, but my tropical fish would all go to the opposite side of the tank because the water agitation from the water return was just too strong for them. After installing the AquaClear, after two-days, the tank is amazingly crystal clear (more so than the Biowheel) and the activity in my aquarium is quite good. The fish are spread out all over the tank and they really do seem happier.No noise---------There have been reports of this filter being overly noisy but I did not find this to be the case with my AquaClear 20. As a preemptive measure, I lubricated the propeller shaft with a slight coating of Vaseline, as has been pointed out on the Internet as a cure for noisy AquaClears. I used a toothpick to coat the the shaft and bushing. Upon start up and priming the filter, there is absolutely no noise coming from the motor. The only sounds are from the waterfall return gently replacing the filtered water back into the tank.I'm a believer---------------The AquaClear filter is a good buy and may very well be the last aquarium filter you purchase unless you're moving up to a bigger tank, of course.Few products do what they claim but the AquaClear is an exception and fulfills everything it is reported to do--clear, healthy water. They also have a lifetime guarantee on their filters against defects in materials or workmanship under normal operating circumstances. They evidently believe in the quality of their products and now, I do too.
summary: The best aquarium filter at a reasonable price

reviewText: Works like a charm! Easy to set up and put together. instructions are easy to read. I like how I can adjust the amount of flow, very useful!

I am usually a diehard canister filter user for my aquariums, but when setting up a couple of small tanks at home (a 6 gallon salt and a 8 gallon fresh), I wanted to try a power filter again.  While I used to use power filters when I first started in the hobby about 12 years ago, I moved to canisters due to their versatility and ability to handle a larger bio-load.  The appeal of the AquaClears was that they were reputed to be quiet, as well as have some versatility in their media capacity.  They are well-reviewed on aquarist sites such as planted tank.net and others, so I thought I'd give them a try.  After a few months, I'm very satisfied.  While I still want canisters for my heavier-stocked tanks, they AquaClears have worked well, and they are very affordable.  A recommended product.

The AquaClear line has been available for many years. You can't beat them for dependability, ease of maintenance and low operating cost. I have kept fresh and salt tanks for over 30 years and I always go back to the Aquaclear power filters.I have tried many different types including canisters, wet-dry, but IMO these filters are so easy to keep which means you will do your required maintenance instead of neglecting it, plus if you purchase your own media bags, you can save a lot of $$$ buying your media in bulk. The included foam filter lasts forever, & of course the included ceramic bio-rings just need to be rinsed as needed in a container of your tank water when necessary. The only outlay would be for carbon or whatever media you wish to utilize.I would recommend to my friends.

Just changed from cartridge-based Aqueon filter--never made sense to me why anyone would completely remove good bacteria from a filter.  This simply makes much more sense to have semi-permanent biological media to keep the filter and tank healthy.That said, I'm used to my Fluval 406 cannister filter and was curious as to why AquaClear/Fluval/Hagen did not employ some sort of modular media baskets for this as they do in their cannisters.  No big deal as it's fairly compact, but would make changes easier.  I would also say that the plastic case looks cheap.  Not sure if Fluval changed this materially with their new version.Anyway, great product that does the job for a good price.  Can't complain too much.
Quiet and efficient. I have Aqua Clear filters on all of my tanks. Easy to clean and reliable. Highly recommended.
Hagen and aquaclear are great product lines and perform well definitely worth having and makes aquarium maintenance a little easier

It is a common mod online to make this a refugium and after a little epoxy I can see why.  This filter has a very large space for mechanical filtration, chemical filtration, macro algae, live rock, a sand bed, and a heater. The flow is a bit much for a 10 gallon SW tank so you will either need to build a diverted for the front out of plexi or replace the impeller with the 30 model.As a regular filter it seems like it would work well but as far as changing the cartridges it looks a little more difficult then on a bio-wheel type model.  This model is quieter than my bio-wheel-type filter (similar size) and based on appearances you get more filtration with this (larger amounts of media).
summary: The best HOB mainstream filter to use as a refugium.

reviewText: AquaClear is a great product! has always made a great product since I could ever remember. I am always happy with good customer service.

I needed to upgrade to a larger power filter (I upgraded to a larger aquarium).  I was using the Aquaclear 50.  The Aquaclear 50 did a great job and it was very quiet.  The Aquaclear 70 does a great job too, but it is very loud.  Almost too loud.  I can take the lid off and it helps, but the noise is coming from the filter motor.  It is not a vibration noise. I already exchanged it for another one because I thought the loudness was a defect.  I was wrong.  If you have your aquarium in a family room where you spend alot of time, this power filter is too loud.
summary: Does the job but VERY loud

reviewText: Unit was great until the motor died after six months.  A replacement motor from manufacturer costs more than the whole unit.
This filter is quiet and keeps my tank clear. Good value too! It's also easy to clean and change the media. You can add your own media as well.

So ive had this running on my freshwater setup. It hasn't disappointed me yet. They could make a better filter body. That little stud on the bottom to balance the box is so f***ing annoying. it pops out one to many times. They'll come a time where it will no longer stay in place. Why not just makle a "normal" HOB like all other company. Hang & forget it.
summary: Aqua is clear fo the most part

reviewText: This (Aquaclear 20) is also the same filter included with Fluval Edge tank, and is very quiet and does it job cleaning the tank.I bought AC20 for my hospital tank and cleans it as it should.What I like about aquaclears compared to other hang on the back filters, is that you don't need to keep on buying filter cartridges. The included foam and ceramic filter should last you a couple of years. Just wash them gently form the water from your tank, or water treated with antichlorine stuff, to preserve the beneficial bacteria.Enough said, highly recommended!

I love the fact that you can change the media to your liking and the needs of the tank's environment. That is what sold it for me. I am not against filter cartridges, its just that I like the time in-between having to change the media and the ease of maintenance. The flow of water is smoother than another brand which I'll keep unnamed. Who needs the hood of the tank saturated with water all of the time, especially with the most likely lights installed there.Overall, this is an easy to set up, optional media configuration based, sturdy, and very effective HOB filter. The clear case is a definite plus as it allows you to visually inspect and makes it easier to clean. There was a little noise at first setup, but what do you expect from a fish tank with a HOB filter? That noise (which wasn't that bad) had subsided quite a bit in just under a week.You can't go wrong with this purchase. The bio media is very effective, and the filter runs very smooth--without excessive splash. Other benefits are: easy to load media and reduced media change requirements as compared to other typical HOBs. *Extend the foam and BIOMAX recommended replacement cycles: rinse foam in tank water, and do the same with the biomax (just inspect for deterioration).
I purchased this filter for my 29 gallon freshwater tank and it's doing a great job.  The water is beautifully clear and the filter is very quiet.

I use this filter on at least 4 or 5 of my tanks, from 20L to 55, and they all work well. The physical filtration sponge is great. I use just the sponge and biomax (double biomax on high-bioload tanks). These filters are easy to clean, reliable, and don't clog easily.

I purchased this filter after reading allot of reviews and I am very pleased. I have it in my 75 gallon tank and it works great and keeps the water clean and filters everything great. I will purchase another smaller one for my 55 gallon and 30 gallon tanks since they work so much better and are allot cheaper to keep clean and running.

After I got tired of of playing with my Marineland Penguin 200, which never worked quite correctly (I think it was defective), I decided to try the Aquaclear 50, which I had seen recommended often in various online forums and reviews. It has been cited as a HOB filter that performs more like a canister filter.This filter does indeed mimic a canister filter. It contains a large sponge, carbon bag (which is somewhat costly to replace, but, as you know, can be easily modified) and media bag filled with noodles to increase biological filtration. When this filter performs, it performs well.So, why the two stars? There are two qualities about this filter that make it ultimately undesirable: 1. It is difficult to use, 2. It is unreliable.Let me first talk about its difficulty. Putting this together and inserting the media are quite easy; getting it started is another thing. It comes with a leveling device to help make sure this is level on the tank. This device repeatedly pops out of its slot, to the point that I have to search for it on the floor behind my tank stand every time I service the tank. Priming it is another problem. This is one of the trickiest HOB filters to prime. One of the main reasons I disposed of my Penguin 200 is that it was a great challenge to prime. As I mentioned, I think the Penguin was defective. The Aquaclear is even more challenging to prime, and I think it is meant to work this way. (I have another Aquaclear on a separate tank that behaves the same way.) Sometimes, I have to disassemble the entire filter before I can prime it. "You must be doing something wrong," someone is thinking right now. No. I'm sorry. If I have to use a level on a HOB filter before I can properly use it, then the filter is at fault, not me.The other major problem with this filter is that it is unreliable. It is not self-priming. I often have to leave town for several days, and I like having the peace of mind that, after a power outage, my filtration will continue to operate. What good is an effective system of filtration if it fails to work?But, you say, the Aquaclear provides the best biological filtration available in a HOB filter. If you want effective biological filtration in a HOB filter that is also self-priming and reliable, you won't find one on the market. However, if you buy aTetra Whisper Power Filter 60, 60-Gallonand fill it withMarineland PA11486 Canister Filter Bio-Balls PC 160-360, 90-BioBalls, you will have biological filtration that is just as effective as that provided by the Aquaclear in a filter that is self-priming and easy to use.If that doesn't appeal to you, buy aAqueon 06117 QuietFlow 50 Power Filter, 250-GPHand shove a piece of bio-sponge in the back behind the cartridges. The Aqueon filters are totally self-priming and never fail to work after a power outage because of their clever design.With just a simple mod, you can have a filter that is even better than the Aquaclear without the hassle.

I bought this for a 15 gallon tank. I am a first time tank owner and wanted something simple and easy to set up and use. I had no problem assembling it and getting it to work. Have had it for about two months now. It's fairly quiet, will depend how close the water is to it as well. Makes only a light trickle when the water line is two inches away.I have only had it wake me up once when it started making the noise it does when no water/water isn't traveling through it properly. It will be very obvious if this happens if you accidentally unplug it, too.I like that I can change the three pieces or just remove it to rinse them out while the filter keeps running.The only con, which is for aesthetic purposes only, is that the tube that sticks into the tank is a light blue color. It provides weird contrast against my black background and the buildup on it can be seen easier than it can on my black heater. Would like if the unit was all black instead of the motor only being black.The replacement pieces (sponge/carbon/etc) were fairly cheap. My water looks great. When I first put everything in the tank it was murky and cloudy but cleared up within two hours.I have not owned any other filters so cannot provide comparison. I decided on the filter because of the good reviews I have seen on Amazon and would buy it again.
I didn't like this filter at all. It stopped working after 2 weeks. I had to return it and replace it with a different filter.

I own two of these filters for some of my turtles. They are not as loud, and you can adjust the flow rate. The tubes clog easily, but all you need to do is knock the gunk out which is not bad. I found that rinsing the cartridges once a month can help increase their longevity. I defiantly recommend them for fish or turtles.

Pros -1) easy to maintain2) easy t0 use custom media like purigen, Poly media, for polishing water and carbon for removing medication3) does a good job of aerating the waterCons1) it is clear so not so good for bio filtering, (light dramatically reduces the ability of nitrification bacteria)2) Flow rate is dramatically reduced if the water is lower then a couple of inches, so not useful in an amphibian tank.3) aerates the water which is not desirable if using CO2 injection or even on a low tech planted tank4) current flow is poor on the 1/2 of tank opposite the filter (a problem with all waterfall filters). This can be solved by using a circulation pump such at the VicTsing 80 GPH submersible available from amazon.com.I would not recommend this as a primary filter on anything larger then a 10 gallon tank but it is useful as a secondary filter or a primary filter for a 10 gallon isolation/medicine tank. Recently I attached this to an Aquatop submersible UV-5 unit with a short length of garden hose. it works great for this, and the Low GPH makes it effective at level 1 sterilization (killing algae. bacteria  and viruses in the water column for up to a 50 gallon tank).I do not believe in using zeolite (amon chips) and always toss them out. The problem with them is that they will release the ammonia they have absorbed if salt is added to the water. This is very bad as the first step after doing a water change when an ammonia spike occurs is to add salt to the water along with something like seachem prime, If you do not remove the zeolite before doing this then the problem will be compounded.I also do not use carbon on a regular bases. It is great for taking medicine out of the water, but beyond that it is not good for much.. First it is only effective for 2 weeks or so. Second it not only takes out some of the bad stuff it also takes out a lot of the good trace elements needed by fish and plants. Something like Seachem Purigen is much more effective at taking out the bad stuff without taking out the good stuff.Note: I did not buy this from amazon.

AquaClears are one of my favorite brands of hang on the back filters. They are fairly compact, well-made, affordable, and easy to set up, use, and clean.The media baskets in AC filters are quite large compared to many other filters, so you can cram quite a lot in there if you want to. The media is stacked in the tray vertically, so the coarse sponge should be on the bottom, with the biological media and fine filtration on top of that. I also use a cut up sponge on the intake as a prefilter to protect the impeller from any sand that might get kicked up from the bottom. The sponges are inexpensive and can be reused for quite a long time if you clean them regularly.The flow rate of the water can be adjusted by rotating the intake tubing away from the impeller, which is good when you are feeding and want the food to stay at the surface. I usually allow the filter to run at maximum flow most of the time and use a baffle I made from an old soft drink bottle to keep from agitating the water too much. I would recommend getting one filter size up from the tank you plan on using it for though. I use the AC50 on a 20g tank, and I feel that it is an appropriate amount of filtration. Without the baffle it may have been too much agitation, however it works very well with my setup.Overall I would say that an AquaClear filter is a good investment for most tanks. I don't think there is much more to say, but if you have a question feel free to ask and I will do my best to answer.
summary: AquaClear 50 - Solid performing filter for a decent price

reviewText: I'm using this on a 29 gallon freshwater and it keeps the water clean.  It's pretty quiet, not as quiet as the Aquaclear 20 that it replaced, but it does a better job than the 20 did.  People say it won't start again if the power goes out but it did for me, I don't know how long the power was out but the UPS on the PC was about dead as well so it was awhile.This is a good filter. I like it.

Now that I have had this for 18 months or more I'm very happy I spend less money and less time on my aquarium in keeping it clean I usually receive complements on its clarity from visiters. I pull the basket every week to 10 days and clean and put back takes 5 minutes. About every 2 or 3 months I remove and clean the whole filter inside all the plastic parts easy to remove and clean  this maybe takes 20 minutes.  Only other thing is bottom cleaning and sponge the glass on the inside every couple a weeks after cleaning bottom and sides stirring up po this filter clears  up my 50 gallon tank in an hour or two. I use a lower power light and this keeps algea way down takes a couple a weeks to notice any. This is with four large goldfish and they are about 10 inches large and poo factories.  Highly recommend this Aquaclear filter
summary: Best filter I have used very economical

reviewText: My recent purchase of an Aquaclear 70 HOB (hang on back of tank filter) will make this my 8Th Aquaclear.  I have five Aquaclear 20's - three on guppy tanks, and two kept as spares in the event of a breakdown. However, in over a year of constant service, I have yet to have an Aquaclear HOB filter's electric motor burn out.Moreover, one must take care to turn these filters off when you are using a sand substrate which is being stirred up in the tank, since the sand can get into the motor and cause it to run roughly, or seize up.Even if this happens, all it usually takes to get these motors running again is to remove them from the filter housing, remove the impeller from the housing on the motor and clean the unit with water and a q-tip.Once you have done so, the motor will usually begin to run properly again.I also own an Aquaclear 50 which I now keep on my 10 gallon tank, and an Aquaclear 110 which I use to filter a heavily planted 20 long tank with about 16 fish.So the extra filtering ability of the Aquaclear 110 is nice to have.As for the Aquaclear 70, this will be replacing the Aquaclear 50 which I used to filter my 37 gallon tank, and have now moved to my 10 gallon.The Aquaclear 70 will be used in conjunction with a Fluval 305 canister filter for redundant filtration.The Fluval 305, like the Aquaclear, is another Hagen product.  It seems like virtually every product that is sold for the aquarist is manufactured by a subsidiary of Hagen's.The 305 is also a very cleverly designed filter,  which works quite well, and is very easy to maintain, thanks to Fluval's patented Aquastop feature; the Aquastop fitting allows you to disconnect the 305 from its tubing without losing  suction, so that you don't have to reprime the unit once you've dumped the water from its container during a filter change.All you do is reconnect the Aquastop fitting to the top of the 305's canister, and then  open the flow valve until the 305 fills with water.You must open the valve partially to avoid creating a tremendous amount of turbulance in your aquarium, since if you open it all the way while filling the 305, the air bubbles will race out of the 305's exhaust tube disturbing your fish.As for the controvery between which canister is best, many people who consider the purchase of a Fluval also consider buying an Eheim, and there are those who own both.  The Eheim - Fluval debate reminds this author of the Chevy-Ford controversy, regarding the merits of each.Moreover, I have owned both and  find that Fluval and Eheim both make excellent canister filters.  However, the Fluval's internal setup is much easier to use, given the trays Fluval includes to add filter media to, while the Eheim Classic series (I'm not certain if the other Eheim filters are the same way) just stack the media atop one another, making for a more complex arrangement, since the Eheim's filter media is in not in a tray.Both filters are well made and reliable.  However,  one must take care to re-lubricate the Fluval's o-ring after each cleaning to ensure that it does not dry out, since this will prevent the unit from leaking onto your floor. And careful removal of the impeller housing will ensure that the impeller that does not get damaged.After more than a year with the Aquaclear series of filters, as well as the several months with a Fluval 305, I must say that I am very pleased with these units.  They are cleverly designed, well constructed, and should last for years provided that they are properly maintained.Jim
summary: Aquaclear Filters Are Simply The Most Cleverly Designed HOB Filters On The Market

reviewText: I have been using Aquaclear filters for at least 15 years.  I have run a variety of tanks, 10, 20 and 50 gallon.  each tank stays crystal clear and maintain healthy bacterial cultures.This system is easy to set up and good for a beginner. Its inexpensive to maintain as well.

reviewText: I bought one of these to replace my pos aquatech 5-15 and i could not be happier. My only issue was solved with a prefilter sponge as i kept getting fry sucked into the filter they were not killed but instead ended up swimming around in the filter till i removed them and sent them home...My water is clear and it cleared quickly the flow is gentle and my fish love it...
summary: Only issue i have is the intake strainer

reviewText: These little filters are incredible for the price!  I have two of them on a 55 gallon Mbuna cichlid tank and they keep the water crystal clear.  Very easy to setup, install and do maintenance on!  It's also very nice that you get a sponge, carbon packet and bioballs with it!  Highly recommended!
summary: The best power filters money can buy on a budget!

reviewText: I've used many filters in my time and this one is hands down the best. Amazon has great prices and shipping as usual.  This filter has chemical, mechanical, and biological filtration.  Most HOB (hang on back) filters do, most dont do all three, but some do. Those that do such as Penguin, for example, are nice filters but for the money they are not worth it compared the aquaclear. Also, penguins parts (like the overly marketed BIOWheel) are hard to find, expensive, and not all that convienent to replace. Aquaclear is quick, easy, QUIET, and gets the job done!
