My poor cat is 8 and a half years old and he went without food for 48 hours!!!!  We feel so terrible and guilty.  I'm returning this piece of &#$*$*#
summary: BEWARE!!! If you love your pet DON'T buy this

reviewText: This is a great food bowl for a pet. I have had mine for over a year and a half now, and it has worked perfectly each and every day. We tried the electronic feeder that spills food down into the bowl, but that would often send down two feedings at once, not good for our cat who we are trying to keep on a diet. We like that we can program this device to portion control feedings several times EACH day instead of every 6 or 12 hours etc.. We can safely and assuredly portion control our cat's food every day according to his activity schedule. We change it as the seasons change and his activity changes. He knows when it turns and he is happy. It is very well built, and our 18 lb cat can't turn it even when he throws a tantrum between meal times. I just now bought a back up unit because we are so dependent on this for our cat's happiness and our peace of mind. For this price, if it lasts for another six months who can complain? It might last for years more. I wanted to give a fair review from someone who has used this product and has relied on this product for 18 solid months--even when we have gone away for the weekend leaving the cat home unattended. No more worries. The batteries last forever, but I still replace them every six months because feeding our cat is a top priority, of course. This Petsafe electronic automatic feeder has never skipped a meal.I hope this helps a little with your decision.
summary: Time tested, accurate and well built

reviewText: This is a wonderful invention. My 7 month old kitten caught right onto the turning noise. He was skittish the first few times of going toward it. And now if he hears it and not hungry he won't even go towards it. Or sometimes he'll nibble alittle and leave some left in the dish and it will be there when it circles back around. It's very cool.

This worked fine for me since I was only looking for an automatic feeder to feed my puppy lunch when I'm not able to get home in time. The trays are actually pretty small. I would only suggest using this for small dogs or cats. Also, the place where you put the battery does not have a cover. My battery hasn't fallen out or anything but I think if your pet was to play around or bump into the feeder, the battery could pop out. I can easily put a piece of tape over it, but why not make this with a battery cover?

We love this product so much, we bought a second unit.  Our cat gained tons of weight while being free-fed.  Now we can control when she eats, have it supply a meal at 7:00 a.m. so she's not howling at us to feed her in the morning, and then we have the second feeder open at noon.  We feed her wet food, by hand, at night.  The problem I had with the other types of gravity units is that 1/4 cup is the minimum allowable.  We need to feed her less than 1/4 cup in each of the two daily dry feedings, and this unit allows you to put as little or as much kibble as needed.  I have not had any of the problems the other reviewers stated (cat being able to push the tray for another feeding, tray not turning, etc.)  The only complaint I have is that the instructions are not that clear and there are no additional trays to purchase while one is in the dishwasher.  I bought the second unit so that I just have to fill the trays every four days instead of every two.  To clarify the instructions, just plug in the time of day when the feeder is to open.  I thought originally that you had to program it for each of the five "trays" to open.  So, one unit has one time plugged in for 7:00 am instead of five 7:00 am's and the other has noon plugged in once.  Tray rotates whatever time(s) you set - not just 12 and 24-hour periods.  Hope that helps.
summary: Life-Saver-Kitty Finally Losing Weight and Not Waking Up Parents

reviewText: We bought one of these bins in a local store several years ago and love it. So when I needed to add a second bin I knew I wanted another one of these! A 30 lb. bag of dog food slides right in, the seal is tight, and the wheels make it so easy to move around. We will definitely have these bins for years to come!

this container is great!!  already had 1 that i use for dog food--holds 25 lbs bag of food easy.  got a 2nd one for cat food---holds a large bag of cat food and still rolls very easy.  have used many different containers for pet food over the years but this is the best!!!!

I didn't know that I would really love these containers so much!!!  My dog & cat food is no longer laying around the kitchen on the floor or in a kitchen chair getting spilled & stale.  I have had no problem with the wheels falling off or anything.  They are very well made products & I'm so glad that I have made my life a little easier & cleaner getting 1 for my dog's food & 1 for my cat's food!!!!

When we purchased "Hill's Science Diet" Dry Dog food for our three dogs, one of these Storage containers was enough.  Now that we have economized and changed to "Purina Benefil?" Dry Dog food, it takes two of these storage containers.  I am glad we purchased three of these.  Two to accomodate regular size kibble and one to store the small dog dry dog food.  Very easy to attach the rollers, no tools needed.  Very easy to manuver around.  Light weight yet seems very sturdy.  It is so much easier than digging down in a big 40-lb paper bag and it keeps the odor of the food enclosed, airtight; as I keep then in the same room with our own people-food storage.  I originally bought one and then when the price was reduced to an unresistable price, I purchased two more.  In both shipments, the time was quick and the packing was very safe.  I was very pleased with my purchase and would recommend them very highly to others.
summary: Great for storing 20-40 lbs of Dog Food.

reviewText: I bought this to hold dry dog food. The bag I normally buy comes in a 15lb size. It holds this much and more. I think it could hold 25lbs of the brand I use. The wheels appear to be optional. They come in a bag for you to install them. I left them off since I have no need to move the container much. The seal seems like it will last and keep the food fresh.It has a small latch to secure it. I have small dogs so this allows me to buy a large bag and maintain it's freshness. It should pay for itself with the savings.
summary: Holds a 20 lb bag with ease

reviewText: I bought this for kitten food and as my cat has grown it's gotten more and more reasonable. It easily holds a 14-pound bag (the largest I can buy) of kitten food and will easily hold larger bags as I start buying cat food. It keeps it fresh, which the bag alone does not, which is great and in the long run really does save money.My only complaint is that the wheels fall off. I may need to empty it out, turn it over, and whack the wheels with a hammer (or glue them in) to get them to stick more thoroughly. It's almost impossible to re-seat a loose wheel with the bin full of food.
summary: Wheels come off from time to time, otherwise perfect

reviewText: Product description accurate.  Holds the food neatly and odor free.  I didn't put the wheels on as even when full, it's easy to slide on floor if needed.  Mostly, it just stays where I keep it.  Good price, too, compared with other containers.

This is just the perfect container.  It has wheels, it opens and stays open easily (for humans that is), is airtight and holds so much food.  Now I buy my huge bag of cat food and just throw it in the container very easily.  It's a lot smaller than you would imagine, but holds so much.  Definitely buy this if you buy your food in bulk.  Works perfectly.

The container holds a 17.5lb bag of Science Diet Indoor Cat Chow with about 3-4 inches to spare. The label says it hold 25lbs of cat chow but I do not see how that is possible. The wheels are nice and the seal is tight.

Bought 2 of these, one for cat food and one for dog food. The wheels and lid were pretty easy to get on without a fuss.Plenty of room left over after dumping in a big 20 lb bag of Purina One cat food, and *almost* had enough room for a 34 lb bag of Purina One dog food so I would say their stated estimates on capacity are pretty much spot on.Unfortunately the containers more short and wide than they are narrow and tall so I have no place to store them side by side or under my kitchen sink.Also, there is no handle or place to grip along the top edges. I was trying to lift and carry the dog food down some steps and I had one hand on the back hinge part of the lid and one hand on the latch and the latch popped open and food went everywhere.The lids also only open 90 degrees, they don't rotate all the way back behind the tub.As long as you're wheeling these around, don't mind storage containers that are squat/short/wide with lids that can't open past 90 degrees and lift them around the middle rather than trying to catch hold under the rim, they're perfectly functional and easier to deal with than the greasy big pet food bags.
summary: Pretty good but could use a few tweaks

reviewText: I use this container to store cat food (we have 6 cats).  We buy the large 18 lb. bags of food, and until getting this container, the bag would just sit on the counter or on the floor, and it looked really messy.  Also we've had a problem with ants, so having the food in this air-tight container is so much better, to keep the food fresh and ant-free, and it looks much better than a big bag of cat food sitting around.  The container is durable, easy to move around, and I like that it is see-through.  Overall I'm pleased with this product and would definitely recommend it!
I bought this to store 30 lbs worth of dry dog food and it works great!  We don't store it in the original bag and just pour it in the container.  Great price too!
summary: Great for storing dry dog food

reviewText: I ordered the Iris 30-qt food storage container with casters. What I received was a bird seed dispenser. I realize mistakes happen so I returned it the same day in the original box along with a copy of my order for the storage container. Instead of sending the right product, I received an e-mail saying they were refunding my credit card. No explanation for why they weren't sending the container, no apology. And I'm ripped off for the return postage of a little over eight dollars. I subsequently ordered an almost identical item on Amazon from another company and am pleased with it. P.S. It was cheaper, too!

This is just perfect to hold 20lbs of dry cat food. It rools really easy, just ask my cats who will push it out if they are low on food. Not sure it they trying to tell me they are out or if it is them trying to help themselfs which they can't do. The lid locks on thight and the food is kept fresh down to the very last bite. This is one of the best Items a pet lover can own.

I purchased this on the recomendation of a reef club member..I use this and garlic extreme to soak my pellets and frozen food in. I put 1cc of this (it has a measured dropped and 3-5 drops of garlic extreme, then let the food soak for a couple of minutes. Fish love it and it helps with my filter feeders and nps. I will buy it again.
I give these to my fish regularly.  its hard to say if it is really helping my angelfish with lateral line disease though.  the disease has not worsen though.
I use this to soak Formula one, brine, flake and any other food i am feeding, use per directions as it will pretty much put a halt on your skimmer for a few hours.
NOT SURE IF IT WAS THIS STUFF OR THE GARLIC OR BOTH BUT AFTER ADDING THIS TO THE SEAWEED TO FEED MY HIPPO TANG WHO WAS GETTING WHITE SPOTS THEY HAVE NOW DISAPEARED AND HE IS FAT AND HEALTHY.
I use this to enhance my frozen foods for my reef tank.  Sometimes I just add it to the tank to aid the growth of the corals and inverts.  It probably helps.  I haven't done tests with/without it.

My fish and inverts seem happy and healthy with this in their life. It does cloud the water for a short amount of time but for the benefits it seems to have I think it's worth it. I put it on frozen food for added nutrients and in my inverts tank once a week for something different then the normal rotifers and phytoplankton.

My P. Fridmani was starting to get these white spots all over her.  Read an interesting article online about how you need to supplement the food with HUFA.  When I googled it, this product came up, and with great reviews.  Within days of using her white spots are practice gone and the beautiful orchid color is back.  Will definitely keep using and buying.

I've used Selcon in conjunction with Seachem Garlic Guard or Kent Garlic Xtreme for the past 2 years with no fish diseases in my 60 gallon saltwater tank.  I'm also meticulous about 10-15% weekly water changes in tandem with supplements.  My Kole Tang has never had ich nor HLLD.  I soak all foods - Rod's Herbivore Blend, Hikari mysis, spirulina brine shrimp, Spectrum NLS pellets, Formula 2 frozen, and nori for 20-30 minutes prior to feeding.  I also feed .50ml weekly into the tank which benefits corals and filter feeders.  Some people complain about cost which is minimal compared to time and medications spent on treating ill fish.  A little bit of this stuff goes a long way so avoid overdosing and the bottle will last a long time.

There's a reason why Selcon is the most widely used vitamin in marine tanks - it just works. Like others, I soak food in Selcon before adding it to the tank, and have noticed that the fish look better since starting them on it. A great bang for your buck would be to soak NLS pellets in this before feeding your fish, too.
summary: Great suppliment for your marine tank

reviewText: If you need a product to help you jumpstart the biological filtration in your aquarium, this is the stuff. Unlike other, liquid based products, this never goes bad so it it guaranteed to do the job. I've been using it for 25 years with nothing but good results, there's nothing else out there that works as good as Biozyme, period.
summary: The best nitrifying bacteria on the market.

reviewText: For people who don't know this product is a bunch of living bacteria. Its really good for new tanks so you have bacteria to break down ammonia. I use it in my tank and its not new, it just keeps it clean and clear. The bacteria goes into the filter and gravel and breaks down all the gunk. Its also a water conditioner to make tap water safe.

This stuff is great. Iv used it to cycle my 55, 20 and 36 gallon fish tanks. It takes a few days to cycle it.I suggest you put this stuff onto your filter pad. I put it on the bottom of the foam and carbon inserts on the aquaclear filters. Putting it on the bottom will cause bacteria to grow a lot easier.Also this is a water conditioner so when adding new water you can add this stuff to the tank and it will take care of chlorine and metals in the water.This stuff will float around in your tank until your filter pushes it under, but if you soak it in a cup it will sink immediately, which I recommend doing.

I'm not sure if this product actually works or not as far as helping to establish your beneficial bacterial colony.  The "bacteria" is mixed in with bran flakes and floats around on the water surface.  Really messy in a small aquarium.  Might be okay for a pond or outside water garden with fish.
I add this first before putting in the sublayer. It helps get the biological started, which breaks down the nitrogen.
summary: This helps get the new aquarium set ups started

reviewText: Quick Cure got rid of my ick problem quickly. Four treatments and did a water change after the 6th day. All my fish survived except for a few neon tetras (which are known for easily dying off even if the conditions are ideal).

I live in Japan and for some reason they have no fish medicine (or maybe they don't understand what Im asking for) but I lost my beta to ick and so i came on here to see if i could get something and thankfully i found this and they were able to ship to APO (military overseas address) and my new 2 beta's came down with ick this time i was prepared and after 3 days of 1 dose a day the Ick was gone and back to normal :) I am very happy cause i got these fancy betas that aren't the cheapest things out there. This bottle will also last you a long time (well longs you don't have a huge tank bottle says it treats 2,000 gallons, sounds like the bottle should be huge but its not it only takes 1 drop per gallon once a day for 3 days and if you have to go more than 3 days got to do a part water change and start the next 3 days). Which for me is great since its a pain to order stuff online and wait for it to arrive over here. Very great product!

It works. Follow the directions and in a few days, you will be free of ick. But I had a loach and it died about a week after I treated the tank. The directions didn't say anything about loaches, but other reviewers did. So if you have a loach and it doesn't have ick, remove it to a separate holding tank while you treat the water, if you can.This stuff really works. Use as directed. I have a lot of tetras (which I think are sensitive to this stuff) but I used a half dose and the ick cleared up in a couple days.I did also turn out the lights for about 2 and a half days on the recommendation of an aquarium site or another reviewer here. I read that the eggs need light to hatch.It turns the water blue, but the fish acted normal, except the loach. I wish I had just taken the poor thing out, but I didn't have a holding tank. :(
summary: Kills ick. Follow directions especially for tetras. Remove loaches before treating.

reviewText: I bought a Betta and some tetras at the fish store and ended up with Ick. (That's what happens when you don't quarantine!) Anyway, I was hesitant to try this due to another person's comments that it hurt their Betta. I figured I had to use something and used it, carefully following the instructions on the bottle. It cured my Betta and Neon Tetras without any harm to the fish. All the fish are healthy and happy and glad to be rid of that Ick after only 3 treatments! Highly recommend. Be sure that your water's ammonia and nitrite levels are checked when using this. You don't want your biological filter getting messed up, which is always possible using any medications...
summary: Worked GREAT, was safe for my Betta and tetras.

reviewText: Treats so many different conditions and is simple to use also not allot is needed so it will last a while. This product has saved dozens of my fish and I recommend it for use in med tanks as well as your regular aquariums.

The product is great for treating fish with ich, even though i only used half dose for my fish. Even though the direction mentioned that the product is harmful for shrimp and snails, it doesnt harm my ghost shrimp at all. The ghost shrimp is perfectly normal in my aquarium. Getting rid of ich in 3 days! I still use the product till now though ( day 10 already ) since I used half a dose for my tank.
This stuff works on Betta.I used it to treat my Betta and guppies. They all survived and I haven't had a case of ick since.
Sorry, but this product didn't work for the ick problem I had in my tank.  It did keep it relatively under control, but overall, didn't eliminate the parasites.
summary: Didn't really work for my tank...

reviewText: I've tried a number of Ich treatments. This one seemed to work the best for me.  Knocked out the Ich pretty quickly.  I used it with a combo of fresh water dips.

My mobile aquarium vet told me to use this for my 17 year old gold fish which had Ich. I ordered it and did use a little less than suggested but treated for a week and Ich is gone !! My goldfish is happy and Ich free again. I feel this product is safe and does what it states it will do and fish are safe which is the most important thing of all here. THANK YOU FOR THIS MEDICINE! Great delivery on time and fast as well. Amazon always comes through. (( You simply shake the bottle well, turn it upside down pointing into the pond / tank and add drops )) The reason I used less is because I love my fish and I've had him a very long time and was a little scared. All is well. My fish showed no signs of distress at all.
Works very "quick", no pun intended, just follow the directions and up the air flow to have best results for remedy.

This product promotes itself as a fast cure for ich and other parasites, and from my experience it is a very effective treatment. I can't vouch for its claim to cure ich in two days in all cases, but it is a rather fast-working product.I like that this product is not as harsh a treatment as the wide-spectrum antibiotic preparations that people too often use for fish diseases. While it seems natural to reach for strong microbials when your fish are sick, it can stress out your fish even more, making things worse. QuICK Cure cures ich without resorting to antibiotics.As with all ich treatment regimes, this works better if you raise the aquarium temperatures and keep the hood lights off. That will help speed along the ich parasite's life cycle and keep your fish in a quiet healing state.Other caveats - you have to remove the carbon from your aquarium filters before adding the treatment drops, or it won't work at all.You will need to use the smaller recommended dose with tetras. Thin-skinned fishes, like the catfishes, botias and loaches must actually be removed, since the malachite green in the medication is too readily absorbed and becomes toxic to them.QuICK Cure comes in a small dropper squeezy container. A 4 oz bottle treats thousands of gallons, which is a lot of ich. In other words, this one product should last your lifetime! Remember not to over-treat; use only the amount recommended per gallon. This product will turn your water blue and will dye anything else it touches. Be careful not to let this stuff touch you too much, since formalin is a cancer-causing agent.If you have a big ich infestation, I recommend using this medication. Make sure to use it correctly, of course! For a small ich outbreak, you might want to just try high temps, no lights and massive water changes first.
summary: Excellent Fish Ich cure for larger outbreaks and should last a lifetime

reviewText: I've tried a number of ich treatments over the many years I've had fish.  This works and it's pretty much the only one that does.  Yes, it's pretty poisonous, but none of the "natural" stuff works.  It's a shame they don't sell this type of product at the big chain pet stores (just the crap that literally does nothing), but it's cheap and quick to arrive via Amazon anyway (with one day shipping!).  This big bottle means I'll probably never have to purchase it again though!I've had no issues with it staining the tank, but it will stain your hands.  (I just use a gritty scrub afterwards, even SOS pads, to get it off.)  The only "con" to this product is that I'll probably have to wait awhile before I can begin using the dirty fish tank water to water my plants again.

I have platy fish that I love very much and was very upset to see they were suffering from ich with pieces of their tail fins actually missing. I have a young platy in my aquarium and was very scared to treat her but this product didn't harm her and healed my fish in three days and three treatments. Treatment is easy, there is no difficult mixing or measuring involved. My fish are now ich free and I am happy!  Definitely buy this product, it will work!

So I brought home a Flowerhorn from Petland Discounts.  Yeah, I know....Petland Discounts...But he was the littlest guy in the tank and he was being picked on and his tail was already ripped from being harassed.  So into the bag he went.  Five days later, he was not just showing ich...he was COVERED in it.  Head to tail. He broke out overnight. And a couple of my other fish were showing spots.  The ich had taken over my entire tank and Mr. Flowerhorn was the culprit.  I don't have another tank to act as a QT (quarantine tank), so please don't be so hard on me for not quarantining. I have kept fish for a long time and usually have an assortment of products to get me through situations like this...and I DID.  I had a bottle of Rid Ich+!  OH JOY!!  So I started treating the tank....yeah...right.  By day three the poor Flowerhorn was on his side on the top of the tank, fins clamped, barely moving. Good thing I had called a fish expert friend of mine who told me to use the Rid Ich+ just until I could get some Quick Cure.  None of my local stores had it in stock so I turned to Amazon as usual and it showed up just in time.  UPS delivered at 3:45, by 4:15 I had done a partial water change and medicated the tank.  I did not have high hopes about the poor Flowerhorn because he was not looking like he was going to make it. However, no more than 5 hours later I went past the tank and OMG!!!!  The Flowerhorn was swimming around the tank and he actually looked like he had less ich on him.  5 hours! Of course he was still clamped and still had a good deal of ich on him...but in 5 hours he went from having one fin in the toilet to looking like there was hope after all. I HAD to come write this review because I really could not believe the difference that this med made in 5 hours, whereas he was getting worse during the three days of treatment with Rid Ich+. I should also tell you that I had to use very very little Quick Cure. One drop per gallon, which is a fraction of the dosage of Rid Ich+ for my 55 gallon tank. Also, where Rid Ich+ demands a partial water change before EACH dosage, the Quick Cure's directions say to do a water change after three days of treatment, especially if treatment needs to be continued after the third day. As with most medications, the carbon needs to be taken out of the filter, and another thing that helps greatly is to increase the temperature of the water and keep the lights off.  This helps hasten the life cycle of the parasite. I hope this helps someone out there make an informed decision about Quick Cure, but after seeing such great improvement after only 5 hours, I am completely sold.  Keep your fingers crossed for Mr. Flowerhorn...but I feel like he is going to be just fine.

This seemed to be clearing up my fishes spots, I used 4 doses of it, then had to stop since I didn't have the time to clean out 25% of my 65 gallon tank that it recommends cleaning out before using any more doses. I will try doing another 3 rounds of this and see if that does the trick. Hopefully so.Update: This product worked reasonably well keeping my fishes ick at bay, none of my other fish picked it up. What ended up clearing it up for good was replacing the light on my UV filter that I hadn't known went out (which is why my fish got Ick in the first place). If you have a larger tank and have problems with ick and fungus, look into getting a UV filter like a Turbo Twist. This product works okay for keeping Ick down, but did not cure my fish, only my UV light eventually did the trick. Also a UV light will prevent the problem in the first place, so you won't need products like this.

This product did work however it took three times as much to rid the ick from my tank. I am not saying it is Qucik cures fault that it took longer and more product but just beware you might need more.

I ordered this product and the bottle I received had a completely different label, I got Mardel Quick Cure with a blue label, it looked nothing like the yellow label pictured here, perhaps its the same thing and the company was sold, but who knows. I tried the product for "cotton mouth" on a few of my cardinal tetras, it looks like the fungus has shrunk in size but after two weeks of the 1/2 dose recommended for tetras they still have the white growths on their mouths, i will move on and try something else.
keeps our turtle tank pretty clean, not sure how it tastes to them, but the water is clear now and looks good.

I would definitely recommend getting chemipure elite over this since it keeps alot more things in balance than the i guess "regular" chemipure that this is.  Bought it on accident but still ended up using it and having no problems in my aquarium.

The best Aquarium carbon out there, keeps your tank sparkling clear for months and smell free. You still have to clean your tank at least once a month, but this carbon will work for at least 4 to 6 months before it has to be replaced. Been using Chemi-Pure for years and my fish are always happy, healthy and clean. I never have nitrate or nitrite problems, no ammonia, my tank is always crystal, best stuff ever, only Seachem comes close.
I use this on my reef tank and my 20 long tank. It keeps everything stable and crystal clear. Worth every penny.
summary: Always works for what i need.

reviewText: I only use once in awhile.  Seems to help clear up my tank.  A little on the expensive side though.

Use this product for both my tropical and african mbuna cichlid tanks - keeps water crystal clear and lasts longer than regular charcoal media.  I keep in my overstocked cichlid tank for 4 months and 6 months in my tropical tank - works great - hasn't harmed any of my fish - remember you still need to perform routine water changes - but this product is a great assist to keeping water quality balanced - recommend this product.

My local fish stores swears by this - I don't have a reef tank but a freshwater tank.  Fits in my Eheim Canister filter (I have the small Pro3) alongside the biomedia.  I run a pretty intense tank with lots of fertilization, high light, CO2, lots of food (many plecos) and a fair amount of mulm and organic debris from the large number of live plants.  This helps keep my water clear and in balance.  I can't say exactly how much this contributes to the health of my tank but I will continue to use it as a safety net.  I also ran Purigen for a while but it was getting expensive given the size of my tank, so I'm saving the Purigen for my smaller tanks that also have a discoloration issue (from the driftwood) and instead use Chemi-Pure in my larger display tank.
Best media to keep your water crystal clear.  Use it every 6 months in my reef tank and will never use anything else.
If you think you have seen your tank clear you should really try this stuff it makes it clear and smell delightful.

I've replaced all my other pumps with ones from Rena and couldn't be happier.  This is a heavy duty unit that is virtually silent and has no problem running two 6" airstones in my 90 gallon tank with the pump on the floor.  I also have them running bubble walls in several other smaller tanks.Much better price than at the local pet mega-stores.
summary: Great pump at a great price

reviewText: Good pump, I have another smaller Rena which is great too, would recommend it to anyone who wants a quiet air pump for their fishes.
This  small pump exceeded my expection.I only intended to run one 20 gallon fish tank and now i'm runnng two with a maniold  installed.It quiet and supplys plenty of air.

I bought this pump at Petsmart about 2 yrs ago and it barely functioned at all.  I returned it and ordered a Hagen Elite from Amazon that has been working perfect non-stop for 2 yrs.  I recently set up a new tank and was looking for an air pump, and decided with all the good reviews, to try a Rena again hoping my bad experience was a fluke.  Well the same exact thing happened.  This thing was barely capable of literally sending  3 or 4 bubbles every minute out of an air wall.  So I went to my local aquarium store and purchased a Hagen Elite again (which was half the price of the Rena), as I should have done in the first place.  Worked perfect, sending out a thousand bubbles a minute.  One bad experience could be bad luck, but not two.  I would never purchase a Rena air pump again.

I've had this pump for roughly two years. It works fine and everything but one day I needed to change the airline and while doing so, the knob that the line slips over broke off at the base! I've pretty much treated this pump with kid gloves for these two years. I use it at room temperature, I don't store it weird with anything putting pressure on the knob, and I don't take off and on the airline frequently. I think the time it broke was maybe the third time I changed the airline. And I wasn't yanking on it either.Therefore, there is no reason for this breaking besides it being of poor workmanship.So I called Rena to see if they'd rectify the matter or if there's even a part that could be purchased to replace it and while the gentleman that I spoke to was very polite, they wouldn't stand behind their product because the short one year warranty was up. He also said that I could purchase a casing (at my expense of course) IF this guy he gave me the number to has any. I didn't even have that option because it was a dead number.So let's review:1. Puts out air fine.2. Knob breaks with regular or less than regular use.3. Manufacturer won't even stand behind product when defect reflects on their own workmanship.My conclusion is that there are many air pumps that will pump air that don't break and will be backed up by the manufacturer when they're at fault. My money is best spent on one of those other brand's air pumps.
summary: Fine as long as you don't touch it.

reviewText: I have owned 3 air pumps, one being a whisper. This one for sure is louder but more powerful. The kit that comes with it is nice and has everything you need to get started. The whisper broke so I decided to give this a try. Overall it pumps out a lot of oxygen and comes with everything but i can hear it across the room. I have tried on different surfaces and even just holding it in my hand. It might me okay stashed in a cabinet but if you have a silent room you won't miss it. It's hard even to hear the bubbles with it on. I may return this for a refund and try another whisper or a fusion. Good luck.

So many pumps claim to be totally silent. This one was supposedly one of the quietest. It is still not silent. IT makes a definite vibrational sound which might be enough to keep someone from sleeping in the same room. I have my bubbles on a timer now to turn on and off automatically so that it's not running when someone is likely to want to get to sleep. I think besides that though, it seems nice and functional and puts out a pretty good amount of air pressure.

Over the past thirty years I've tried about every air pump there is and in my opinion the Rena trumps them all.These air pumps are quiet, efficient and with minimal care should last for many years. Like all air pumps replacing the intake filter with new ones is imperative for keeping vibration and noise at a minimum.The 400 is perfect for tanks ranging in size from 55 - 160 gallons.They're easily adjustable dual output ports let you configure just how much air you need to drive your aeration, bubble wands, walls, air stones, sponge filters, power heads and so on.The 400 hundred is the largest in the line and like all Rena pumps their curved design and expansion chambers keep vibration and noise to a minimum.Replacing the diaphragm is easy to do on these pumps - just remember to buy two replacement kits - one for each intake port.Quick Specs:1) Powerful2) Dual out put3) Dual control Valves4) 3 Year warranteeLike any quality air pump keeping a drip loop and using check valves in your air line tubing is essential.Add the mix changing the air filter from time to time and the Rena will reward you with years of efficient trouble free service.
summary: Powerful Dual Out Put Dependable Air Pump

reviewText: A coworker bought this air pump to use with one of those air bubble wands.  It worked great.... for a while.  I have lots of other brands of air pumps, most of them the inexpensive kind and they last and last and last.  I've had some for 7 years and not even had to replace the bladder.  This Rena is only four years old.  Since we have moved Turtle to a larger tank with better filter, the wimpy air pump wasn't a big deal.  I decided to take a chance and purchase the repair kit for this little pump.  Nope, it didn't help.  I wanted to see how much air was coming out so I attempted to remove the air line.  Air lines on these pumps always seem to get really stiff and you have to cut them off.  The problem with this pump is that the outlet is recessed and you can't get a a knife in there to cut the tubing.  Snapped the outlet right off.  Fortunately, I had purchased a Whisper Air as a backup.  That air pump doesn't have the flawed outlet like the Rena and it's also quiet.  It came with a T so that you could use it with two devices.I have a Million Air 300 on my 30 gallon tank which I purchased more than seven years ago and it's still going strong.  This Rena air pump is an overpriced piece of crap.  The only positive thing about this pump is that it's quiet.  I can't bring myself to give it two stars.
this product gets the job done. it quickly dissolves and doesn't leave any gross residue behind, and makes water properly conditioned for aquatic animals
It seems to be working well. I noticed in the weeks after I added to the tank, my Beta started swimming around a lot more and his tail fins seemed to be less tattered.
Three times the amount for half the price in local stores.  Quick delivery and API is one of the best brands out there.
Live by this stuff  for water treatments. Never had issues with fish death and they seem happy. Cap iis easy to read with 5 gal buckets.

This product is absolutely fantastic--I use it at home, and at the pet shop where I work. It's safe for just about anything, but DO NOT purchase this product from Amazon. This is the one and only time I've ever had a problem with anything I ordered from Amazon. Twice I ordered it from them, and between the two orders, I barely got one full bottle. The lids were not screwed on properly and the liquid leaked out both time--badly enough the second time that the bottle itself was in a bag inside the box, and then the BOX was in a bag due to leakage. I love Stress Coat for my fish, definitely--but I'll go ahead and pay the few extra dollars at pet stores to make sure I get a full bottle.
summary: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS FROM AMAZON!

reviewText: Love this stuff .When ever I buy new fish I use a tea spoon when I release the fish into tank. The pet store sells this as a 8 oz for what I payed for the 16 oz.
Wonderful product for aggressive fish tank, and any other time fish become stressed!  Water changes and tank maintenance tend to stress fish!
I used to buy this product all the time but it got to be too expensive in retail stores. Now that I know I can buy it here, it is affordable again.
This stuff works great.  It dechlorinates the water as well as providing your fish with slime they may lose under stressful situations.

I've been using Api for my tanks for well over 17 years and i would never change their products for any other brand in the world. That said all Api products should become a staple in any aquarium/fish tank cabinet because you will never find anything that will work better including the Api Stress Coat Water Conditioner.Make sure you read the directions properly and have patients because treating any tank takes time and relies on a lot of factors.I have tried multiple times throughout the years to use other brands but without exception each and every one of them have failed miserably simply put they just won't work!I trust Api products with my eyes closed, i would highly recommend them to everyone and i definitely will be buying them for as long as i own tanks.
summary: Api is the ONLY brand you need in your cupboard!!!!!!

reviewText: This is a great product for adding new fish to your tank, doing water changes, or anytime that your fish may become overly stressed (i.e. power outage).  This product does not remove ammonia from your water, but helps to replensih any slime coat on your fish.  I have found this to be a common misconception of this product in that most people believe that this product will remove ammonia.  Filtration, water changes, and surface agitation are the only ways to effectively remove ammonia.  I use this product for all of my water changes to remove harmful chemicals in tap water, and anytime that I add a new fish to our tank.
summary: Great Product as long as you understand what you are buying.

reviewText: this is a great product and a must if you have an aquarium but you can not beat the price
I use occasianally wihen it appears bacteria levels have fallen off.  Buy the bigger bottle as it more bang for the buck

Last week my new female betta fish Annabelle somehow managed to shred her delicate fins in her balinese lantern (which is rough around the edges). Having heard about API's stress coat, I picked up a bottle from a retail pet store chain. Within a few days, I started noticing some growth in my betta's fins. Clearly the aloe vera was doing its job on my poor girl's shredded fins. Even her missing ventral fin has started growing back. I am definitely pleased with the results that I have seen with this product. Definitely will use this for my bettas if their fins are ever damaged.

I chose this item for its reputation and because it's all I use for my fish.  After getting it I'm very satisfied with my purchase. I use it every time I change water to my fish tank.  It keeps my fish healthy and happy and if they are happy so am I. Excellent item to maintain you fish happy and stress free.  I recommend this item to anyone having fish as pets.

I understand that a lot of people like to use Seachem's Prime dechlorinate solution, but after trying it, I found that the health and condition of my fish went down quickly. But after using API's Stress Coat Water Conditioner, things improved significantly.When I used Prime, according to directions, my fish reacted oddly and distressed and seemed to have a reaction to it. A few of my guppies died, and the community tank was in trouble. But after switching to API's solution, and doing a partial water change, I immediately saw their level of activity go up. My guppies seemed "happier" as did my Nerite snails and Red Cherry shrimp. The formulation of this product is safer than Prime, it would seem.I am very happy with the results of the API product and will continue using it. As for Prime, I dumped the whole bottle down the drain. Lesson learned and I won't be buying Prime ever again.Water specs: Zero ammonia; zero nitrites, 5ppm nitrates, and 7.2 pH.
summary: I like this better than Seachem Prime

reviewText: Used this in a new aquarium.  Fish didn't die, so I guess it worked as advertised.  I would use it again, but I don't have a lot of experience with keeping fish.
Always use this product works great very trusted product never have any issues with this product I would recommend this to anyone  .  .
after moving my fry and junior fish around it comes them down a lot, works well for them when they're sick..

This stuff will raise the ammonia level in your aquarium extremely, make the water cloudy and kill your fish. It does NOT neutralize ammonia, nitrate or nitrite. I do NOT recommend this product at all. I have always used Prime and for some reason decided to try this. Big mistake! I highly recommend Prime, it is much better for your aquarium and fish. It removes chlorine, chloramine, ammonia and detoxifies nitrite and nitrate and provides an excellent slime coat. If you want your fish to live and do well use Prime by Seachem, not this!!

Excellent all-in-one water conditioner that tackles both chlorine and chloramines.  I've used this product for both inside aquariums and my 200 gallon outdoor pond.  Easy to use - and a little goes a long way.  Literally, it provides instant water conditioning.

works as intended. does not kill your fish.the aloe is actually benefitial to my fish. he had some torn fins and it helped them to heal faster than normal
This is in my opinion the best water conditioner available.Use it with each water change and it has performed well. I would highly recommend this product for any tank owner!
WELL SUPER CHEAPER THAN IN STORES KEEPS FISH ALIVE AND HEALTHY! GREAT DEAL CANT GO WRONG I DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT
I love stuff, swear by it. It can be used as a water conditioner or added to the water to aid a fish in fin healing, etc. I should probably start buying this stuff in bulk.

i think this is a great product. the price is much cheaper on here then at the store.i use this everytime i clean my fish tank and have no issues with any of my bettas.one of my bettas came home with part of fin missing and this has helped my bettas fin to grow back and my other betta i had bought from walmart he was acting really weird when i first got him i used this in his water and since then has mellowed out. overall i would totally recommend this product
The best there is, I use it on every water change in all my tanks, works great and this is a great price on this product, thanks.

reviewerName: Kimberly J. Karas "a New England mom"
reviewText: Two of my fish had their fins damaged by an aggressive tank mate.  While this is a nice water conditioner, I bought it with specific hopes that it would aid in my fishes tail fins regrowth and it has done just that.  I was very upset at the damage and didn't know how well mother nature alone would take care of it and this stress coat fish and tap water conditioner has definitely delighted me with it's efficiency.  Pay close attention to the dosing.  Extra size dose is recommended for fin damage.

I live where the water is so soft there's almost no minerals in it at all.  Maintaining a Ph of 7.0 was difficult but possible, but my snails had the white pitting and my guppy had fin rot that he contracted during the time when I was totally new to fish keeping and didn't understand how important it is to snails and guppies to keep the Ph at or above 7.0.I had finally got the situation under control.  My guppy's fins were regenerating and my snails had new shell growth that was healthy.Then I made the grave mistake of trying this product.  Aloe vera?  So what.  Looked like a stupid gimmick.  Since when do fish need aloe vera?  Do we need to pull them out of the tank and rub moisturizing cream on them too?  How about some Lubriderm?Anyway, shortly after switching to this product my Ph crashed to 6.0.  My guppy's fins started rotting and got worse than ever, and the healthy growth on my snails that survived me climbing the learning curve last Summer now have white calcified shell damage.  I don't even recognize the two I named just a few months ago!I was doing emergency water changes morning and evening just to keep the Ph at about 6.4.  (My tap water is totally soft, but comes out of the tap at PH of about 7.2).  My hands got raw and cracked because I was washing my hands so much after working with the tank so much.I asked myself what had changed when this started, and the only thing I came up with was switching to this aloe vera stress coat.  Then I looked up aloe vera juice on the Internet and found it has a Ph of 3.5 to 5.0 depending on where I looked.  Wow, I thought, maybe putting something with Ph that low in the tank could throw the whole Ph down quite a bit.I bought some Tetra brand stress coat and did a few more water changes (some cracks in hands bleeding now, maybe MY hands could use some aloe vera!!) and soon the Ph climbed back up to 6.8.I did two emergency salt dips for the guppy, whose fin rot had begun on his body too.  It looks like the rot has been halted.  The damage has been done to my snails.  Maybe once I get this under control I'll have time to just stare at the tank a while and figure out who is who again through all the shell damage.So, thanks API for putting my fish and snails through hell.  Brilliant idea mixing a super low Ph substance in with water conditioner.  Did you test this thoroughly before you put it into production?  Anyway, I could rant further but I think it's time to rub some Vaseline moisture lotion on my cloud fish.  They really need to chill out.
summary: Low PH aloe vera crashed the Ph in my tank and almost killed everything.

reviewText: I use tap water, right from the sink or hose and have never lost a fish after adding water.Our water supply in Davis, CA is so bad they have a huge project going on the replace itwith another water supply.

I use this with my weekly water changes to condition water for my bettas.  It's great and you can add extra if your fish has torn fins - it helps with healing.  Amazon also has a great price on the large bottle!
if you have any kind of aquarium from small to big, you must have it for your lovely fishes. I use it for years and it never give me problem.

I forgot to use this product for a while and my newer fish started to die quickly, the pet shop reminded me that the stress coal will help the fish transition to their new home much better. I used it and the fish didn't die anymore. Also, the amount you need to use maked the product a greay value!

That's been working for me, as my fish have lived a few years and they're getting big.  One 16 ounce bottle will probably last until they die.
Works a lot better then other products.Won't leave any water cloudy.I do 50% water change and have not lost any fish.I trust this to be the only product I use.

The fish were happier and the tank was clear after useing it. My fish stop acting crazy when changing the water too.
Works well. I add it anytime adding new fish and every once in a while just to create a good environment for the fish and their slime coat.
will help your fish recover from illness or stress great addition for after transport or water changes. not a must have but helpful.
One of the few water ammendments I use and like.  Does help with stress.

I like this brand for my fish. I use it when I do water changes or whenever my fish gets really messed up from a fight. They recover quickly from injury with this brand and when doing a water change, they come out of their panic easily after the change is done. I love this product.  I have owned my aquarium for several months now and I have used this product since day one. This is essential when doing water changes or adding new fish to your aquarium.

reviewText: I use this once a month when I do water change for my 10 gallon Fish Tank. It keeps my fish happy.

I woke up one morning and saw that my betta had a shredded fin. I immediately began searching to figure out what had caused it and noticed not too long later that he was chewing on his tail and I panicked! I have my betta in a three gallon bowl and he has ornaments to play with and rest on so I wasn't sure how he could be bored (I do not have a filter so I figured it must be caused by boredom). Well after rearranging his tank a little it stopped and i have not noticed it since. I knew though that I needed to get him something to help his fins grow back. Stress coat had long been recommended as both a water conditioner and for fin regrowth so I purchased it along with stress zyme by API. As soon as I received it I did a 100% water change and scrubbed the bowl and then quadrupled the dose of this and allowed to permeate for several hours before adding my betta back to the bowl (I also added some stress zyme with it). After just one day (24 hours) WOW what a difference! Not only did his fin look much healthier but he had stopped biting, was much more active and responsive, and his colors were much brighter and he just seemed much happier! The water also looked much cleaner. Now a month later his fin is totally healed and this is the only water conditioner I use. It just seems to be so healthy and does wonders for him. If you want to do something nice for your fish use this product and no other!I also highly recommend you use this with stress zyme! Stress zyme adds beneficial bacteria to the aquarium and should be used at start up and with water changes. These products work so well together and will do amazing things for your aquarium. I can't recommend them enough! Store upright and at room temperature. Fasten lid securely.
My ammonia levels were out of whack. This brought them down, and they have stayed down over the past 48 hours.

i dont know how much this really works, but i added this to my tanks when i got new fishes and they miraculously survived (after the previous new ones died).  it seems to work because when i was just using regularly water conditioner, i'd have batches of new fishes die.  now all of my fishes are alive! yay!
I found this when I was searching for fish food.  What a GREAT PRICE so I ordred extra.  Does the job and even better I had it delivered right to my door!
I use this stuff all the time, but I normally pay a little more and have to drive 25 miles to get it. This is a great quality product and my fish appreciate it very much.

There are a great deal of water conditioners out there on the market for the fish tank. This is one that I've used regulary since 1999. I use it to condition my water for water changes, topping off the tank and when setting up a new tank. It removes both chlorine and chloramine from tap water. It also reduces fish stress and heals any damaged tissue, torn fins, and skin wounds. It also replaces the natural secretion of slime that is interrupted by handling, shipping, fish fighting, or other forms of stress and reduces the susceptibility to disease and infection. It is a great product, which I have no trouble recommending to others. I usually buy the larger size, but when in a pinch I buy this size.
summary: Love this stuff: Using regularly since 1999.

This stuff is awesome! I have a 30 gallon tank that this has been keeping crystal clear. I haven't had a fish tank in a while so when I got one a few weeks ago I had to relearn everything. I did not cycle my water for a whole month before adding fish to my new tank (super excited & impatient kids partially to blame, lol), so I lost a few. After adding the recommended dose of stress zyme, I noticed my fish were more active/happier within a day or so. Haven't lost anymore since, and this keeps the water  clear. I have a turtle in a different tank and he has a filter but his water was looking filthy about a week after his water change (I give him feeder minnows so that's no surprise), and I added a dose of stress zyme to his water - crystal clear within hours! This stuff is great! It's expensive in pet stores (a 4oz. bottle lasted me 2 weeks and that was $6 at Petco, so I'll be buying larger bottles on Amazon from now on, since this stuff is cheaper in bulk). Stress Zyme is literally a lifesaver, and a timesaver, too!
I have a newly formed planted 20g aquarium and this has helped it so much so far! Its making my nitrate levels rise and seems to be working great!

I have a betta fish in about a 3 gallon bowl. I used to do 100% water changes weekly and scrub out the bowl and the ornaments which inevitably get food and gunk on them. I normally did these water changes every week and added stress coat (also by API) as a water conditioner and also to replace his slime coat. The conditioner was meant to ease the stress on him and while it did 100% water changes were still very stressful for the betta even when the water was the same temperature. Then I found this stuff.I now only change 25% of water weekly and add stress zyme every week. It helps the bowl stay cleaner and the water stay clearer by killing off harmful bacteria which will keep your fish healthy. When I tried to do 25% water changes before without stress zyme his bowl just didn't look clean and he wasn't as active as he is now. I can rest assured that although his bowl is not being cleaned as often this product gets rids of the bacteria and keeps my betta healthy. This does not replace the water conditioner. My betta is very happy and healthy and the bowl is noticeably cleaner without the stress of 100% water changes. Less water changes means less stress for my fish which will hopefully allow him to live a long and happy life.

I have a new tank and have been dealing with ammonia spikes trying to get my biological filter system up and running.  The water was a bit cloudy even after my weekly water swap.  I added this about two weeks after my tank was started and it fixed everything.  Bacteria is building up, ammonia is going down and the water is crystal clear for the first time.  I found a winner!

reviewText: I've used this kit before and see no detriment to its ability for testing the pH.  If you want to be comprehensive and test for more water elements, you would want a complete, more expensive test kit.
This is an easy rinse and fill tube to the line, add chemicals, cap and invert several times and read 'instant test'.  It is easy enough to use the color chart to compare and read the results.
Absolutely necessary for my aquaponics.  Keeps my system going smoothly.  Love it that amazon sells this I don't have to go to the pet store and pay more.

I don't have multitudes of pH testers around to attest to the accuracy, but it never gives me readings that seem off. It's easy and fast. I'm so used to my ammonia tester (that I use more often) that requires 5 minutes of waiting, it's nice to just put the water in, put the drops in, shake, and see what the water's at. This hasn't changed my life or anything, but it's everything that I wanted in a pH test kit.
its ok good to have but I found out you could take your fish tank water to the store and they test it. put this is good to have around

Not only do I  use this product to check my Ph. I also use it in my CO2 drop checker with a 4kh solution to see where my CO2 levels are when injecting. This solution last a very long time too. After a few years I just toss it out and reorder more because the price is great.
summary: A must have for fresh water set ups

reviewText: The API pH test kit is simple, accurate, and easy to use. I have played around with it in measuring my pH, but what I really use it for is my drop checker to measure Co2 along with 4dkh H20. Works well. Not much else to say.

I got this to test my pH while setting up a freshwater tank.  Where I live, the water is quite hard, so I knew some adjustments would be needed.  This is a very simple to use kit and the laminated card that tells you the explanation of the test result colors is great.  However, because it only goes up to 7.5, I had to do a lot of guesswork to get my tank down to those levels.  The color stays the same until the pH falls down to the levels this kit is designed for - not a design flaw at all, but it isn't the most effective kit when you live in a hard water area.  I suspect the same would be the case if you live somewhere with very soft water, too.

This is necessary for maintaining my fresh water aquarium.  These last a long time; however this is my second purchase because I broke the first glass vial and haven't been able to find a replacement so I had to purchase this a second time.
This is a necessary product to have on hand because it is one of the water quality aspects, that should be measure frequently enough to give advanced warnings of changes to the water makeup.
easy way to check my tanks ph
This item works well! Just make sure you wear gloves or the product can irritate your skin!It is well worth the low price you pay for it.
Nice replacement for your main test kit, as I test for Ph more frequently than others.  It also comes with its own glass vile.

This is an easy and cheap way of testing PH. It doesn't need to be calibrated like the electronic ones , just put the water that needs tested in the tube, then a couple drops of the liquid , shake and match the color up on the supplied PH chart.
I ended up receiving a dud set which led me to months of redoing my freshwater tank trying to get the pH levels right. It turns out that they were fine all along. It was a waste of my time and money.

reviewText: Its a complete bargain for the price! Definitely buyin this again when my test bottles empty. totally recomended for any one who uses ferts on any aquarium. I bough a phosphate test and also the Gh Kh combo from API too. I hope in the future API includes this 2 on the master test kit because it'd be awesome.

Have had this for a few weeks now and love it. The kit will test for PH levels in two ranges (high/low), Ammonia, Nitrite, and Nitrate. I have been using this kit for my aquaponics system and it has all the needed tests to ensure the right levels for plants and fish. This would also work great for an aquarium as well since they have similar needs. Instruction are clear and easy to follow and kit comes with enough solution to test probably 75 times. Check out my full review of the product here - http://youtu.be/SFRlC8q_AOw

I chose this product because it gives more accurate readings than the strips do. However, it is time consuming but well worth it when fighting to make sure the water is correct. I also like that it has high PH tests. This makes testing my cichlid tanks very easy.

This handy little kit is crucial for any concerned fish-owner. I found out that despite frequent water-changes and ph stablilizer additions, my tank  was still totally toxic with ammonia. This kit has everything you need to test for the big 4 problem chemicals, but it is also suuuper easy-to-use. The instruction manual tells you how to fix any problems that may occur, which is also really really helpful
This was stellar while I was fishlessly cycling my tank. Easy to use and accurate. A must-have for every aquarium enthusiast.

I got this to make sure my new tank was cycling correctly, and stay balanced, while doing many water changes after having just added 'too many fish' at one time. I was able to tell when my nitrate/nitrite/ammonia levels were off, and take action before any ill effects occurred. There are enough testing supplies included to last a very long time (for me, at least...2-30gal freshwater tanks). Good product.

I used this to diagnose a water quality issue with a tank I set up.  I seeded it with filter media from an established tank and thought it was cycled after a couple weeks.  This kit allowed me to monitor ammonia, nitrite and nitrate to determine it wasn't cycled at all.  After several more weeks, levels were good and stable and my fish are doing great.Get this and some cheap pH strips for quick checks.  It can save a lot of time and money avoiding having to guess what's going on with your water.
Very accurate. Definitely good to have when cycling your tanks or checking to see if you need a water change. The only thing I wish it came with was the Gh and Kh tests.
Very pleased. My tank is doing well and my fish are happy. Easy to use and the instructions are very clear. I would highly recommend.

Before you buy fish #1, before you can fishless cycle your tank, you need this test kit.  IMO the only test kit to spend your hard earned money on (check ANY online aquarium forum and see) dont waste your money (and fish) on test strips, get the real thing and enjoy your hobby...

It works. Seems accurate and is a necessary part of monitoring your aquarium. Just make sure you read the instructions until you get used to how each test works, especially the ones where the bottles or tubes need to be shaken for a period of time. Otherwise, you may get inaccurate results. Great product and well worth the price.

My fish were dying left and right. I had another test but all the levels were FINE! I was so confused! Then, I saw this one also tested something I didn't know about, Nitrates. (Not noTRItes). Sure enough, I tested my Nitrates level and it was a DEEP dark solid color, showing my tank was basically eroding away my fishes systems and killing them.This thing saved my fish!

I had purchased the ammonia part previously, and was debating on buying this whole kit. Well all of the vials ended up meeting my floor (and shattering), so I ended up buying this product. So far it is great. I wish the manual was a little bit better designed for easy finding. But other than that it is nice. I think it'd be nice if they vials weren't all glass, since i've been close to dropping a few more of them.

I love this test kit.  I have always had to take water to my area PetSmart to have my water tested because I just cannot figure out those little cards that you dip in the water to read the levels.  Throw them all away and buy this kit.  It's foolproof and so easy to use.The charts that you compare the water colors too are very clearly marked and you have no mistake in what you are reading.  It tells you exactly how many drops to put in how much water and how long to let it set to read it.  The bottles contain enough chemicals to do hundreds of tests.  Each bottle contains 1 1/4 fl oz of test liquid and depending on the test, you only use about 3 drops per test.  I especially like that all the test bottles and glass vials are in a nice compact case so I don't have all these bottles rattling around the drawer that I keep my aquarium stuff in.  And, when you do empty one, the ones you buy in the store are the exact same size so they fit right into the kit for storage.The written instructions are very clear to understand for testing.
It was nice to be able to test your tank and realize if the quality of water is acceptable. The kit is complete and easy to use. Buy with confidence.
summary: It was nice to be able to test your tank and realize if the quality of water is acceptable. The

reviewText: We bought this test kit (which is a NECESSITY) for any serious aquarium owner years ago, and still use it regularly.

This is an indispensable tool.  It's easy to read, and easy to perform the tests.  It took all of five minutes of following the instructions before I was able to test my water quickly and easily.  Really helpful.  It's definitely an accurate test.  I've been able to watch a new tank cycle by watching ammonia rise, then drop as nitrites rise, then watch nitrites drop as nitrates rise.  It's indispensable for my large tanks, which I test every month (or more as needed) just to make sure things are going as they should.  Also great for my smaller betta bowls, as it's helped me to determine how often I need to change their water to keep them healthy.  I have used my test kit around 25-50 times, and it's still not empty.I ordered another one a few days after receiving the first one.  It's that useful.  I don't want to run out.Be warned, the glass vials are breakable when dropped (duh).  I've had a few kicked on the ground.  Not the product's fault of course.  Just don't drop them.The colour is very easy to read.  Be sure to wait five minutes before reading the results.  Also, I wouldn't wait more than ten minutes.  I've noticed that the colours get distorted after a while.
summary: A must have for all fish keepers

reviewText: I gave this four starts because this a bit bothersome in testing the water for each inconsistency.  On the other hand I do feel it is more accurate than the quick strip tests.  So if you have fish you want to keep a long time, it's worth the extra time to open all the different containers n run the individual tests.
summary: Tells you everything you need to know about your water

reviewText: We are experimenting with aquaponics.  This kit is helpful.  We have fish dying left and right.  Who knew ammonia and ph levels were so important to everything.

This will tell you just about everything you will ever need to know about your freshwater tank. The same chemicals are used in the saltwater test kit, but the colors displayed will be slightly different. I do weekly testing on 5 freshwater tanks and I'm completely happy with the results.

I used this kit to test my aquaponics system and attached koi pond. It was a pain to follow all of the directions each time for each chemical and the various vials, but it gives you the vital information you need to keep your ecosystem healthy.

I have an aquaponics system and in every forum I see this kit mentioned. I know now why because it has everything you really need. I won't need to look any further for another kit. I think they make a saltwater kit too which I'm sure is just as great.
summary: There is a reason this is mentioned everywhere

reviewText: Good product , easy to use, except my wife has to do the reading of the test because I am color blind.
summary: does what it is suppose to do

reviewText: I'm not sure if this is the best choice for someone that just dabbles in fish keeping. I have a goldfish tank, a betta/cory tank and a platy tank. I love having fish and wanted a way to test the water. After reading reviews that the test strips were less accurate I bought this test kit. It just takes more time and fuss than I was expecting. A couple of the tests require drops, shaking, more drops and then waiting 5 mins for results. It's also hard to get the colors to match up, my pH test didn't seem to match any of the colors at all. As far as accuracy goes, I don't really know.

Teast kit has 4 glass test tubes! Easy to read number display with limit water line on glass tube. Accurate test colors that matches color chart inside kit and has a booklet that show you exactly what to do. Extra details that are necessary are included to buy other chemicals! Kit helped me maintain the water in top shape.

Perfect kit for the home aquarist. You have fish that are dieing and you don't know why. Use this test kit and I bet you'll find out. It lets you check all the main parameters that cause fish death or illness

I needed this kit for testing my newly cycling aquariums. I had bought the quick-strips from the local pet store, but they were not accurate, and didn't test as close of a range as this kit did. I found this on amazon for about half off of where everyone else was selling it.It shipped extremely fast, and works amazingly. I don't know what I would do without it, and I will never use the dip strips again.
summary: A litteral need for any freshwater aquarium owner

reviewText: I've been using Api for my tanks for well over 17 years and I would never change their products for any other brand in the world. That said all Api products should become a staple in any aquarium/fish tank cabinet because you will never find anything that will work better including the Api Freshwater Master Test Kit.Make sure you read the directions properly and have patients when doing your water testing because I have tried multiple times throughout the years to use other brands but without exception each and every one of them have failed miserably simply put they won't work as good as any Api product!I trust Api products with my eyes closed, I would highly recommend them to everyone and I definitely will be buying them for as long as I own tanks.
summary: Api is the ONLY brand you need in your cupboard!!!!!!

reviewText: I always see my local fish store using and so i decided to buy my own kit and it saves me time and gas I can do my own test whenever and know the accuracy will be good.

These are great tests and accurate. You can buy a slightly more expensive one and that one is on point, but I have had tanks for years and used these tests and have never had an issue. The price on Amazon is great too. You save quite a bit instead of getting it at the fish store.

This product is highly recommended on the fish forum I frequent and truly is a great test kit. Get this instead of the strips; strips are unreliable. One member tested no nitrite on the strips when the levels were actually so high they were killing her fish! This test gave her the true reading.

Wonder why your fish went belly up, cant figure out why the 30 fish you added to your 1 gallon bowl died in minutes?Nab a sample of water, pop in your testing solution and see what water parameters are way off the chart.  ;)Also good for people that want to save money on water changes by knowing when your water really needs to be changed instead of a set time because that's when you were told to do it (every tank is different)
summary: Don't keep fish with out it.

reviewText: If you're looking for speed tests and 30 second maintenance, probably not for you. Takes about 10 minutes total to run through all these tests, and then treat your water accordingly (with other products). Works great, and I imagine it'd be pretty fun for the geeky science kids in your house. :)
summary: Accurate, easy to use, a little time consuming

reviewText: Great little kit. Definitely helped with establishing my tank. Allowed me to tell when it was fully cycled. would recommend
never wrong kinda hard to read but find the closest color and roll tide much cheaper then pet shopps in town

I just got the kit the other day but I can tell you that the measurements are pretty accurate.  I did a water test with the kit then took another water sample to my LFS where they verified my findings with a different vendor's kit.It's a little bit of a pain to remember how many drop in each and whether to shake and/or just invert the tubes, but once you get the hang of it, it's easy.

As a keeper of freshwater fish, you know that it's important to monitor a good number of levels in your tank.This kit covers most of what you'll need to monitor in your water.-pH (including high level test)-Ammonia (NH3) from fish waste-Nitrite (NO2) oxidized ammonia-Nitrate (NO3) oxidized nitritesThe kit even includes a pamphlet which explains how to correctly perform the tests and what to do about bad results. If you don't understand the nitrification process, I suggest reading up on it so that you may better understand why you're testing these levels and how to correct them.Here's a link that will get you started understanding the nitrogen cycle in your tank: [...]
The PH bottle was damaged and the instruction booklet had PH solution stain all over it. Very disappointing API...I have found this product very useful and necessary. Good product.

I used to have a testkit strips from Ferplast but the results it's giving me seemed inaccurate. It never shows a correct reading on nitrite and nitrate. Im glad i survived in cycling my tanks.Today, i just received this package from a seller in Ebay as the seller here in amazon has no shipment for Riyadh. I began the test for my two aquariums (10g and 20g) right away following the instructions in the manual. I was happy with the results: my 20g tank which is about 3 weeks old is already cycled (ph 7.5, NH3/NH4 0, NO2 0, and NO3 0); Whereas, my 10g tank got some nitrite and nitrate spikes, though this is a month older, got a .25 and 15 readings, respectively, with 0 Ammonia. I did an instant 30% WC to lower the figures down and doze off some prime and stability. I will try to make a test again after 2 days so as to let the biological do its job.Nevertheless, having this is really a must and im glad, i have it now. Highly recommended!Happy fish keeping!

After reading on multiple fish forums that test strips were inaccurate, I decided to purchase this kit as it was highly recommended by lots of fish keepers. It certainly lasts a long time considering I bought it six months ago and still have about half of the solutions left. Anyway, my only gripe with it is the ammonia test. I've found that it's difficult to distinguish whether the water is 0ppm or .25ppm. After testing multiple water sources (tap, bottled, tank water) I found that although the test tube appears like it could be .25 it must actually be 0ppm assuming of course that the bottled water I tested has no ammonia in it which I'm pretty confident about. Also, be sure to VIGOROUSLY shake all of the bottles before using them for the tests as some of them have particles that settle to the bottom and can result in an off reading (Nitrate Bottle #2 in particular). All in all, this is what you need if you plan on starting a serious freshwater aquarium!
summary: Works great and lasts a long time.

reviewText: These tests really helped me understand the world my fish were living in and also was great to test my own water quality.

I used this kit and a strip tester for my tank and found the titration method to be more complex and time consuming, but more accurate and easier to interpret the results.  The results are much more detailed. I just wish that there were a 5th test tube (there's only 4 for 5 tests) and I wish there were a test for water hardness.  I had to order a whole separate test online because they don't carry it at any pet stores.

This kit is wonderful and very accurate.  It also saves a lot of money than doing the strip tests and gives you more accurate measurements.  I've found it very easy to use, fast to use, and it's helped me keep my aquariums in top condition.  The only negative I can see is that it should have included one more vial since you do end up doing all the tests on the aquarium and that way you can have them all at once.  It would also be nice to be able to purchase replacement vials since they do break (glass).  Otherwise the cards are great for comparing colors, the booklet goes into detail that will help a new aquarium lover to keep their system in top form.
summary: Great test kit, essential if you have aquariums, easy directions.

reviewText: Works great but the strips might be as good in the short run.  I had water issues so I didn't want to make a mistake and ordered this that worked fine.
summary: Works great but might be over-kill

reviewText: I love this master test but I wish it came with a few other tests to really be MASTER. But the included tests works well and thats what I bought so FULL STARS!

This kit has everything you need to test for freshwater fish, NOT plants. takes about 13mins to go through the entire full spectrum test of ph, ammonia, nitrites, and nitrates. Has one regular ph test and one high level ph test.

A must have for any hobbyist.  Only reason I did not give it five stars is because the nitrate testing chemicals are 10 drops each and I seem to go through them so fast I have to always buy replacements.

This kit works great and is easy to understand. You have to follow directions closely to get accurate results. I did double check my readings with a local pet store and they seemed to be about the same. I don't know if I'll test some things very often as I'm mostly interested in Ammonia, Nitrates, and Nitrites so I wonder if I would've been better to just buy those separately.
I have been using this test kit for years. Very reliable, simple and accurate. So much better than test strips.

The Master Test Kit comes with 8 small bottles of chemicals, four plastic vials, and a number of testing cards. For each test, you take a vial of aquarium water, put in the required number of drops (it says on the bottle) and compare the color to the card. The tests are simple, and something like this is a good first step in righting water problems that can kill fish or cause algae growth.My gripe with this kit, however, is just how fragile the vials are. Simply trying to put a cap onto one of them caused it to crack right down the side. When capping them, remember to not over-tighten them.
summary: Easy to use, but easy to break

reviewText: Very affordable test kit and a great kit.  Only 2 problems... The only test I have problems with is the pH test.  If it is very high or very low it can be read easily.  Anything in the mid range makes me want to scratch my eyes out because none of the colors seems to be an exact match for what is on the printed reference card (I am getting colors that do not look anything like the reference chart).
