So I end up sort of making a best guess.  All the other tests have clearly distinguishable colors to reference in the results.  The other problem is the little test tubes included.  They are fragile and do break easily (had one break on the first batch of tests I did).  API has a set of 24 replacement tubes available which I am glad I got to go along with this kit, especially since I am testing up to six tanks at once.  If not for the pH test, this kit would have gotten 5 stars.

A must-have if you have a freshwater aquarium. Don't rely on the less-accurate and expensive test strips (one of my local big-name pet stores charges $15 for a pack of like 7 test strips.)The container for the test kit is pretty sturdy, for what it is. The tray is a bit thin and you will poke a hole through it if you are too rough. But the plastic top is much thicker.The bottles inside all fit neatly on the tray, as do the test tubes.The color chart is water-proof, and one piece, so no keeping up with multiple cards.Read the instructions. The Nitrate test requires shaking the #2 bottle for 30 seconds, and shaking the test tube for 1 minute. Otherwise your test results will be inaccurate. Also, don't hold your finger over the tube's cap as you shake, as the instructions warn you not to do, doing so may result in inaccurate results. Be careful with the Ammonia test. The first liquid is thick, and you will have to squeeze the bottle a bit to get it out. The second one is as thin as water, and if you squeeze it just as hard, it's going to put out way more than you need for the test, and it will ruin the test, and you will have to start over, and waste chemicals.Don't lose the test tubes. Replacements from API cost $2 each, or $24 for a box of 12. It might be cheaper going with generic glass 10ml tubes. I have read over time the plastic caps will slightly stretch, and not be completely water-tight anymore. At this point you might be better off finding generic 5ml test tube caps instead of ordering brand new test tubes from API.Be very careful of some of the chemicals. The irritant and corrosive warnings on some of the bottles aren't a joke. I had poured a couple test tubes out in a large jar of water, and figured I could dip the tube into the top to rinse out, and pour back into the jar. Just the few moments in the diluted water, and my thumb tingled and slightly burned.If there could be any improvements in the kit, it would be to include a dropper and maybe a small collection bottle for your aquarium water. You really shouldn't dip the tubes into the water, as any residue left in them will get into your tank. Some of these chemicals are bad-news for fish, and can straight-up kill them. I also wish the test chart had slightly more white space between color graphs, as you are supposed to place the test tubes against it to measure the color. The test tubes are slightly wider than the white space, so it's a little harder to judge accurate color unless you are in bright light.This kit is also designed to detect a certain kind of Ammonia, not straight Ammonia out of a bottle. So if you are doing a fishless cycle on your tank with Ammonia, it will not detect it correctly. It will report far less than is actually in the tank, and you will end up overdosing your tank if you rely on it. There are other test kits on the market that will accurately detect Ammonia like this.
I find this test very easy to use and seemingly accurate.  I have betta fish and did not want their water conditions to be off, now I'm able to keep on eye on exactly what their water conditions are.

Be sure to buy online rather than at Petco or such. Almost always can find for a significant cost savings. Would be nice to be able to purchase just the individual chemicals at a better price. I have found that purchasing the kit is more cost effective than buying just some chemicals resulting in to many of one type and being out of another type. Be sure to keep the color chart safe. I misplaced mine and had to buy another whole kit to be able to compare results.
summary: Easy to use, covers the parameters that you need to know

reviewText: Love this product and it is very simple to use. Thanks to the company for putting this product together. Will continue to use and will restock through Amazon as needed.

As other reviewers have stated the product information is misleading because the kit does not come included with the KH and GH test bottles. The good thing is that if you contact Amazon's great customer service they might be willing to give you a partial refund like they did with me. I wanted to be able to test for everything since this is a "Master" test kit. I'm giving the product 4 star simply because it doesn't come with those two bottles included.

This is a good kit, and the price is right.  In a local store this would be twice as expensive.  Covers all the parameters I need, the directions are clear and easy to follow.  Comes with a sheet to match colors and a log in the back of the directions to record your levels.An essential for anyone keeping fish that wants to do the job right.

I chose API Freshwater Master Test Kit because of their good reputation. This kit is very complete and test all aquarium's parameters. It has easy to follow instructions and easy to read test results.  Will recommend to anyone having fish as pets. Excellent item.

I hear it's the best freshwater testing kit, so I got it. I don't know what the others are like, but this has all the instructions, and seems clear enough. Make sure you read the instructions thoroughly before using the kit. It's not as simple as put in drops in some cases. Not much more complicated, but there're usually some amount of shaking of the test tubes involved.
summary: Did what it's designed to do

reviewText: My 55 gallon fish tank is cystral clear and I use this about one time a month and no problems.
This comes with everything you need. It's very simple and very easy to use. I'm very pleased with it so far.
the user guide is very straight forward, clear and easy to operate, the color compare sheet is very easy to recognize! highly recommended!

This is a must have item for anyone keeping anything more advanced than tetras or guppies. A great value since they sell in stores for almost twice what you pay here on Amazon. And liquid tests are much more accurate than the little test strips.
summary: A must have for aquarium hobbyists

reviewText: Test kit is perfect for testing my water parameter even though the cap for the test tube LEAKED! It is horrifying to see the chemical flying everywhere when I try to shake the tube to mix the chemical together. Overall, great product with perfect step-by-step instructions. Recommended to everyone who own an aquarium.
summary: Test kit is great but not perfect

reviewText: They don't call it the "Master Test Kit" for nothing.If you keep freshwater fish, you will need this test kit. It contains all the must know tests to ensure your water quality is up to par for your tropical fish. The importance of a kit like this really shines while you are cycling a tank and it's critical you know how the cycle is progressing. A liquid test kit like this one is far more accurate than using strips, and is cheaper in the long run.A brand new aquarium will experience what is called a cycle. Fish produce waste in the form of Ammonia, which is pretty toxic to the fish and has long term health effects, and possibly death. Bacteria that naturally exists everywhere in the air will enter the tank and feed off the ammonia. The bacteria produce Nitrite as a waste and unfortunately this is even more toxic to fish than the original ammonia was. However, again, there is a natural bacteria in the air that will enter the tank and consume the Nitrite, and in the process produce Nitrate (with an a). Nitrate, again, is toxic to fish but they can tolerate it far better than ammonia or nitrite.A tank is fully cycled when both Ammonia and Nitrite (with an i) are 0 ppm and you have some reading of Nitrate (with an a).And this is why this test kit comes in handy, it contains tests for Ammonia, Nitrite, Nitrate, pH, and high range pH. You'll likely only use one or the other for pH depending on what your tap water is (acidic or basic).All of the tests are easy to perform, and the kit comes with 4 test tubes allowing you to perform all of the needed tests at once. A word of caution, follow the directions closely for the Nitrate test, it requires you to shake the #2 reagent bottle for a period of time. This is essential for an accurate reading.CAUTION: If you use a water conditioner that will also detoxify ammonia (for example Seachem Prime), this test kit will still show an Ammonia reading. This is because the conditioner converts the Ammonia to Ammonium, a chemical that still contains the Ammonia but in a non-toxic form to fish.
summary: A must have for any freshwater aquarium

reviewText: Having three aquariums, we would periodically go to the local pet store when either the water seemed a bit "off" or some or all of the fish were behaving oddly. At the pet store, they use test strips, and the results from those can be very inaccurate. The instructions included with the API test kit make it very easy to obtain samples correctly, and the API test kit provides much more accurate results than you will get from test strips.This kit is an excellent item to have on hand for your freshwater aquarium, both for periodic checkups (I check out water about once every six months because of some issues with the local water supply) and for those times when the fish or their water seem unhealthy or unbalanced. A great kit that includes all the major test types at a great price.
summary: Far superior to test strips, well worth the money and effort

reviewText: I bought this as a gift for daughter's new aquarium.  Water testing is very important and this product seems to do that accurately.  We have compared the result of its testing to the result from local pet stores, and find it to match the pros readings.

I've been using this for a while now and it's really great. It has a lot of tests so I never worry about the tests running out. I like the case for everything. It's easy to put it all away. The tests have really helped us refine and improve our aquarium. Totally recommended.

This costs much more at the store, buy it here instead! Kit works great, much better than test strips, although it does require a bit more work.  The only thing I would buy in addition to this kit is a water hardness tester, something like the API GH&KH Test kit.
summary: Great all around kit for this price.

reviewText: What can be said?  It is an aquarium test kit.  Works great for my needs and should last a long time.
No complaints. I needed this. CANT BEAT THE PRICE! Petco and Petsmart offers this for $30-35. Screw that! this is the best

Easy to use and very accurate. I had my water professionally tested and it was about the same as what I got. Comes with enough tests for years for a filtered uncycled or stable nitrogen cycle tank. Follow the instructions very closely every time.
summary: first time tank owner loves it

reviewText: Good price for a complete testing kit. Easy to test and seems to be accurate. Have trouble with consistent PH readings...
Good Kit and way less expensive than LFS. Totally worth the money. Was delivered on time and would definitely order again

Everything is accurate, just make sure you follow instructions per the manual. If you don't shake properly it can greatly change the results. That being said, my only qualm is the fact that in the Nitrate testing color chart, the 10 and 20 PPM look like the same color.

This product is very accurate in measuring the makeup of the water in your tank.  It helps you check if the levels of PH, ammonia, nitrite, and nitrate are acceptable for the fish.  Highly recommended.

This is a great kit if your looking to keep an eye on your fish friend's water. I would like to air two small gripes...1. That "Over 800 Tests" on the front probably means total, not for each individual test (so your getting about 200 tests of each chemical). Not terrible but I think a bit misleading.2. DON'T DROP THE TEST TUBES. I dropped one on a tile floor my first week with the kit and went to buy a replacement online. I wouldn't mind buying a 4 or 6 or even 10 pack of them. But the smallest replacement pack is 24 tubes... what would I do with 24 tubes? But it's easy enough to test, dump and grab more water.Overall a great kit if your paranoid about water quality like me.
Wonderful product. Get it if you can. Keep your water safe with this kit. I love it and use it frequently.
It's important to keep the parameters of an aquarium stable, and this is necessary to meet that end. I use it monthly.
great kit. Comes with great instructions and plenty of supplies. the supplies come with enough for more testing than you'll likely every do.
Yes I love this. I can test my tanks when ever I want. Very easy just wish they included a dropper. would be nice all the money you pay retail for this
This is a great system to have. I enjoy checking the water to see if everything is good with the fish and the tank. Now my fish are very happy and there home is fresh, clear, and clean.

This is very helpful and a must for everyone who owns a fish tank.There is already hundreds of positive review about this test kit, and it really works!When cycling a tank, keep track of your ammonia level, when it hits 0ppm, keep track of your nitrite level, when it hits 0ppm, your tank is cycled.Highly recommended!
summary: Great product, especially when cycling a tank

reviewText: Price is better than LPS price. If you decide on the strips, I suggest you get this at least at start up. To me accuracy is the key, even if it takes longer to test. I've learned that if you don't worry yourself to death, once your tank is up and running just test occasionally. No need to test weekly, that is more a standard, and most likely written to have you use the product more (good sells plan:).

Tests 5 things: Ph, High Ph, Ammonia, Nitrites and Nitrates. Comes with 4 test tubes with stoppers, so I use the same test tube for both Ph and High Ph. Most tests can be performed in less than 5 minutes start to finish. Ammonia and Nitrates take a few minutes longer. The instructions are written fairly well and give advice what to do if the results are not in the normal range - some suggestions are to buy the products they sell, of course.  The only thing I could not find in the directions was how to safely discard of the used test tube liquids and how to clean the tubes.The manual has blank pages for keeping track of your tank tests results. The results seem very accurate, much more than the test strips I was using. I use a small measuring cup to pour water from the aquarium into each test tube. I do not like to dip the used tubes into the aquarium once the tube has had chemicals in it, even after I rinse it out.
This is a complete testing kit for fish tanks.  You need ALL these tests to properly keep your tank water safe.  I've looked around and this is the best test and the best price.

This is a really nice kit, it is very easy to use and all of the bottles are well labeled with instructions for each chemical. Amazon sells the kit for $20 bucks cheaper than the local pet supplies store and $10 cheaper than Petsmart.

PH test kit works.  Nitrite test works.  Ammonia test works.  Nitrate test kit fails.  Nitrate results always yield 0 PPM, which couldn't be right since I dose Nitrate in my planted aquarium every other day.  Also, confirmed this when I brought my water sample to my LFS and my nitrate was 20~30 PPM as I expected using EI dosing schedule.
summary: API was recommended amongst most brands

reviewText: I like this kit. It is accurate and easy to use. Obviously clean up is a pain.I gave it 4 stars because one of the nipples on the chemical bottle was defective and bent so the drop size is larger than it should be.  All in all I am happy with it.
summary: Works perfect. A must have for any fish keeper.

reviewText: This kit has everything you need to test the most important freshwater parameters. Easy to follow instructions make testing quick and easy.  Comes in a nice storage container too.  Stop the guess work and get one of these!
summary: A must for every freshwater hobbyst

reviewText: I think that this test kit would be a good investment for any freshwater aquarium owner. It is pretty inexpensive ($20 cheaper here than at my local pet store, and certainly more cost effective than buying test strips), seems to be accurate, and provides all the tests the average tank owner would need. The tests are easy to perform and it only takes a few minutes to complete (btw, regarding other reviewers' complaints about how long it took - if you don't have ~5 minutes to spare in your week you probably shouldn't be keeping fish).I originally bought this kit while doing a fishless cycle and was having serious questions about the accuracy of the dipstick tests I'd bought first. I felt much more comfortable with the results I got using the tube method. With the strips I had a hard time reading the results for nitrites and nitrates, it was much easier with this kit.I typically only use the nitrate test now to ensure I'm keeping up with my water changes, however I do periodically check the pH, ammonia, and nitrite just to make sure that nothing weird is going on. I'll use a medicine dropper I bought from the dollar store to fill the test tubes and perform all 4 tests at once (depending on the pH of your water, you only need to do either the normal pH or high pH, not both, so 4 tubes is sufficient).The ammonia and nitrate tests can be a little messy as water can seep around the cap, so I use cling wrap or parafilm, making sure to keep one finger over the open end just in case. It's best to read the test in a brightly lit room under white light; I check it under the fluorescent lights in the kitchen. They're all easy enough to read, and even if you can't find an EXACT match to a color on the chart, you'll get a pretty good idea of what your levels are.I do wish a hardness test was included, but for the average person it isn't really needed. It can be bought separately anyway, and given how inexpensive the master kit is here on Amazon, you'll still be paying less than if you'd bought the master kit alone at a brick and mortar store.
works great pretty easy to do all the test, wish there was one more test tube, but everything else is nice well packaged, explained in various languages and pretty comprehensive.

This master Test Kit has everything you will need to keep your tank healthy. Along with each test comes a booklet telling you what each test means. I also like there is a space to write down your results. Thus being able to compare where your tank has been and how to improve it in the future.
This test kit works perfectly and with excellent precision not to mention that it is very advantageous to purchase the kit out instead of separate

This is an absolute necessity if you have an aquarium.  It's awesome because it makes you feel like an actual chemist in an a la Walter White kind of way. Works well, doesnt need a pH calibration like the old version of these tests did.

Overall happy with the purchase and all API products. I wish their was a quick instruction guid like the color code chart. Also wish the test chart broke some colors down more into smaller segments. I know API says they don't bc the eye can't determine a difference that small but I would like to try.
I test my water way more than I should.  But it's nice to have something as reliable as this test kit.

I gave this product four stars just because it doesn't come with a hardness test. I mean, come on, its supposed to be a "master kit"--now I have to fork out another $10 just see how hard/soft my water is? For that, I feel kind of jipped. However, it does what it is supposed to do. The NitrATE test is a bit ridiculous. And the ammonia test requires 8 drips from one bottle followed by 8 drips from another bottle, therefore if you are testing everyday with a new tank (like me) the stuff can run out pretty quickly. But, like I said, it seems to work and is fairly comprehensive aside from lacking a water hardness test. AND this seems to be the kit most people recommend. 4 stars.
summary: Seems to be the one everyone recommends.

reviewText: This is my first time getting a freshwater testing kit, but I am so glad I got this one.  The price is very good compared to other's and it comes with all the levels you need to test.  pH, higher pH, nitrite, nitrate, and ammonia testing.  Very easy to use as well.  Each bottle says how many drops you need and you just fill the water to the line.  Shake a little and wait 5 minutes.  Very quick and painless.  Rinse them out and your good to go again.  I highly recommend this kit for anyone who needs to test their fish water.
There really isn't a need for reviews. This is the only test kit you should buy. It is accurate and easy to use.
summary: Buy it! Your fish will thank you!

reviewText: Then this is the kit for you! Kit includes everything you need to make brightly colored fluids out of your fish tanks' normally clear-ish water. Made me go "mwah ha ha ha haaa" the first time. Quality kit, the test tubes are great and having 4 allows for simultaneous testing of the key parameters. Extremely helpful as I did a fish-in cycle and needed to monitor closely to make sure no one died. ;) Thanks to the kit, all 3 fish survived the cycle, and we are now a mature tank!
summary: Wannabe Mad Scientist with a fish tank?

reviewText: Test tubes! Indicator tests! Fun!But really, comes with all of the tests you really need for general tank upkeep for a fraction of the price.Very useful.
Great test kit, a staple for any aquarist. No complaints - Always use liquid tests over strips, they're more accurate!

Cons- Multi-language instructions.I get that these are sold worldwide and you want to make one universal instruction booklet but honestly it's a pain to go page by page and look for your little section for your language. The only plus is that when you have done it long enough you probably won't need the booklet unless to reference for corrections to the tests.- Caps.These do not seal firmly. You can't invert or shake these containers without the test liquid getting on your hand. Even if you wrap the top in a towel to prevent it from getting on your hands you are still absorbing the liquid. I don't know if this alters the test parameters but it doesn't scream accuracy.- Hard to distinguish colors.Do I have 0 ammonia or .25ppm ammonia? Sometimes it's incredibly difficult to distinguish because the increments in color are so close to one another that you almost have to guess.- Doesn't include all the tests.GH/KH test sold separately, and I'm sure there are others I'm missing. When it's called the "master" test kit, I would think it would have all the tests available. While I knew that it didn't include these tests I just want to make it known and this part doesn't reflect on my rating.ProsFor the price you won't find another suitable kit and this is essential if you want a healthy aquarium, especially if you're just starting out where testing is important before adding livestock.
summary: The kit does the job but could use some improvements.

reviewText: Four of five tests are fairly straightforward.  The ammonia test, however, requires mixing the 5ml of tank water with 10 drops of one solution, shaking a second solution bottle for 30 seconds, adding 10 drops from it, then shaking the test tube for one minute, and then waiting 5 minutes to test color against a chart.  Seems a bit much, no?  That being said, this process isn't any more difficult than any other system I've seen, and it seems to be accurate.  The color chart is waterproof, though the instruction manual isn't, and due to the moist nature of its application, make sure to memorize instructions quickly.  API is by far the most highly recommended test kit on every freshwater tank forum I've read, and I found it here a good bit cheaper than at my local (chain) pet store.  Be aware that the test tubes are glass and will occasionally shatter when trying to juggle all 4 at once, but I've only once needed to test for everything - the first day the kit came in.  Nitrates are probably the only regular (weekly) test you'll have to do outside of changes to the tank, such as adding fish or changing substrate or filter media.FYI each bottle has a printed "Lot Number" on the back, the last four digits of which are the month and year of manufacture.  Anything over three years or so is getting old, and you'll probably want an exchange unless you test with great frequency.  These chems definitely have a finite shelf life.Oh, and anyone who has live plants in a tank will want phosphates and KH test kits as well.

It's probably been nearly a decade since I had an aquarium, and I'm just getting back in to the hobby. With a smaller 10-gallon tank, I knew that keeping my levels in check would be particularly important. I've heard great things about this kit, and Amazon's price was great, so I gave it a shot.I can't believe how great this kit is! Out of the tap, my water is off the charts (well, aquarium charts) when it comes to pH, and having the separate "regular" and "high" pH tests available was great. And that's just the beginning.By the time I was done testing ammonia, nitrites, and nitrates, I felt like I was running a small chem-lab. It was pretty fun, until the day my daughter emptied a fresh container of food in to the tank. That's when this kit was nothing short of invaluable, to assess the damage, and ensure a steady recovery. (Incidentally, I'm happy to report that we had a 100% survival rate, thanks in no small part to this kit.)The only downer is that Amazon packaged this along with aheavy metal CAT5 crimper, which damaged one of the glass test tubes in shipping. Of course, Amazon handled the situation perfectly, but if you're not bunching up orders to get Super Saver Shipping, you might want to buy this separately, so it arrives in its own box.
summary: A must-have for any aquarium hobbyist.

reviewText: this kit is a need for aquarist. very easy to use and accuracy. i check the water quality once a week to make sure everything is fine.

I needed to buy all of these tests but my husband didn't like how expensive they all were.. FINALLY remembered seeing this kit on here awhile ago and was able to get all the tests I needed! Now I can make sure everything is healthy and keep my fish happy. Such a good deal and will buy again. Will recommend to anyone who asks me for advice on freshwater tests. :)
It is easy to use this product. The readings chart is of good quality. Works well. More cost effective than the quick dip strips.
this is an essential part of getting the tank ready for fish (cycling) and maintaining the ideal condition for a healthy tank!

I've worked with and kept freshwater aquarium fish for years. In stores and in my home this is the kit that I choose to use because it contains 2 pH, Ammonia, Nitrite, and Nitrate tests. Other test kits do not last as long. The box that it comes with helps to keep the glass test tubes from rattling around and hold the bottles upright without losing anything. My only complaint comes about the results cards...they are easy to misplace and do not hold up as well when wet as I feel a test kit should.Overall, this is the best and cheapest water test kit that you can get. It will last for years.
summary: Just about the best you can get for the money

reviewText: The standard for the hobbyist. Generous amounts. Stamped with expiration date. Mine came dated exp. 2018. Simple, easy to use. Necessary to monitor water health considering the cost of ordinary tropicals.

I bought this product after receiving advice from [...] When I tested for the first time everything came back perfect. I then decided to add more fish to my tank and after a couple of days I had a huge Ammonia spike. This test kit saved all of my fishes lives because I was able to do a water change right away (after finding out that I had Ammonia in the tank.)I also was having a problem with too much Ammonia in my tank even after a water change. I decided to test my tap water and I found out that I had 1ppm of ammonia coming from my tap. That is a crazy amount.Buy this product and you will not be disappointed. The only negative I have about it is that the Nitrate test takes a while. It is a lot of shaking the bottle of test solution 2 and the test tube. It is still pretty easy and you can have all of the test preformed in a few minutes.

I've been using this product (all tests except ammonia) for about 6 months for weekly testing in a koi pond.  Tests appear accurate and easy to use with good directions for the "trickier" multi-reagent tests.  I'm very happy with the kit and will be buying another for work.
summary: Excellent for a low-cost / lo-tech kit!

reviewText: Great water test kit especially for a beginner. Directions are detailed and easy to understand. Tests are super easy. Recommended.

Great value from Amazon.  Much cheaper than buying from pet store.  More accurate than test strips but also more work.  I regularly use the Ammonia, Nitrite, and Nitrate tests.  If you are lazy buy the test strips instead.  A less accurate test is better than not testing the water at all.
summary: best test kit but take work

reviewText: I've used the API and Nutrafin kits.  I've found this one to be easier to use.  The bottles are better labeled, and the tubes can stand on their own.  The Nutrafin ammonia test is better, but otherwise, I get the same results with the API kit.  I DO recommend added a box of extra glass tubes to your order.  Pretty simple to break.
This kit has all the basic needs.  A few of the items in the kit are only needed once every 3 to 6 months but thats why buying it as a whole kit is great.  all the testing supplies are replaceable

At first I was reluctant to get this item as some reviews on Amazon stated that they received an outdated test kit that was already a couple years past the expiration date.  But had a good breath of relief when the expiration date said 2018, that's 5 years!  Not too shabby.  I have never had a liquid test kit before purchasing this so I assumed it tested for almost anything.  I was only slightly disappointed that the kit does not test for Kh and Gh.  And there are not test kits that only read for Kh and Gh, so I have to buy the API test strips that test for everything if I want to see the status of my Kh and Gh.  Sour about that.  That's the only reason this gets 4 stars instead of 5.  Other than that, it accurately measures Ammonia, Nitrites, Nitrates, and Ph.  4 Stars!

This master test kit tests everything that I need to test to keep my system in good shape.  Much better price than at the local pet store.  I much prefer the old test tube method of water tests over using strips, and this kit is much cheaper than strips would cost anyway.
The instructions are very clear, and it takes no more than 5 min to do a pair of tests. I'd recommend it.

I really enjoy this product. The convinience to do the analysis almost every day at a negligeble cost. My water has a very veird pH so I have the tendency to keep it monitored almost every day, I don't have nitrogen problems, so I don't care much obut those one.Like the strips it is a colorimetric methods, and sometimes you have an indication of what is your status. I work in a lab, and I have access to a bench pH meter, so every once in a while I test the pH in the lab, and with my surprice this test is much more accurate than the strip one. I use to use the API strips and the pH always resulted higher than the one I measure in the lab, however, whith this colorimetric it can get pretty close.The price of this is good, about 10$ in savings compare to the pet store.
summary: Cheap solution for long term analysis

reviewText: I came to amazon for this product because it was so much cheaper than the local pet stores.  The instructions explain how to do all the water testing, so you should have no issues.  I would recommend cleaning out the test tubes and not leaving the test water with solutions in them for long as they will start to slightly stain the glass (particularly the one that will appear yellow).  This could make it more difficult to get a good reading if your glass is already stained partly yellow.Been using the set for a year an still have plenty left.  Initially, we were testing quite frequently during the tank cycling.  Now we test about once a month to check the water is staying healthy.
This kit is exactly what I needed. Will last me years to come. Everything for beginners getting into aquariums;such as myself .

I'm not going to write much about this product since there are plenty of reviews about this item however I do have to say... This item is a MUST HAVE for every aquarium and aquarists out. It's waaaaay cheaper purchasing through Amazon than through pet chain stores (ie. Petco, Petsmart or LFS). I bought this for 18 bucks, but now its 15, keep checking for prices on Amazon, you might get lucky and get it cheaper!!

I've used test strips before but wanted a more accurate test after redesigning my tank. Everywhere I looked on the internet people recommended this testing kit. I was happy to find this test kit cheaper than local fish or pet stores. Nothing was broken or leaking when I opened it and the test tubes seem fairly durable. The kit was really straightforward on how to test the water and each bottle is labeled with the number of drops needed. The laminated color card is really nice since its constantly by water and getting wet. Overall I'm really happy with this kit.
Don't bother with any other testing methods or strips. Get this kit and learn how to use it. Then you can buy refill bottles when you need to. I wouldn't trust anything else.
summary: This is the kit you want.

reviewText: Bought this for my 4 fish tanks. Very nice! Exactly what I needed. Saves money and lasts a long time. Fast shipping.
Very good test kit. comes with directions and easy to follow. however, whenever I do a water test, all the results shows i have no ammonia, nitrate and nitrite at all...so I assume it's good ?

I bought this kit mainly for the nitrates and nitires part of it and it is just wwhat i wanted... it was easy to use and instead of just a color chart it also tells you the PPM's that basically tells you just more in detail of the water condition
Awesome, it does the job, it does what we needed it to do. We do plan to buy it again.
I bought this to use on my 40 gallon breeder tank. It is very handy and informative. I recommend for fish tank owners

Don't waste your time with strip kits, the results are never accurate.  Spend the money for this kit and long term you will not be disappointed.  The chemicals themself will last a long time, you won't be needing to replace this kit frequently.  The results are so accurate that if you stick with your changes and testing you'll know about a problem immediately and can resolve it long before it affects fish.
summary: If you own more than a beta you need to invest in this

reviewText: If you don't have this yet then you must have this!  I have a fish room with 14 good sized freshwater species tanks and this test kit is the best I've tried.  And I've tried just about all the kits in the market.The only caution I would give is to watch the expiration date.  Also, the testing solutions may go bad as the bottles are constantly exposed to air.  So, I would replace them once every two years regardless of the expiration date.The color chart can be tricky to read under dim light, so check against bright light in order to get the shades correct.  I typically compare under a full spectrum day light bulb in one of the tanks.Strongly recommended.
summary: a must have for any freshwater aquarist

reviewText: Thanks for your awesome product and fast packaging, handling and shipping process. I'm now in charge of my tank water's chemistry and very comfortable with this test kit. It also help me save money and time with completely confined. Thanks
It is very important to have the right water quality. I have African chiclids and it is crucial to have the correct pH and what not balanced in their water.
This is a nice kit and easy to use. Test strips are easier, true, but expensive. I will be using this product from now on.

I received it today and wanted to check out my water right away. (i found out most of the bottles were frozen from shipping) but once they thawed, i tried them all out. They all seem to work great! would buy this again.

I'm only giving this three stars, not because of the product but because of the way it was shipped. The box on arrival was smashed, when I opened it, the tray and cover for the kit were totally destroyed. I've thrown away the tray container, ordinarily I would have sent it back but I needed this kit badly...I've decided to keep the rest and will make something to keep everything together with. The product is easy to use and accurate, I've been using API products for a while and I trust them.

This is by far the best freshwater testing kit I’ve used. It is a great value. If you use those test strips, you will find two things: they are very expensive, and they aren’t accurate. A liquid test kit like this one is much more accurate, and the API kit is very affordable. It comes with PH, High Range PH, Nitrite, Nitrate, and Ammonia testing. There are four test tubes with caps. It is very simple to use and it comes with detailed instructions.

This a very nice test kit for testing Ammonia, Nitrite, Nitrate, and pH. Easy to follow instructions. The bottles are marked with the test they are for and how many drops are to be used. Test tubes are easy to fill, marked with proper water level, and the lids fit nicely. Easy to read color sheet for determining test results. Test instructions are easy to read and follow. Instruction book also includes a log to record results (good for one aquarium only unless you use a different page for each one).Highly recommended.Oct. 28, 2012:This test kit has been very useful. I am very happy with the test kit. It is easy to use and has helped my greatly in keeping my aquarium water correct.

This come with all the solutions plus 4 test tubes and instructions @ a very good price,  It is cheaper to by the whole kit then separate solutions/test tubes, so when I run out, I will just buy an entire kit.  Very easy to understand, LOVE IT!!!
a must for any aquarium lover and cheaper than the local pet store. a must have. better than test strips and more acurate.
summary: a must for any aquarium lover

reviewText: This arrived promptly and was in good condition.Have used it a few times, it seems to work fine.Don't know how you could tell if it wasn't giving accurate results?
API makes good aquarium chemicals, both for testing as well as keeping the aquarium water itself safe and healthy for the fish.

This is THE test kit for freshwater tanks. I have been in the hobby for approximately 6 years and I quickly found this kit to be the most reliable as well as being widely available. It may be pricier than the dry "test strips" available but I wouldn't trust one of those if it was free. This liquid kit is what we used in the specialty aquarium shop where I worked, on our own water and on our customers' samples. This test kit is what I will always use, and contains all necessary tests. You're not paying for any frivolous tests. Your fishies will fare better with these tests.
So easy to understand and such a useful tool to have - no fish-keeper should be without this kit! Excellent.

API is a giant among companies that provide aquarium related products.They have maintained their sound reputation by offering innovative products and resisting the temptation to tamper with those which are already established and are time proven, dependable performers.The Fresh Water Master Test Kit belongs in the arsenal of tank maintenance and care products for every level of hobbyist from beginner to advanced.It's important to understand that these kits provide an indication only - it's unrealistic to expect a pin point reading as the tests aren't intended nor made to deliver that. But rather, to enable you to get a decent reading of say, where your PH level is knowing the accuracy may be off a few points sure beats shelling out $200 for a good digital PH meter.It's critical to understand these limitations and that they apply to everyone of the four included tests.PHHigh Range PHAmmoniaNitritesNitratesFor must of us, Ammonia is the most important because it's the number one killer of aquarium kept fish. The others are important of course, but Ammonia levels should always be checked and checked often. It's also important to pay attention to the expiration dates of the liquid reagents. Expired reagents mean off the charts inaccurate readings. Along with the liquid reagents the kit includes, instructions both in a small manual and attached to each bottle of testing liquid, four test tube, four plastic caps and a color chart.To ensure you get the most accurate reading possible compare the finished result to the card color block in the best possible light and against the most pure white background you can find. Just like computer monitors many of us see color differently which is the inherent draw back of this type of testing. But again, there is nothing else on the market at this kind of price point which can give you enough information to correct and adjust your key water parameters.If you're just starting out in this wonderful hobby, you'll master using this kit in no time and it will help you maintain a healthy and flourishing aquarium. Remember to never, ever rinse even cleaned test tubes in your tank water - even very small traces of testing reagents can be lethal to your fish.Draw water from your tank using a large plastic syringe available at any drug store, super market, or add one to cart from Amazon.For a full range of tests that cover the four most significant parameters you need to stay on top of - you can't beat the API Master test kits, not at this price. You can also buy replacement API test tubes which are sold in boxes of a dozen or 24 at a reasonable price, and a steal at Amazon.
summary: A Must Have Test Kit For Every Level Of Hobbyist

reviewText: Essentially everything you will need to monitor your aquarium's water parameters.Seemingly accurate, and easy to use.Would buy again.

So far everything works as advertised.  The tests are simple to perform.  It comes with four test tubes (not actual test tubes) that has 5 mL marking.  Some notable:  (1) the instructions are written in small type. For you middle-agers out there, you'll need reading glasses.  You'll find it easier to write the desired test results like pH, nitrate, nitrite, etc on a larger piece of paper rather than looking at the small print all the time.  (2) there is a section in the back of the instructions are some blank tables for you to write test results in (i.e. logs), you might want to use your own logs.  Finally, you'll need to be able to count to 10 as you are putting the drops in the test vessels.
summary: Good basic set of tests. Instructions are in small print.

reviewText: I have been using these kits for years and they are great... just be mindful that the test kits do expire and once they do it will alter your test results but the one i got from Amazon doesn't expire until 2018... and you can't beat the fact that it is literally half the price of petco or petsmart and about a third the price of the specialty fish stores around me... and you simply can't argue with that!
i got this kit for my aquarium and i am very happy using it. the instruction are very clear, they are not too easy but if read they should be no problem.
much better and more accurate than the test strips, have been using this particular test kits for years , always accurate

I'm new to fishkeeping- I purchased a tank with all the trimmings and a lovely betta a few months ago. I used SafeStart to cycle my tank, but soon realized checking my water perimeters was far more important than I had previously thought. For one I didn't even know if my tank had actually cycled or not! Was the ammonia too high? Heck if I knew! So I purchased this.This kit is easy to to use, the instructions easy to follow. The only think that irks me is that for nitrates, several of the colors on the card are the SAME EXACT COLOR. I've looked at it in different lighting conditions, and had other people do the same. So is the nitrate level 10ppm or 20ppm? No one knows, cause the colors for both are exactly the same! Same for 40ppm and 80ppm. Knocked it down a star for that.
summary: Now I know the water is okay!

reviewText: Do not buy anything else. Pay the extra $$ and buy this product. I am confident my water quality is excellent with this product.
Must have for any aquarium keeper.

This kit is easy to use, accurate, and for the price on Amazon I don't think you can beat it. The guides and charts included are helpful, giving advice on what do to if your water parameters are unhealthy.It can take time to memorize/learn how to do each test, as each on is a little different. But I enjoy it, I always feel like a chemist when I'm testing my water!If you have a freshwater tank, you absolutely need this!

I love this kit! Easily tests the PH (high and low), ammonia levels, nitrate levels, and nitrite levels fast and effectively. An extremely handy color chart for all of the listed levels is provided and makes identification of ppm/ph fast and easy. I have absolutely no gripes about this product, get it!

I have always used this product and it has never dissapointed. Just make sure that wherever you get it from that it is not expired. The one from Amazon does not expire for a few years and I was very happy about that.
Works well for a cheap test kit. Using the card can be questionable sometimes as it looks different in different light.

I use this for both fresh water and salt water even though its a fresh water master test kit it provides high range PH and all the other tests are the same only thing you need is phosphates, calcium KH and GH and your all set  not a bad deal for what I use it for cheaper then buying at a LFS

I have a tube of the test strips, but things like pH and Nitrites I wanted better measurements of. This kit works great, and gives very accurate measurements of pH and High pH values (separate tests), as well as Ammonia (I use the Seneye monitoring system for this too), but also tests for Nitrites and Nitrates.Since my water is very hard, it's hard to lower the pH below 8, so I may have to use RO/DI water, or find a pitcher filter or something to provide better water when I do water changes. So far the pH of 8 seems ok for the 5 Tetras, the Angelfish, Pleco, and a few ghost/cherry shrimp, and my fav little dwarf crayfish.
summary: Works great, easy to use, accurate results

reviewText: Would not have an aquarium without a good test kit. With keeping fish it is a must to know the water parameters.This is a great kit you can also supplement it with a KH and GH test kit from api.
summary: Great kit for testing water parameters.

reviewText: Compared to test kits I purchased years ago, this is more complete and a lot cheaper. Tested two aquariums in about 20 min. Nice case to store in it. Would recommend this kit.

I have been using this test kit since I've owned my aquarium and I must says it has been very beneficial. It is easy to use and once you get into the routine of using it, you will not need to read the instructions. I recommend this test kit to anyone with  an aquarium.
summary: a great test kit. a must have for any aquarium owner.

reviewText: I've always loved these master test kits. They don't degrade quickly like the strips do and I believe they are far more accurate than the strips are. Easy to use instructions that are in the user manual as well as on the front of the bottle. And I love the tube holder.

I like the fact that you have a comprehensive test kit with plenty of the various fluids to test the water for perhaps years to come.  I took a star away because the instructions aren't that clear (which is sadly the norm with products nowadays).
I already used this and it is very accurate. I know that it's accurate because I have used other water tests from other makers to test the quality of my tap water and the results are the same.
this was a better value than buying the individual tests that i had run out of. works as expected.  and a must for water quality
I could not be happier with this water test kit. So fair in price. Seller great to work with. Instructions are easy to understand. Will definitely will buy again. Highly recommend!!!

Plenty of chemical to test many times!  I love how useful and fun this kit is!After testing many times, you get to the point of being able to tell by looking at your water that there is something wrong.  Having this kit tells you what it is!! :)
It came in just a few days.  All product and information was available as described.  Tests are seem to be accurate.  I'll buy again.
I bought this item as a new fish tank owner, not knowing what I would need, and this item helped me get the right balance for my fish tank.

I've been using API test kits for decades.  Recently, a nitrate kit that must be over 15 years old started reading about 30ppm for all my tanks.  I didn't realize anything was amiss until fish started getting sick.  I suspected something wrong with my kit and ordered a new complete Master Test Kit, because all my separate kits were very old, as well, and then the truth came to light.I'd told myself during this past year that the less than 20 bucks was worth it, but I was complacent that everything was fine, and I never got this Master Kit as a fresh replacement for the expired ones.  Now two extremely large fancy goldfish are dead, and 4 others are still (we'll see) recovering, because the nitrates had drifted into the 100-150ppm range probably for months.  One heatwave to bring it all to a head, and I'm still mopping up disease 2 months later.  I've spent $50 on pharmaceutical-grade medications and $100 on a UV sterilizer so far, plus other little expenses here and there.  And there's no guarantee the other 4 fish will make it.SO DON'T LET THIS HAPPEN TO YOU!  All kits have expiration dates, and this API Master Kit is not only accurate and has all the tank-startup/everyday maintenance tests you'll need, but it's extremely inexpensive when you think about what can happen if you don't have working kits.  Don't be a dummy like me, and GET A FRESH SET OF TESTS TODAY.
summary: Don't let disaster happen by letting your test kits get old!

reviewText: Everything you need in one test kit. The testing tubes are held in the container so that there is no accidental spills.

And should have for all other fishkeepers. This is the standard test kit in the hobby. I have looked into other kits, but this one is probably the easiest one to use. If you ask questions on any fishkeeping forum this kits readings gonna be the ones most people are going to ask for. I know all kits should produce the same readings, but they dont. Some kits measure different ions of the various chemicals you will be testing for. Others just have different colored reagents, which can be another source of confusion when trying to figure out where your levels are. I do wish there was more of a color gradient to the results, some times it's kinda hard to say exactly what your levels are. But i think we might be limited by chemistry and price point there.

This test kit only measures four things:  pH, ammonia, nitrate, nitrite.These are the critical basics, but a "master" test kit should have all of the tests that a "master" aquarist would need, such as general hardness, carbonate hardness, and phosphate.  Gh and Kh are both included in the API "professional" kit, but the price difference is kind of ridiculous.  Unless the "professional" kit comes with super-sized bottles of test chemicals, it's much cheaper to get this kit, then purchase the missing tests individually & throw them all into a recycled fishing tackle box.  If anyone out there knows the size of the chemical bottles in the "professional" kit versus the "master" kit and individual tests, post the sizes please.The tests themselves are high quality and easy to perform.  As long as you're not color blind, they are also easy to read and accurate.  :)I find it helpful to compare my liquid tests results with a 5 in 1 test strip every now and then, just to confirm I'm getting reasonably accurate readings.

Perfect! Easy to use, instructions are clear, and comes with a card to tell you what to do to correct problems with your tank chemistry. The color card is easy to use as well and easy to tell he color differences. Can't maintain a good aquarium without it!

I bought this test kit instead of using expensive test strips that are not as accurate and it is also cheaper than buying these tests individually.  Buying from amazon was about 10 dollars cheaper than at the big box stores.

I am new to the aquarium hobby and the idea of testing my own water was very intimidating to me.  However after some encouragement from some well experience hobbyist, I ventured out with this kit.  I have to say it has totally been worth it.  It is worth every penny.  It is more accurate than any test strip kit you will ever get.  You will get WAY more tests out of this kit than you will out of any test strip bottle as well.I would LOVE to give this a 5 stars, but the color chart would need some improvement.  I would like for it to be more detailed.  I hear that the individual test bottles have better color charts.  I have contacted API directly to see about getting the individual charts for easier color reading.
summary: Much needed item for any hobbyist

reviewText: It's a good product does what it say's it'll do with lots of test much better the the strip tests

i used this to monitor my water chemistry every few days when my tank was cycling.  i use this now every few weeks and i'm really happy at how long it has lasted me.  the chemicals also have a longer than expected expiration date.  i'm glad they have a test kit that's more accurate than those strips!!!  it gives me more confidence in the results and saves fishes lives!
This test kit is the same as what is sold at your lfs. I got this one because of the great price, even with shipping cost, this cost was a lot less. All tests work as it should.
summary: freshwater master test kit - best price around

reviewText: There is a reason why this is the #1 selling product in test kits and that's because it's great.  I'm new to the fish hobby and like everyone else they started off with test strips etc.  While the strips were accurate enough they were expensive.  The Freshwater Master Kit gives you all that you need and if you buy it from Amazon it is at a great price.  Fish stores charge over $30 for this.If the thought of putting drops of chemicals in tubes is scary you have nothing to be worried about.  The instructions are pretty clear and if you mess up a test what have you wasted maybe 5 drops of a bottle full of thousands of drops?What I Like:Ease of useThe color test card seems water proofThe kit holds everything tight.What I don't like:For the nitrate test you have to shake for 1 minute.  The test tube lid always seems to leak during this.  Fixed by wrapping in a paper towel but annoying.What Needs Improvement:  This isn't a con but if someone from API is reading this here is how to improve your product.Make the test tubes seal better.  Nitrate test leaks.Make the top of the kit grab the bottom better.  Mine requires a rubber band to keep it from flying apart when I grab it from the top.Put the test instructions on a single card.  It's lame having to read through the book when all you are looking for is a bullet point list of steps.Perhaps include a 5 ml syringe.  I have a 10 ML syringe from some of my kids medicine but if there were a 5ML in the kit you can just suck up water and shoot into a tube without having the think about it.

I've used the test strips for years, but have been getting odd, yes - that's the right word, odd results from my big tank (125 gal.) lately.  Also, the fish die offs.  Something is weird in there!So, time to get another type of test kit to verify what the strips are saying.  Needless to say, stocking that thing with fish ain't cheap.  It seems the pH is out of whack on the high side.  Yup, who'd have thunk it.  Fish poo and corpses shouldn't raise pH that much, something else is raising it.  OK fine, time for new bio-wheel filters (staged introductions of course) and stuff.This test kit was easy to use, but not easier than the test strips.  On the other hand, the "high PH" test came in very handy for me.Incidentally, everything coming from a tap around here has pH around 8 and my home filter system drops it to a nice 7.0 value.  I do weekly 20 gal water changes and keep the fish biomass low for a tank this size.  Oddly, the hardness of the tank water is pretty good so the tank is obviously buffering rather nicely to keep that high pH value.  Maybe it's the substrate.  So, I've decided to buy fish that like a slightly higher pH range.  I'd been trying to keep a big school of neon tetras (which prefer lower pH) with occasional success.

I've had fish tanks for many years and began using this kit regularly since 1999. Part of properly caring for my fish involves regularly testing the tank water and this kit does it easily and quickly without much fuss and mess. To do a test, you take a small amount of water and put it into a test vial, add few drops of test liquid, wait five minutes then match the color of the test tube with the laminate card to tell you the results. Nothing can be easier.I highly recommend this kit to keep your freshwater fish safe. It does what it is supposed to do reliably and you can't expect anything more than that.
summary: Great test kit for great price.

reviewText: Works excellent when it comes to testing my water level. I highly recommend it! Quality is really good also, and it provides me with enough tests!
Delivers accurate readings and i trust this kit with my tanks. I recommend this highly to experienced and inexperienced aquarists! ☺

No problems, no bad readings, no false positives, no sticks to keep dry.The box doubles as a case to hold the bottles and vials and is reusable which is a nice perk.  I only wish it came with Phosphate indicator as well but it can't have everything I guess.  In terms of the normal everyday aquarium user that's a specialty item for planted tanks.

This kit is super easy to use. All of the bottles are labeled clearly and have a childproof lid. The kit includes a guide to help you correct dangerous levels. Clueless as to what to do for a high nitrate level? The guide included tells you how to correct the problem, keep in mind it may require adding a product to your tank that is not included in the kit. It also includes test tubes for testing water levels. The directions are easy to follow and can be stored in the kit if you keep the lid. It also has a long shelf life. I have had several of these kits and as long as I have fish I will continue to use this product.

Good product to test your aquarium water.  Bought this at Amazon, it's a lot cheaper than at Petco or Petsmart for similar products.  It comes with a lot tubes and you feel like a chemist at work, testing pH and all the other parameters.  My kids love it too.
summary: Good product to have if you have an aquarium.

reviewText: It has all of the stuff you need to make sure your water is in tip top and your fishies dont float to the....top? I'm not always great at rhyming stuff. Anyway, it's a handy kit to have!

I love this test kit!  Fast and easy - it's trivial to use if you aren't afraid of pipetting (e.g. high school chemistry).  Bottles are clearly marked with instructions for each type of test.  Color chart makes reading results easy. Only complaint - the test tubes that come with it are fairly small, and there's really no included way of getting tank water into the tubes (unless you like to just dip the tubes right into the tank, which I like to avoid).  I bought a set of glass test tubes with a rack and a graduated pipette with pipette pump to make things easier - now I can test pH (low and high range), ammonia, nitrite, nitrate in about 5 minutes flat.  And for the money you really do get hundreds of tests - I test weekly and after 6 months still have plenty of reagents left!
summary: Best way to assess tank water quality

reviewText: It may not be pinpoint accurate, but this gives very reliable and consistent results. Definitely a good kit to start with. If it had a test for hardness it would have everything i need.

This is a very detailed testing kit at a good price... haven't found a lower price in local stores. Provides all the info you need for a healthy aquarium. Included instruction book explains each test and result in detail and provides solutions to problem results. Easy to understand for a new aquarium owner. Kit includes 4 glass test tubes with plastic caps and all testing chemicals for Ph, high Ph, ammonia, nitrites and nitrates. Read all instructions before performing tests. Test tubes might be fragile to rough handling,  caps and tubes are interchangeable.  I have not had a problem with staining due to chemicals used, but would recommend washing them out soon after use with tap water, no soap. The only thing missing in this kit is an eyedropper, which makes it much easier to fill the test tubes. Do not get chemicals on your hands, can cause irritation...rinse quickly as possible to avoid. If you are unfamiliar with cycling an aquarium or the nitrogen cycle, please Google it because you will get a good explanation why this test kit is necessary for anyone who owns an aquarium.
summary: Everything you need for aquarium testing

reviewText: Got it used for like $3. Works great, doesn't scratch the glass, cleans up the tank walls very well. Cheers.
Not much more one can say.  Perhaps I should add that it seems durable.  John loves it, and he is the one using it!
This scraper is well made and does a good job of cleaning off algae on a glass tank.  Would recommend.

I used this scraper daily however I have a 125 gallon, plus several other tanks to clean. I now use this product:Mag Float 350 Magnet Cleaner GlassMag-Float magnetic cleaner. Mag-Float is effortless and makes glass crystal clear in minutes, plus your hands don't get wet.
summary: I found a much more effective and effortless method

reviewText: Product works well although it takes a bit more muscle than i anticipated, think this is partially due to the general stubbornness of algae in general.
And a happy/much healthier betta has returned.  This salt desolves quickly.  We used this to treat fin rot and it worked wonders.  This is one purchase I am truly thankful for.

I love API and all their products. Aquarium salt is an essential tool on hand for an aquarist to treat some basic fish diseases. (never use table salt!)Just remember to do your research before treating your animals with any kind of 'fix'. I see a few reviews on here that demonstrate the wrong way to use Aquarium salt. It's not necessarily recommended you add it with regular water changes  - freshwater fish obviously don't need salt unless they're being treated for something. And when doing salt baths it's best to use a quarantine tank rather than treating your main aquarium.For a betta, don't use this as a treatment for bloating - it will block your betta up worse. Use an Epsom salt bath for that.

reviewerName: Kimberly J. Karas "a New England mom"
reviewText: I have a number of five gallon freshwater tanks but of course they can use about a tablespoon of salt per tank.  Have used to cure fin rot.  My "technique" is to fill a five gallon jug with tap water.  Add one tablespoon of the salt and whatever else I need to put in there (stress coat, algae drops, etc.) let it stand overnight at least.  I siphon out a bit of water from each tank and replace with the water from the jug as needed.  This eliminates problem with having the salts dissolve and from my experience is just a good practice if you are dealing with tap water.In my case when used for fin rot I did daily water changes of about 1/3 the tank.  Having it pre-mixed keeps the consistency you need for each change and that definitely helps the fish.
summary: Great price, product goes a long way.

reviewText: I've heard it helps with stress so I place a small amount with every water change. I use less than the recommended dosage.
Great aquarium salt. I use it for my betta every water change, and he thrives in his aquarium. Highly recommended
i use this to make salt water for my hermit crabs. they love salt water and is necessary for them to have it to wet their gills.
Very helpful to have on-hand when you have a Betta-fish from a LFS and need to treat for Fin-rot or other issues.
This is good stuff.I use just a small amount of this stuff in my tanks.Highly recommended to keep fish disease down.
summary: Great for just a small amount of salt to be added

reviewText: If Python ever makes these things in a more durable plastic or metal, they'll get five stars.  The python water change system works excellent and is probably my most favorite maintenance item for my fish tanks.  Unfortunately, after awhile, the necks on these things always weaken and start to leak, then break.  This is my 4th one in the last 10 years.  That's a good track record, but I still like my stuff to last.
summary: Great product but breaks too easily.

reviewText: Product was shipped fast and I do not have any complaints. This fits my Python hose perfectly, since I broke the plastic piece that screws onto my sink faucet. Thank you!
Works great, perfect replacement. Just remember that this won't hook directly into your faucet and you will need the brass upgrade or original adapter to make the two go together.
summary: Works Great (But Doesn't Hook to Faucet without Adapter)

reviewText: the quality is not great. Mine broke after light usage. Other than that it works fine. I recommend checking out the Python Brass Adapter for Aquarium to work with a sink.

Aquarium filters remove many harmful chemicals, but nitrates do accumulate over time, and the way to remove them is by periodic partial water changes, usually something like 20% per week. The old way was to siphon water out into a bucket, which was dumped down the sink, commode, or in the yard. The bucket was then refilled and poured back into the tank.To change water in this manner was a little bit labor intensive on a small tank, and really time consuming on a larger tank.I stumbled on my pump in a Thrift store, where I found it on a shelf for $1. In all honesty, I'm not 100% sure mine is a Python brand, as there is no name on it. It may actually be a knock-off. Mine is made of blue plastic, not green, but otherwise looks identical to the item pictured.It operates by connecting it to a water supply with a fitting at the top in the photo. Water flows through from top to bottom, past a venturi located where the side fitting is, creating a suction which will draw water out of the aquarium through a hose. I purchased 50 feet of clear vinyl hose from my local aquarium store, attached it to this device, and put a suction strainer on the other end to avoid sucking small fish into the hose.In use, I drop the suction strainer into the tank, unroll the hose, and attach the pump to the water tap outside my front door. Opening the diverter on the pump outlet, then turning on the water tap starts a siphon which removes as much water from my tank as I desire (water tap can be closed once siphon starts so long as the pump is lower than the tank, siphon will continue).Closing the diverter on the pump outlet stops the siphon, and opening the water tap with the diverter closed refills the tank.I can't imagine any way to make water changes any easier. I've been using this device for years now, and it still works great.There are adapters available which allow the user to connect the pump to their kitchen or washroom sink instead of outside the house, if the aquarium is located closer to those water sources. There are also attachments which allow you to vacuum the gravel with the water siphoning out of the tank, if you feel the need to perform this task (I never vacuum because I don't use an undergravel filter, because I use EcoComplete substrate, and because I have fish which eat any food which falls to the bottom, so for me, the need simply isn't there).

I got my Python probably 20 years ago.  Pretty close to when they first came out, anyway.  The first pump cracked at the bottom, and I got a generic pump that later cracked at the top where it screws onto the faucet.  For the third one, I decided to go back to the name brand, hoping it would be more sturdy, and I was happily surprised to see that they've made the pump now with thicker plastic.  I can't see either the top or bottom part breaking under normal use now.I only took away 1 star for the fact that the design inherently tends to spray water out of the bottom under pressure (when filling the tank.)  I'm sure there must have been some design change they could have made to prevent that, like adding a rubber seal at the base.  Well, I just drape paper towels over it, like I have since the beginning.  (Other brands, btw, are all the same.)
summary: Newer design than the original is sturdier

reviewText: Python comes with an adapter just like this one so you don't need to buy it unless you need a replacement. It is a strong adapter that fits perfectly on my kitchen sink faucet.  The Python was the best invention since sliced bread and this adapter fits it perfectly.
summary: Strong adapter that comes with the new Pythons

reviewText: I can't get this to attach to all sinks.  So I'm not sure it's as standard as it claims to be.  Good sturdy product though.
summary: Good for some sinks, not all

reviewText: Finally, something that works.  No more plastic, no more trying to thread screwed up threads.  Very satisfied customer
It works as it should, but it is easily cross-threaded. If you're not careful, you can easily ruin the threads, then it's useless. But it works fine as long as you're careful with it.

This adapter screws into the faucet after you take the original adapter out--- mine was alerady removed since I use a water filter that screws onto it with a different adapter.And the python screws onto it without another part.I needed to get a replacement since the original part was missing so I was glad they sold one that is sturdy and long lasting.**** Note to any one buying one: the external thread was really sharp and I ended up cutting my thumb on it while trying to screw it onto the faucet the first time.  I work around this issues by using a papertowel/rag to put over the threads while screwing in or out and I haven't cut my thumb again since.  It helps give it the extrat grip on the adapter so you can screw it in better too.
summary: exactly what I needed--- sturdy adapter

reviewText: I lost my other adapter that took forever to find in a hardware store with the help of two employees. I wan't sure if this would work on our laundry sink since the threading is so small but it did! Great high quality adapter. It's too bad that the plastic Python Aquarium Replacement Pump that this attaches to was not made stronger as well.

If I had known that Python now ships with a brass adapter I wouldn't have ordered one - bowever it's always good to have a back up and I keep it for my tanks that are on a different level of the house.Python has been around for just about as long as I've been keeping fish which is over 35 years. I haven't used one in decades but decided to get a new one and check out the improvments. Not much has changed but the brass adapter is a major step up from the old plastic one. Those wouldn't last very long, the threads would strip away entriley after a few uses an the seal was never complete enough to stop water from spraying everyplace - but it STILL beat carrying around those buckets!This adpater is pretty universal and should fit most any faucet. Theres amale and female side, if you have a diffuser or water saver on your faucet simply remove it and pop this one in and you're good to go.
summary: Great Brass Adapter Better Than Plastic

reviewText: This  brass adapter is a must own by python gravel cleaner owners.It replaces the original version and this one screws into the faucet so effortlessly and that alone is worth the price of the adaptor.
summary: A must have for python gravel cleaner owners

reviewText: Work great connecting to my sink. The siphon that was given to me didn't come with this. I believe new ones do..

If you have anything over a ten gallon aquarium or have multiple aquariums this is for you! Used to take me 3-4 hours to drain, clean and refill my three aquariums. Many buckets of water hauled in the process. Just did a water change and cleaning in all three aquariums, two ten gallons and one fifty five gallon, took less than an hour to drain and refill them all. Best thing i ever bought!!

The faucet adapter this comes with is not universal and from what I've read, neither is the universal adapter they sell. Luckily the adapter fit the faucet that was further away than the one I had intended to use. My solution was to go to the hardware store and replace the short tube with a longer one.I didn't realize I was using it incorrectly the first few times. basically you press the big tube against the bottom slightly at an angle and move it around for the best results. it seems like it wastes a lot of water and an electric water pump would probably be more efficient but this allows you to safely clean the waste out of the gravel and do partial water changes with your fish in the tank.
summary: Does what it should. Faucet adapter not universal.

reviewText: If I could give this 10 stars, I would. My 1-2 hour water changes have been cut down to 20 minutes (3 tanks) using this. I cannot tell you how AWESOME this is. I wish I would have purchased this years ago. Easy to hook up to the faucet, easy to use and even my fry and baby snails aren't sucked up. It deep cleans gravel within seconds. Get one!!
summary: It really needs 10 stars. Well worth the price and cuts water changes way down and saves you TIME and $$ on water bill.

reviewText: I think the concept is great and I loved it..at first.  It's only been 9 months and there is little to no suction anymore.  I've checked and tightened everything but no go.  I'm very frustrated with it now and use a siphon vacuum instead but still use the python to replace the water.  Again, it started great but doesn't suck literally lol!

Since my faucets will not connect to any hose, I use this and run the hose out the door and use the water hose to drain and then fill my tank. It's a 70 gallon tank and this works great. You can stir up the gravel and get under it and get a lot of junk out!
summary: So much easier to change water with

reviewText: Used it once so far, but it was awesome!  Directions very clear and easy to follow.  Worked exactly as stated, and the hose was so long that when I had trouble unscrewing the screen from my bathroom faucet, it stretched all the way to the kitchen to use that one!  Love.

This is a great product.  It does a super job making heavy buckets and spills a thing of the past.  Had no problem hooking it up to my bathroom sink and the operation from the tank to the sink and back, was effective and easy.  My main concern was putting untreated water from my sink into the aquarium as I refilled it.  I added my de-chlorination solution into the tank as I refilled.  My fish were no worse for the experience and should benefit from regular wter changes now that it will be so easy.  If you have a 50 gal tank or greater, you really need one of these.
summary: I should have done this sooner.

reviewText: I've had my 16-GallonbiOrb Mega(it has a pretty small opening) for 7 weeks now and have attempted to change water 3 times before today:#1 - could not figure out exactly how thebiOrb Cleaner Pumpworked so I manually pumped out 5 gallons of water (in increments of 1-gallon milk jugs), followed by manually filling it back in 1-gallon increments (different clean glass jug)...as expected, I had some minor spillage, borderline hand cramping, and alot of wasted time walking back and forth from the tank to my kitchen sink.#2 - started to do the same again but began pumping faster after the first 2 gallons because I was getting impatient...well what do you know, that created a siphon effect! definitely saved time compared to my first try but again manually refilled the tank.#3 - got a strong start and instantly started the siphoning this time. unfortunately, I created a much stronger vacuum this time and the 1-gallon jug filled up too fast for me to stop it in time...massive spillage! all around the tank, my jeans, nearby couch, carpet, etc. this third water change took the longest of all because of all the cleanup I had to do and convinced me to look for something better.Today, my first use of THE Python No Spill Clean and Fill - this 25' device looks a little bit intimidating at first with all the different connectors and whatnot. after thoroughly reading the instructions twice, I got it set up quickly and was ready to go. I turned it on the 'Drain' setting and slowly lowered the Python into the tank. It didn't look like it was doing anything for a moment until I noticed pieces of fish poo getting sucked up into the gravel tube in a slow motion speed that was much like watching something get abducted into an alien spaceship. I must admit, there is almost nothing as rewarding as watching huge pieces of fish poop (some about half the size of my little guppies themselves, looking like dark grey dryer lint) get extracted out of a small tank. I had to make myself stop before I got rid of too much water but I'm already looking forward to the next water change! ..I even felt a little jealous when I read about other reviewers and their huge 55 gallon tanks.
summary: I wish I had more tanks to clean!

reviewText: I bought this after looking and reading reviews and I am glad I did. This is so easy to use anyone can clean a tank with this maintence system. What used to take me over 30 minutes to clan my tank took me less than 20 mintues with cleaning and refilling the tank. No more buckets and fuss. Would suggest to anyone looking for an easy way to clan aquariums.

I have been using this python system for 7 years now. I have had it since I got my first aquarium & I have never had to replace any of the parts, it's still in great condition. I did a lot of research on different types of hoses/siphons & this one was the best. You hook it up to your faucet & there is a switch that allows the siphon to either suck up all the water/dirt out of the tank & gravel or it can add water back in the tank. I usually vacuum the gravel/take out water, add water conditioner (I use stress coat) then add fresh water (that is the same temperature as the old water) back to the tank with the hose.
